title: Data Analyst
description: <strong>What you will be doing:</strong><p><br></p>As a Data Analyst, you will work in a client facing role to improve and scale data analysis and processing capabilities. Your work will enable the insights provided to hospitals through Lumere’s software solutions.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Systematically connect disparate data sets</li><li>Develop and monitor metrics related to customer data and Lumere data sets</li><li>Take initiative to generate and test algorithms for insights driven from data</li><li>Collaborate with ETL engineering teams to automate processes for consistent and efficient analysis</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors in Mathematics, Statistics, Engineering, Economics or similar</li><li>1+ years professional background in mathematics, statistics, engineering, and/or informatics</li><li>High degree of competence and comfort using MS Excel and basic familiarity with SQL is preferred</li><li>Familiarity with data science tools, like python or R, is a plus</li><li>Experience working with large data sets </li><li>Familiarity with healthcare data a plus</li><li>Excellent communication and organizational skills</li><li>Detail-oriented and thorough</li><li>A demonstrated track record of accomplishing goals, meeting deadlines, and holding yourself and others to a high standard</li><li>Excellent written and oral communication skills with a proven ability to present solutions with both technical and non-technical arguments</li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR<p><br></p>ZvQbyNt8CW

title: Data Analyst
description: Outstanding opportunity with a fast growing AI technology software company. Working remote for a DC area based company.<p><br></p>We have an immediate need for a talented individual with a computer science or information technology related degree with a focus on database administration or data analysis to join our clients fast growing team. The Data Analyst/DBA will service clients by providing structured and non-structured data analysis, custom scripting using various programming platforms, database creation, searching, and modification; and custom load file creation. In addition, the data analyst/DBA will provide data modeling and optimization; make recommendations related to performance and efficiency of data storage including more effective use of indexes or other DBMS specific features; assume responsibility for administration of existing enterprise databases; make recommendation for standards and best practices for SQL; and interact with and write complex SQL queries.<p><br></p>Requirements for this role;<p><br></p><ul><li>SQL Certification and/or 1+ year of database administration considered a strong plus.</li><li>Experience with parsing and scripting languages such as SQL, Perl, VBscript, etc.</li><li>Knowledge interacting with .NET, C#, Java, or other programming languages.</li><li>Extensive experience with Microsoft Windows Operating Systems &amp; general networking concepts as well as virtual technologies.</li><li>Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or related IT Field.</li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR<p><br></p>4584XUP0T8

title: (Chicago) Entry Level Business Intelligence Consultant/Analyst
description: Passionate about making a difference in the world of cancer genomics?<p><br></p>With the advent of genomic sequencing, we can finally decode and process our genetic makeup. We now have more data than ever before, but providers don't have the infrastructure or expertise to make sense of this data. We are on a mission to connect an entire ecosystem to redefine how genomic data is used in clinical settings.<p><br></p>We are looking for a Jr. Clinical Trials Data Analyst who will work with our clinical and computational biology team on reports for clinical and research use.<p><br></p>Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Works collaboratively within cross-functional teams at Tempus (including but not limited to scientists, pathologists, product development) to create customized clinical reports.</li><li>Analyze patient clinical records and molecular testing results to identify potential clinical trials.</li><li>Perform critical quality control functions in clinical report workflow.</li><li>Support ongoing and future projects within the team.</li></ul><p><br></p>Required Experience and Skills:<p><br></p><ul><li>Minimum of a BS or MS degree in Genetics, Molecular Genetics, Cancer Biology or Biological Sciences.</li><li>0-2 years working experience.</li><li>Oncology and medical terminology knowledge are strongly preferred.</li><li>Ability to learn new skills quickly and adapt to new processes smoothly. </li><li>Detail-oriented with strong critical-thinking skills.</li><li>Excellent communication skills with the ability to work both independently and in a group setting.</li><li>Excitement and drive to make a difference in a fast-paced energetic work environment!</li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR<p><br></p>9psCUWWt2S

title: Data Analyst (Healthcare)
description: <strong><u>Job Description</u></strong><p><br></p>LaSalle Network is partnering with a top investment management firm in Chicago seeking an experienced <strong>AWS Data Engineer</strong> to join their team.<p><br></p>As an <strong>AWS Data Engineer</strong>, you will play a crucial role in designing, implementing and maintaining data solutions on the AWS platform. Your primary responsibility will be to develop and optimize data pipelines, ensuring efficient data ingestion, storage and processing for our organization. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, design scalable data architectures and support the development of analytics and data-driven applications. If you are passionate about leveraging AWS technologies to drive data-driven insights and have a strong background in data engineering, this role is perfect for you.<p><br></p><strong><u>Data Engineer Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Design, develop and deploy scalable and robust data pipelines on AWS using services such as AWS Glue, AWS Lambda, Amazon S3, Amazon Redshift, Amazon Athena and Amazon EMR </li><li> Build and maintain data models, schema definitions and data transformation processes to support analytical and reporting needs </li><li> Optimize data ingestion and ETL processes to ensure high data quality, reliability and performance </li><li> Collaborate with data scientists, analysts and software engineers to understand their requirements and translate them into scalable data solutions </li><li> Work closely with infrastructure teams to ensure the availability, scalability and security of data infrastructure on AWS </li><li> Monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines, identifying and resolving performance issues, data quality problems and system failures </li><li> Implement data governance and security best practices to ensure compliance with regulations and company policies </li><li> Stay up to date with the latest AWS technologies and industry trends, proactively identifying opportunities to leverage new tools and services </li><li> Participate in code reviews, provide constructive feedback and mentor junior team members </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Data Engineer Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's or master’s degree in computer science, engineering or a related field </li><li> Strong experience in building data solutions on AWS, including hands-on experience with AWS data services such as Glue, S3, Redshift, Athena, EMR, Lambda, etc. </li><li> Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java or Scala for data processing and automation </li><li> Solid understanding of data modeling concepts, data warehousing, and ETL/ELT processes </li><li> Experience with data integration and ingestion techniques, including streaming data processing using tools like Apache Kafka or Amazon Kinesis </li><li> Familiarity with SQL and NoSQL databases, data lakes and big data technologies </li><li> Knowledge of data governance, data security, and compliance best practices on AWS </li><li> Strong problem-solving and analytical skills with the ability to work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment </li><li> Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders </li><li> AWS certifications, such as AWS Certified Big Data - Specialty or AWS Certified Data Analytics - Specialty, are a plus </li></ul><p><br></p>Join our client’s team as an <strong>AWS Data Engineer</strong> and contribute to the development of scalable and robust data solutions on the AWS platform.<p><br></p>Thank you,<p><br></p>Kelsey Gonzalez<p><br></p>Team Lead<p><br></p>LaSalle Network<p><br></p>LaSalle Network is an Equal Opportunity Employer m/f/d/v.<p><br></p>LaSalle Network is the leading provider of direct hire and temporary staffing services. For over two decades, LaSalle has helped organizations hire faster and connect top talent with opportunities, from entry-level positions to the C-suite. With units specializing in Accounting and Finance, Administrative, Marketing, Technology, Supply chain, Healthcare Revenue Cycle, Call Center, Human Resources and Executive Search. LaSalle offers staffing and recruiting solutions to companies of all sizes and across all industries. LaSalle Network is the premier staffing and recruiting firm, earning over 100 culture, revenue and industry-based awards from major publications and having its company experts regularly contribute insights on retention strategies, hiring trends and hiring challenges, and more to national news outlets.<p><br></p>

title: AWS Data Engineer
description: <strong>About The Team<br><br></strong>The ESG Portfolio and Fund Methodologies team is a new area of expertise within the ESG Methodology &amp; Product Architecture Team at Morningstar Sustainalytics, having been previously based under Morningstar’s Managed Investment Data. The team is dedicated to developing and enhancing ESG methodologies for managed investment (fund) universes and custom client portfolios for both Sustainalytics and Morningstar products. They work across various peer groups within the broader ESG Methodology &amp; Product Architecture Team to determine how methodologies should be reflected at the portfolio level, such as the Morningstar Sustainability (“Globe”) Ratings, while also developing fund-specific methodologies, such as Sustainable Attributes. Team members cover a wide range of content, such as Climate, Impact, and ESG Risk, while also identifying opportunities for cohesiveness across different methodologies.<br><br><strong>About The Role<br><br></strong>This is an exciting opportunity to own methodology development and enhancement for ESG Portfolio and Fund data. You will be working across Sustainalytics and Morningstar methodology, commercial, and technical stakeholders to develop and present methodology concepts, translate these into detailed specifications for technical and data operations teams, as well as publish methodology documentation for our clients. The role is preferred to be based in Chicago, Toronto, or Amsterdam, but applicants in Frankfurt will also be considered. A long-term remote work arrangement will not be considered for this role.<br><br><strong>Key Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li>Lead and collaborate new methodology development for portfolios and managed investments (funds) by leveraging a subject matter background of managed investment and portfolio data to translate issuer level methodology into the fund/portfolio level, as well as identifying and developing fund specific methodologies.</li><li>Presenting on methodology concepts to methodology managers and other stakeholders.</li><li>Translating a methodology concept into detailed methodology specification documents in Excel and/or Python for technical teams to understand and implement. This includes the scope and definition of data sets, methodology logic/requirements, data modelling, and examples of calculation logic or data collection processes.</li><li>Testing of internal and external validity of methodology including change/impact analyses.</li><li>Authorship of external facing methodology papers.</li><li>Supporting product managers as well as client support teams for escalations of methodology related questions, including interfacing with clients as a subject matter expert.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Minimum of a bachelor’s degree, with excellent academic credentials.</li><li>Minimum of three years of experience in financial services or investing.</li><li>Minimum of three years of research and/or product development experience.</li><li>Demonstrated ability to utilize data to draw insights and propose solutions.</li><li>Demonstrated ability to communicate and collaborate across global stakeholders.</li><li>A strong quantitative skillset, with a background in quantitative analysis, programming, statistics, econometrics, modelling, and/or big data processing considered an asset. Applicants should have a strong knowledge of MS Excel, and basic to intermediate knowledge of working with large data sets using Python, SQL/ AWS, or other basic programming skills as well as a willingness to grow that skill.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Nice to Have<br></strong><ul><li>Subject matter knowledge or experience with Morningstar managed investment/fund data operations and methodology is considered a strong asset.</li><li>Experience with ESG data is considered an asset, but not required. We believe the right candidate will be able to learn the subject matter and apply their experience to ESG concepts.</li><li>Experience utilizing LEAN, Six Sigma, or Agile methodologies in a project management or data operations setting is considered an asset.<br><br></li></ul><strong>About Us<br><br></strong>Sustainalytics is a Morningstar company dedicated to responsible investment with over 25 years' experience in ESG research and ratings. With an extensive client base across asset managers, asset owners and investment banks, our mission is to provide the insights required for investors and companies to make more informed decisions that lead to a more just and sustainable global economy.<br><br>As Morningstar’s ESG center of excellence we are responsible for driving both the commercial success and innovation of its ESG products as well as its overall ESG strategy.<br><br>For more information, visit www.sustainalytics.com<br><br>Morningstar’s hybrid work environment gives you the opportunity to work remotely and collaborate in-person each week. While some positions are available as fully remote, we’ve found that we’re at our best when we’re purposely together on a regular basis, typically three days each week. A range of other benefits are also available to enhance flexibility as needs change. No matter where you are, you’ll have tools and resources to engage meaningfully with your global colleagues.

While some positions are available as fully remote, we’ve found that we’re at our best when we’re purposely together on a regular basis, typically three days each week. A range of other benefits are also available to enhance flexibility as needs change. No matter where you are, you’ll have tools and resources to engage meaningfully with your global colleagues.

A long-term remote work arrangement will not be considered for this role.<p><br></p><strong><u>Key Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Lead and collaborate new methodology development for portfolios and managed investments (funds) by leveraging a subject matter background of managed investment and portfolio data to translate issuer level methodology into the fund/portfolio level, as well as identifying and developing fund specific methodologies.</li><li>Presenting on methodology concepts to methodology managers and other stakeholders.</li><li>Translating a methodology concept into detailed methodology specification documents in Excel and/or Python for technical teams to understand and implement. This includes the scope and definition of data sets, methodology logic/requirements, data modelling, and examples of calculation logic or data collection processes.</li><li>Testing of internal and external validity of methodology including change/impact analyses.</li><li>Authorship of external facing methodology papers.</li><li>Supporting product managers as well as client support teams for escalations of methodology related questions, including interfacing with clients as a subject matter expert.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Minimum of a bachelor’s degree, with excellent academic credentials.</li><li>Minimum of three years of experience in financial services or investing.</li><li>Minimum of three years of research and/or product development experience.</li><li>Demonstrated ability to utilize data to draw insights and propose solutions.</li><li>Demonstrated ability to communicate and collaborate across global stakeholders.</li><li>A strong quantitative skillset, with a background in quantitative analysis, programming, statistics, econometrics, modelling, and/or big data processing considered an asset. Applicants should have a strong knowledge of MS Excel, and basic to intermediate knowledge of working with large data sets using Python, SQL/ AWS, or other basic programming skills as well as a willingness to grow that skill.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Nice to Have</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Subject matter knowledge or experience with Morningstar managed investment/fund data operations and methodology is considered a strong asset.</li><li>Experience with ESG data is considered an asset, but not required. We believe the right candidate will be able to learn the subject matter and apply their experience to ESG concepts.</li><li>Experience utilizing LEAN, Six Sigma, or Agile methodologies in a project management or data operations setting is considered an asset.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Us</u></strong><p><br></p>Sustainalytics is a Morningstar company dedicated to responsible investment with over 25 years' experience in ESG research and ratings. With an extensive client base across asset managers, asset owners and investment banks, our mission is to provide the insights required for investors and companies to make more informed decisions that lead to a more just and sustainable global economy.<p><br></p>As Morningstar’s ESG center of excellence we are responsible for driving both the commercial success and innovation of its ESG products as well as its overall ESG strategy.<p><br></p>For more information, visit www.sustainalytics.com<p><br></p>Morningstar’s hybrid work environment gives you the opportunity to work remotely and collaborate in-person each week. While some positions are available as fully remote, we’ve found that we’re at our best when we’re purposely together on a regular basis, typically three days each week. A range of other benefits are also available to enhance flexibility as needs change. No matter where you are, you’ll have tools and resources to engage meaningfully with your global colleagues.
description_json: <strong><u>About The Team</u></strong><p><br></p>The ESG Portfolio and Fund Methodologies team is a new area of expertise within the ESG Methodology &amp; Product Architecture Team at Morningstar Sustainalytics, having been previously based under Morningstar’s Managed Investment Data. The team is dedicated to developing and enhancing ESG methodologies for managed investment (fund) universes and custom client portfolios for both Sustainalytics and Morningstar products. They work across various peer groups within the broader ESG Methodology &amp; Product Architecture Team to determine how methodologies should be reflected at the portfolio level, such as the Morningstar Sustainability (“Globe”) Ratings, while also developing fund-specific methodologies, such as Sustainable Attributes. Team members cover a wide range of content, such as Climate, Impact, and ESG Risk, while also identifying opportunities for cohesiveness across different methodologies.<p><br></p><strong><u>About The Role</u></strong><p><br></p>This is an exciting opportunity to own methodology development and enhancement for ESG Portfolio and Fund data. You will be working across Sustainalytics and Morningstar methodology, commercial, and technical stakeholders to develop and present methodology concepts, translate these into detailed specifications for technical and data operations teams, as well as publish methodology documentation for our clients. The role is preferred to be based in Chicago, Toronto, or Amsterdam, but applicants in Frankfurt will also be considered. A long-term remote work arrangement will not be considered for this role.<p><br></p><strong><u>Key Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Lead and collaborate new methodology development for portfolios and managed investments (funds) by leveraging a subject matter background of managed investment and portfolio data to translate issuer level methodology into the fund/portfolio level, as well as identifying and developing fund specific methodologies.</li><li>Presenting on methodology concepts to methodology managers and other stakeholders.</li><li>Translating a methodology concept into detailed methodology specification documents in Excel and/or Python for technical teams to understand and implement. This includes the scope and definition of data sets, methodology logic/requirements, data modelling, and examples of calculation logic or data collection processes.</li><li>Testing of internal and external validity of methodology including change/impact analyses.</li><li>Authorship of external facing methodology papers.</li><li>Supporting product managers as well as client support teams for escalations of methodology related questions, including interfacing with clients as a subject matter expert.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Minimum of a bachelor’s degree, with excellent academic credentials.</li><li>Minimum of three years of experience in financial services or investing.</li><li>Minimum of three years of research and/or product development experience.</li><li>Demonstrated ability to utilize data to draw insights and propose solutions.</li><li>Demonstrated ability to communicate and collaborate across global stakeholders.</li><li>A strong quantitative skillset, with a background in quantitative analysis, programming, statistics, econometrics, modelling, and/or big data processing considered an asset. Applicants should have a strong knowledge of MS Excel, and basic to intermediate knowledge of working with large data sets using Python, SQL/ AWS, or other basic programming skills as well as a willingness to grow that skill.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Nice to Have</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Subject matter knowledge or experience with Morningstar managed investment/fund data operations and methodology is considered a strong asset.</li><li>Experience with ESG data is considered an asset, but not required. We believe the right candidate will be able to learn the subject matter and apply their experience to ESG concepts.</li><li>Experience utilizing LEAN, Six Sigma, or Agile methodologies in a project management or data operations setting is considered an asset.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Us</u></strong><p><br></p>Sustainalytics is a Morningstar company dedicated to responsible investment with over 25 years' experience in ESG research and ratings. With an extensive client base across asset managers, asset owners and investment banks, our mission is to provide the insights required for investors and companies to make more informed decisions that lead to a more just and sustainable global economy.<p><br></p>As Morningstar’s ESG center of excellence we are responsible for driving both the commercial success and innovation of its ESG products as well as its overall ESG strategy.<p><br></p>For more information, visit www.sustainalytics.com<p><br></p>Morningstar’s hybrid work environment gives you the opportunity to work remotely and collaborate in-person each week. While some positions are available as fully remote, we’ve found that we’re at our best when we’re purposely together on a regular basis, typically three days each week. A range of other benefits are also available to enhance flexibility as needs change. No matter where you are, you’ll have tools and resources to engage meaningfully with your global colleagues.

title: Data Content Researcher, ESG Portfolio and Fund Methodology
description: NO SPONSORSHIP<p><br></p>Associate Principal, Data Governance Analyst<p><br></p>SALARY: $145k flex plus 15%<p><br></p>LOCATION: CHICAGO, IL hybrid 3 days in office / 2 days remote<p><br></p>Looking for a candidate with 7 years’ experience working with IBM information server suite 11.x . Proficient with SQL ETL tools data stage. <strong>DAMA certification, </strong> Java data governance Meta data management data quality analysis data quality data profiling and data lineage<p><br></p>Must have a holistic perspective on the entire data governance process from both a business and technical perspective. Act as a liaison and translation layer between business and technical teams and operates at system- and detailed technical level for analysis purposes. Work on new project requirements from initial requirements through full development life cycle and implementation.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Lead Data Domain and Data Steward Workgroup meetings</li><li>Work closely with Data Domain Owners and SME’s to identify CDE’s (Critical Data Elements) and define data elements for the Business Glossary</li><li>Collaborate with Data Domain Owners to identify and define appropriate business rules</li><li>Collaborate with the Metadata specialist to identify data sources</li><li>Collaborate with data modelers to review definitions of business terms vs. technical terms</li><li>Utilize data profiling and data quality tools to expose and determine causes of data quality issues when defining business rules</li><li>Participate in metadata management utilizing IBM Metadata Asset Manager and the IBM Information Governance Catalog to build out the business glossary</li><li>Implement data governance controls, procedures, and standards</li><li>Develop and deliver presentations for department and senior leadership</li><li>Perform other duties as assigned</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications &amp; Experience</strong><p><br></p><strong>Technical Skills &amp; Background</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>7+ years of experience with IBM Information Server Suite 11.x</li><li>Proficient with SQL</li><li>Proficient with Microsoft Office desktop tools (Word, Excel, etc.)</li><li>Database experience a plus (i.e. Oracle, SQL Server, DB2)</li><li>Java</li><li>ETL tools (DataStage etc.)</li><li>Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related discipline</li><li>[Required] 7+ years of experience in data governance disciplines: metadata management; data quality analysis; data quality remediation; data profiling and data lineage</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Certifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>DAMA certification preferred</li></ul>

title: Data Governance Analyst
description: Dose is a full-service media company that uses data to inform, inspire and create meaningful marketing insights and creative strategies for digital and brands. We have some of the best talent in the industry, and we’re looking to add to it!<p><br></p>We're looking for a Junior Campaign Analyst to join our Execution team. The Execution team is responsible for interacting with existing and potential clients to deliver smart data-backed campaigns. The Junior Campaign Analyst position is critical to ensuring each campaign achieves optimal success in terms of social reach, statistical validity, actionable insights and client KPIs.<p><br></p><strong>The Gig:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Analyzing data from a marketing perspective: We’re all about discovering those “a-ha” moments for brands. Our true deliverable is the strong qualitative conclusions and recommendations we provide a brand. These insights inform effective marketing strategies, product positioning and more. We’re looking for someone who can confidently and creatively make strong data-backed conclusions.</li><li>Asking the right questions and strategizing alongside a brand's needs: Our testing strategy answers a brand’s most important marketing and product questions by talking to their customers where they live—on social. We’re looking for someone who isn’t afraid to problem-solve, strategize and challenge assumptions to make sure we’re running the most effective test possible.</li><li>Finding new innovative ways to present our insights: Our reports arm brands with smart, data-backed recommendations to inform future campaigns. They’re less about providing raw numbers, and all about weaving together a strong, cohesive story. We’re looking for someone who can bring new ways to visualize our data and someone who can craft a story out of data sets and trends.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>The Day-to-Day:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Brainstorm with the team to scope smart campaign strategies</li><li>Post and monitor social campaigns across platforms like Facebook, Instagram and Programmatic (primarily through Facebook Ads Manager)</li><li>Analyze and improve campaigns based on key metrics</li><li>Identify new opportunities and strategies to deliver the best results</li><li>Build client reports that inform and meet client and team standards</li><li>Complete comprehensive reports on both weekly progress and special campaigns</li><li>Develop new strategies and products based on client needs</li><li>Develop relationships with clients, pitching new work and retaining existing customers</li><li>Identify additional opportunities to expand existing and future campaigns</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Good statistical, math and analytical skills</li><li>Strong storytelling skills, with an eye for creating actionable narratives from data</li><li>Strong attention to detail</li><li>Ability to work collaboratively and under tight deadlines</li><li>Excellent knowledge of how Facebook works and experience with Facebook Ad Manager preferred</li><li>Passion for social media</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Why work at Dose?</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Well-funded, fast-growing creative company</li><li>Endless supply of in-office snacks and drinks</li><li>$100/month towards wellness activities</li><li>Commitment to continuous learning</li><li>Progressive work culture</li><li>Surround yourself with some of the smartest people in the industry</li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR<p><br></p>UNj3m7I34x

title: Junior Campaign Analyst
description: Dice is the leading career destination for tech experts at every stage of their careers. Our client, Request Technology, LLC, is seeking the following. Apply via Dice today!<p><br></p>***Position is bonus eligible***<p><br></p>Prestigious Financial Company is currently seeking a Technical Data Governance Analyst. Candidate will gather business and technical requirements and technical implementation to support Data Governance, Data Quality Measurement, Exception Management, Remediation, Analytics, and other essential Data Governance functions<p><br></p><strong>Primary Duties and Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Responsible for gathering technical requirements to capture metadata and lineage working with Business and Technical SMEs.</li><li>Design, Build and Execute Data Quality Rules over the critical data elements (CDEs) identified according to the business needs to ensure clean and healthy data.</li><li>Ability to develop and implement Data Quality Solutions for multiple data sources across On Prem and Cloud environments including but not limited to Databases, Flat Files, JSON, APIs, Kafka etc.</li><li>Manage Data Quality Exceptions and help the team to find out the root cause analysis.</li><li>Hands on experience working on data quality and data governance technology and tools.</li><li>Ability to communicate effectively with Business and Technical SMEs, Architects, Analysts, Developers and other IT and business teams.</li><li>Develop Metadata and Data Lineage Solutions for multiple data sources across On Prem and Cloud environments including but not limited to Databases, Flat Files, JSON, APIs, Kafka, ETL/BI Tools etc.</li><li>Create, develop, configure and execute end to end business and technical data lineage across disparate sources in accordance with the Data Governance Standards, Policies and Procedures.</li><li>Experience working on metadata management, administration, support and ingest data management assets using extension mappings, custom data assets, metadata bridges, connectors, third party metadata bridges ensuring data lineage/ source to target data mapping.</li><li>Perform requirements gathering, Data Analysis, Data Profiling to enable all the essential functions of the Data Governance.</li><li>Design and implement Data Quality Dashboards for monitoring and reporting.</li><li>Experience creating, developing and managing DG workflows using BPM processes.</li><li>Perform other duties as assigned.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor or Master degree in data analytics, computer science or related field.</li><li>7+ years of experience in data governance disciplines: data profiling, data quality measurement, exception management, remediation, metadata management and business intelligence</li><li>Ability to work independently and as part of a team to successfully execute projects.</li><li>Ability to multitask and meet aggressive deadlines efficiently and effectively.</li><li>Experience with Data Governance tools such as IBM InfoSphere Information Server Suite, Collibra or Informatica</li><li>Experience with Business Intelligence/ Reporting tools such as Tableau / Cognos.</li><li>Proficient with SQL.</li><li>Proficient with Microsoft Office desktop tools (Word, Excel, etc.)</li><li>Experience with Databases (i.e. Oracle, SQL Server, DB2, Amazon Redshift).</li><li>Strong data analysis capabilities.</li><li>Previous experience in designing and building data capabilities like data quality, metadata, data catalogues and data dictionary.</li><li>Demonstrated strong communication and presentation skills.</li><li>Capital market or banking domain experience is preferred.</li><li>Prior development / coding experience is preferred.</li><li>Structured Query Language (SQL)</li><li>Data Governance Tools example, Informatica, IBM ISEE, Collibra etc</li><li>Bachelor or Master degree in data analytics, computer science or related field.</li></ul>

description: <p><strong>About Us:</strong></p><p>Ubiquiti Inc. (UI) is focused on democratizing network technology on a global scale - aggregate shipments of over 108 million devices play a key role in creating networking infrastructure in over 200 countries and territories around the world. Our professional networking products are powered by our UNMS and UniFi software platforms to provide high-capacity distributed Internet access and unified information technology management, respectively.</p><p><br></p><p>Customers know UI products for their excellent user experience, high performance, and exceptional value. We have teams across the world collaborating virtually.</p><p><br></p><p>Join our team. Work on network system and application verification roles.</p><p><br></p><p><strong>Key qualifications</strong></p><ul><li>Strong comprehension of the elements that contribute to an optimal User Experience (UX)</li><li>Background in IT application management; proficiency with UniFi considered an advantage</li><li>Excellent communication abilities, encompassing both verbal and written</li><li>Skilled in various networking technologies, such as WiFi, TCP/IP, switching, and routing</li><li>Practical experience with Linux and shell scripting</li><li>Knowledge of Python programming is favored</li><li>Capacity and eagerness to adapt quickly in a dynamic, fast-paced environment</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>Description</strong></p><ul><li>Conduct verification of User Experience (UX), features, and performance for UniFi applications, including but not limited to Network (inclusive of WiFi), Protect, Talk, Access, as well as upcoming platforms</li><li>Design and implement test setups, and strategize and execute manual as well as semi-automated test scenarios</li><li>Precisely report findings, employing clear visuals and providing comprehensive details</li><li>Foster collaboration with development teams to address and rectify identified issues</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>Education and experience</strong></p><ul><li>Possess a bachelor's or master's degree in Information Technology, Network Management, Cyber Security, or a related discipline</li><li>Hold 1-2 years of relevant work experience, or be an imminent/recent graduate</li></ul><p><br></p><p><strong>Benefits</strong></p><ul><li>Work with top-notch technologies</li><li>Competitive compensation package</li><li>Fully paid, high coverage medical insurance including dental and vision</li><li>401k contribution from the company</li><li>Unlimited PTO (for reasonable requests)</li><li>Modern office with a great location</li><li>Company products for home lab setups</li><li>Flexible working hours and terms</li><li>Snacks and drinks in the office</li></ul>

title: System Verification Engineer
description: We are Gelber Group -- Passion for Trading. Powered by Technology.<p><br></p>For 40 years, we have set the bar as one of the industry's most innovative and enduring proprietary trading firms. We are headquartered in Chicago with offices and team members across the United States and Europe. Our success derives from a relentless pursuit of new trading ideas and careful attention to technology. Our culture of entrepreneurship, innovation and collaboration empowers each member of our team to have a meaningful impact from the day they join Gelber. We believe our talented staff are our greatest asset and we are committed to providing them the resources they need to succeed. With 16 distinct trading groups, we trade a little bit of everything here – with diverse styles and approaches across all major global marketplaces – and we are always looking to expand into new opportunities. Our flat organizational structure ensures a true meritocracy and attracts individuals with an edge to contribute to our consistent success.<p><br></p>As a Junior Technology Operations Engineer at Gelber, you will have a real opportunity to have a long-term career in Engineering at a successful trading firm. This position will work closely with not only other talented engineers on Technology Operations but with the rest of the technology team, trading, and Trade Support. This role is for someone who flourishes in a fast-paced environment, has a strong work ethic, clear communication, a never say die approach to problem solving, and has a strong interest in growing their technical skillset. This position will report directly into the Manager of Technology Operations who reports directly into the Chief Technology Officer.<p><br></p>This position will require in person presence in our Chicago office located in River West right next to the Merchandise Mart and convenient to public transportation. This position will be flexible for hybrid once fully onboarded.<p><br></p><em>What you'll do:</em><p><br></p><ul><li>Actively manage and implement strategic improvements to all processes enabling Gelber tech and trading team operations, including investigating production events in our environment and coordinating firm-wide incident management</li><li>Design and implement continuous updates to Gelber's operational processes in an effort to continually improve daily tech and trading efficiency</li><li>Automating and streamlining Gelber's applications, processes, and systems</li><li>Actively manage deployments for the firm into Gelber's production environment</li><li>Troubleshooting through complex problems</li><li>Work collaboratively with members of trading, development, enterprise technology, and IT operations to establish best practices and enable them to do their best work</li><li>Manage access and maintenance to a wide variety of third-party applications</li><li>Own services from conception to deployment</li></ul><p><br></p><em>What you'll need:</em><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Computer Information Systems, or a related field</li><li>0-3 years of work experience and a strong ability to learn</li><li>Experience working with Python</li><li>Understanding of C#, Java, or SQL is preferred, but not required</li><li>General understanding of Windows and Linux administration, familiarity with Linux shell or bash preferred</li><li>Database experience or QA experience preferred, but not required</li><li>Strong critical thinking skills and sense of urgency when it comes to support</li><li>Great communication skills, inquisitive nature, and formidable attention to detail</li><li>Relentless pursuit of answers</li><li>Must be able to be on call for after-hours support for 2 weeks at a time, with 6-8 weeks off</li></ul><p><br></p>B<em>enefits Highlights</em><p><br></p>Gelber offers a wide range of benefits to full-time employees in order to meet you and your covered dependents needs. Our comprehensive benefits offering includes:<p><br></p><ul><li>Traditional and Roth 401(k) retirement program with discretionary employer match</li><li>Comprehensive health benefits including medical coverage provided by Blue Cross and Blue Shield (PPO and HDHP/HSA) and dental coverage; generous employer cost-sharing</li><li>Tuition reimbursement for Undergraduate and Graduate courses</li><li>Flexible Spending Accounts for health care and dependent care; pre-tax commuter benefits for parking and transit expenses</li><li>Life insurance and long-term disability coverage</li><li>Health club membership with on-site facilities (and reciprocal memberships)</li><li>Generous vacation time (15-day accrual in first full calendar year of employment; prorated accrual in initial year), paid holidays, and paid maternity/paternity leave</li><li>Weekly catered lunches and monthly continental breakfasts</li><li>Social events including sponsored 5k races and annual holiday party</li><li>Enjoyable work environment including a game room (foosball, ping pong, Golden Tee)</li><li>Employee referral bonus program</li><li>Charitable giving and company matching opportunities</li><li>Casual, relaxed dress code</li></ul><p><br></p><em>If you are based in California, we encourage you to read the Gelber Privacy Notice for California Employees and Applicants, linked</em> <em>here</em><em>.</em>

title: Junior Technology Operations Engineer
description: <strong>SQL Developer with C#<br><br>Location: Chicago, IL(Hybrid)<br><br>Interview: Phone + Skype<br><br></strong><strong><u>Jd<br><br></u></strong>Tech stack is C#, SQL Server, SQL, SSIS, Angular (a plus), WebAPI, WCF, Web Services.<br><br>Involve in the phases of software Life Cycle Development.<br><br>Analyze, design, develop, implement and test applications.<br><br>Design and develop user interfaces of application modules.<br><br>Develop build scripts and deploy the application.<br><br>Participate in code integration and system testing. Create unit test cases and test the application.<br><br>Uses the Agile/ Scrum model as part of the daily and sprint work routine, updating, user stories, tasks and Defects statues in Rally and Participates in team huddles to update the code development, deployment, and test automation status of the application.<br><br>Participate in requirements discussion with business to provide inputs on feasibility of implementation based on application architecture.<br><br>Responsible for requirement gathering, development/ enhancement of application framework<br><br>Design databases, tables and Indexes.<br><br>Create many stored procedures with input and output parameters to be utilized by micro services.<br><br>Develop SQL Queries to fetch complex data from different tables in remote databases using joins, and database links.<br><br>Create Custom SSIS Packages using C# in Script task to handle issues related to excel and flat files and to send custom emails to users.<br><br>Implement data validation rules in SSIS Packages. Deployed individual packages created environmental variables and scheduled jobs. Created packages in SSIS with error handling.<br><br>Utilize business intelligence reports daily, hourly and on-demand basis by using the Data Gateways as necessary.<br><br>Design complex data intensive reports and visualizations utilizing various graph features such as gauge, funnel, line for better business analysis.<br><br>Aggregate Functions, Filter Functions, Time &amp; Date Functions and Logical Functions in Data Analysis Expressions (DAX) for various fact calculations and efficient data visualization.<br><br>Host and consume RESTful Web services using API .<br><br>Develop Micro services using RESTful services to provide all the CRUD capabilities.<br><br>Develop Restful Web Services for applications to allow external applications to access data and also to consume external services.<br><br>Test and debug program units in conjunction with other units and/or systems.<br><br>Test SQL databases and perform bug fixes.<br><br>Develop User Interface (UI) and Application Program Interface (API) automated tests that adhere to the coding standards by frequently analyzing the repository with Sonar Lint and SonarQube servers to determine the quality gate.<br><br>Triages application defects for all that impact test case automation execution and delivery, and work on the Critical Production Issues on Priority basis.<br><br>Configure fiddler for auto-generated documentation for all REST API calls.<br><br>Document web application test results for dynamic test elements, functional tests, and document object model (DOM)<br><br><strong><u>Navnish kumar<br><br></u></strong><u>IT Technical Recruiter<br><br></u><strong><u>Stellent IT </u></strong><strong>Phone<u>: </u></strong><strong>2014081575<br><br></strong><strong>Email: navnish@stellentit.com</strong>

title: SQL Developer with C#
description: Here at Syndigo, we're enabling our clients to deliver <em>better</em> eCommerce experiences. We've mastered the right data, right now. From creation to sale, that's the value our partners get from us - a holistic, truly differentiated end-to-end solution that closes the loop while increasing sales.<p><br></p>Basically, we're the accurate data behind how people feel when they shop online with confidence!<p><br></p>We cannot do all of this without our amazing people! Our employees make the magic happen here at Syndigo and we're growing rapidly! We're ready for you to collaborate with us to challenge the status quo!<p><br></p>Syndigo is a growing company with a growing infrastructure footprint. We have over 1,500 VMs across multiple virtualization platforms and a strong presence in Azure and AWS. We acquire multiple companies each year and take ownership of their infrastructure and applications. We are seeking a <strong>Systems Engineer</strong> within the Lisle, IL area with experience creating, managing, and monitoring networks across multiple locations.<p><br></p>The ideal candidate will have experience managing, creating, and maintaining storage, VMs and virtualization platforms for large software development organizations. Candidates must be highly skilled in systems / infrastructure engineering, have an intermediate understanding of networking protocols and systems administration, as well as possess knowledge and experience to build, operate, and maintain infrastructure from the ground up within a hosted data center or office location.<p><br></p><strong>How We’ll Be Winning Together Day To Day</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Virtualization – Manage, create, and maintain virtualization platforms.</li><li>Storage – Provision and manage both network and local storage devices.</li><li>Infrastructure Support – provide infrastructure support for ongoing software development initiatives.</li><li>Maintain Network/Infrastructure Components – Minimize outages by keeping up with hardware and software components through upgrades, patching, migrations, etc.</li><li>Systems Administration – assist with software rollouts, patching and other administration efforts as needed.</li><li>Project Management – assist with project management tasks on major infrastructure/ IT related initiatives including datacenter migrations and M&amp;A. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>WE SHOULD TALK IF THIS SOUNDS LIKE YOU</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Virtualization: Primarily VMware, secondarily Nutanix &amp; HyperV</li><li>Storage: Primarily SAN devices, (storage host appliances / fiber channel switches), secondarily hyperconverged infrastructure</li><li>Switching / Routing: Basic understanding of firewall and switch configs</li><li>OS: Primarily Windows Server, secondarily Linux</li><li>3-4 years of relevant experience</li></ul><p><br></p>This role is a hybrid remote / on-premises role. It is required that the candidate be within driving distance of our Lisle, IL datacenter. You will report to the IT Infrastructure Manager. The schedule for this role is normal business hours but should also expect to provide after-hours support for outages and other work that cannot take place during the day on rare occasions.<p><br></p><strong>Diversity, Equity &amp; Inclusion</strong><p><br></p>Authenticity fuels our work. In fact, it’s one of our Syndigo Values. To achieve the best version of our organization, we know it takes new ideas, new approaches, new perspectives and new ways of thinking. A purpose we are 100% committed to cultivating.<p><br></p>Diversity is woven into our fabric at Syndigo and it’s how we stay an industry leader, innovating technology solutions that equip our customers with everything they need to be successful!<p><br></p>All are welcome here and we invite you to join our team if you are ready to help us continue that growth!<p><br></p><strong>GDPR/CCPA</strong><p><br></p>Syndigo, to process applications, holds onto data for a "reasonable time" after applications are submitted. This data is stored for Syndigo's internal use by HR/Recruiting Staff only. Verified requests for data deletion and exports will be completed upon request.

This data is stored for Syndigo's internal use by HR/Recruiting Staff only. Verified requests for data deletion and exports will be completed upon request.

title: Systems Engineer - Lisle, IL Area
description: <strong>Position Overview</strong><p><br></p>The Junior Software Engineer position will assist with the development and implementation of software services for use in a service-oriented architecture.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Assist in the development of our software by writing and troubleshooting code; using C#.</li><li>Contribute to the design and architecture of the project(s).</li><li>Works cross functionally with the development and engineering teams.</li><li>Ability to manage multiple requests, multi-task and deliver requested work on time.</li><li>Embrace utilizing new approaches, ideas, and technology to solve challenging problems.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>BA/BS in Computer Science, IT, Engineering, Mathematics or related field.</li><li>0-3 years’ professional experience in a technical role.</li><li>The passion and drive to expand coding skills.</li><li>Demonstrated ability to relay complex technical information to both technical and non-technical audience.</li><li>Excellent problem solver.</li><li>Outstanding verbal and written communication skills to effectively collaborate with team.</li><li>Exposure to one of the following languages: Java, C, C#.</li><li>Solid foundational knowledge of SQL</li><li>Skills in PostgreSQL or MySQL a plus.</li><li>Understanding of software design/ architecture process.</li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR<p><br></p>ci8SPBh20a

title: Junior .Net Developer
description: <strong>You have the ability to introduce and engineer evolution across an organization. Your exceptional multitasking skills help you to prioritize and balance in accordance with an organization’s goals and timelines. Your expert analytical skills allow you to quickly examine performance, security and reliability of systems and networks, and identify and resolve any issues that may arise. You stay ahead of the curve and utilize various tools and methods to collect, process and interpret data. You use your interpersonal skills to communicate effectively with different stakeholders and can explain technical concepts and solutions in a clear and concise manner, and in creating robust documentation.</strong><p><br></p>If this sounds like you, please read on!<p><br></p>As the Infrastructure Engineer, you will be involved in creating end-to-end infrastructure solutions as part of a cross-functional team. Your main responsibilities include assisting in designing and implementing infrastructure solutions, supporting infrastructure improvement projects, maintaining and updating existing infrastructure solutions, creating operational documentation, and resolving server (physical and virtual), network and desktop issues.<p><br></p>Responsible for Academy’s server infrastructure and network system comprising of system maintenance; installation and tuning of system software; monitoring of system performance; management and allocation of computer resources; provisioning of system users; backup and system restoration. Responsible for securing systems per Information Security recommendations.<p><br></p>Part of a team responsible for basic database administration duties comprising of installation of SQL Server, Personify and other database applications. Monitoring of SQL Server and other database applications. Maintenance of databases which includes user provisioning, resource usage, and backup and restoration.<p><br></p>Server backup, network, phone and desktop support and alert monitoring primarily at the Rosemont headquarters with limited travel to the Washington D.C office.<p><br></p>Works with DevOps, SQL DBAs and Cloud Engineering to support both on premises and cloud-based projects and improve the provisioning times for IT environments.<p><br></p>Participates in creating documentation for operational readiness activities, designs and builds pilot solutions using new technologies, and implements new product features and enhancements.<p><br></p>Ensures that infrastructure projects are integrated and operate efficiently, and coordinates with colleagues across the enterprise to drive infrastructure builds and resolves any issues that may arise.<p><br></p>Works closely with the Identity and Access Management and Cyber Security teams to properly provision and decommission access to systems as necessary.<p><br></p>Assists with desktop software, OS and hardware upgrades and using SCCM.<p><br></p>Configures and monitors AAOS backup solutions. Consists of backup, restore, on site retention, cloud (Azure) backups and cloud synchronization. Member of the Disaster Recovery team.<p><br></p>Monitors, purchases, and installs DNS name renewal and SSL certificates.<p><br></p>Responsible for 3rd party audio/visual conference subscriptions. Provisioning users and billing reconciliation.<p><br></p><strong><u>Exemplifies The Following Essential Values Of The Academy</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Teamwork: Effective collaboration and team-focus to solve complex problems and drive innovation.</li><li>Empowerment: The authority, information, and skills to make decisions and drive results.</li><li>Accountability: Ownership of process and results that drive decisions and ensure implementation.</li><li>Mindset of Growth/Continuous Learning: Focused on and invested in self and staff development to become more adaptable, making the Academy more agile, innovative, and sustainable.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Travel</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Up to 10 days per year</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Required</strong>:<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree and 3-5 years of relevant infrastructure engineering, network, and desktop support experience </li><li>Hands-on experience with VMware, and experience with Microsoft Azure </li><li>Knowledge and skills in infrastructure management </li><li>Ability to manage multiple assignments, prioritize activities, and work independently. </li><li>Familiarity with ITIL v4, IT standards, procedures, and policies </li><li>Experience in configuring networking components, TCP-IP/tools, VMWare, wired and wireless appliances (using Extreme Networks, Cisco, and Mitel solutions) </li><li>Ability to simplify and standardize complex concepts and processes. </li><li>Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, as well as the ability to prioritize. </li><li>Drive for cross-functional execution, adaptability, and ability to introduce and manage change. </li><li>Team player, detail-oriented, and analytical skills. </li><li>Above average ability in communication and human relations skills </li><li>Strong organizational skills and user orientation</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Desired</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>System administration and IT certifications in Linux, Microsoft, or other network related fields </li><li>Knowledge of IIS running in Windows 2016, 2019 and 2022 </li><li>Experience with cloud-based infrastructure specifically in Microsoft Azure </li><li>1-2 years of experience of project coordination/management</li></ul><p><br></p>If this describes YOU, please apply by sharing the following:<p><br></p><ul><li>Clearly communicate why you are the ideal candidate for this role, providing specific examples and experiences as proof points.</li><li>Resumes must be accompanied by a cover letter with salary expectations to be considered. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Please Note</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>This position is based in Rosemont, Illinois and is open to applicants who are able to commute weekly to this office.</strong><p><br></p>Applicants must already be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of work visas.<p><br></p><strong>JOB CODE: 1000052</strong>
description_json: <strong>You have the ability to introduce and engineer evolution across an organization. Your exceptional multitasking skills help you to prioritize and balance in accordance with an organization’s goals and timelines. Your expert analytical skills allow you to quickly examine performance, security and reliability of systems and networks, and identify and resolve any issues that may arise. You stay ahead of the curve and utilize various tools and methods to collect, process and interpret data. You use your interpersonal skills to communicate effectively with different stakeholders and can explain technical concepts and solutions in a clear and concise manner, and in creating robust documentation.</strong><p><br></p>If this sounds like you, please read on!<p><br></p>As the Infrastructure Engineer, you will be involved in creating end-to-end infrastructure solutions as part of a cross-functional team. Your main responsibilities include assisting in designing and implementing infrastructure solutions, supporting infrastructure improvement projects, maintaining and updating existing infrastructure solutions, creating operational documentation, and resolving server (physical and virtual), network and desktop issues.<p><br></p>Responsible for Academy’s server infrastructure and network system comprising of system maintenance; installation and tuning of system software; monitoring of system performance; management and allocation of computer resources; provisioning of system users; backup and system restoration. Responsible for securing systems per Information Security recommendations.<p><br></p>Part of a team responsible for basic database administration duties comprising of installation of SQL Server, Personify and other database applications. Monitoring of SQL Server and other database applications. Maintenance of databases which includes user provisioning, resource usage, and backup and restoration.<p><br></p>Server backup, network, phone and desktop support and alert monitoring primarily at the Rosemont headquarters with limited travel to the Washington D.C office.<p><br></p>Works with DevOps, SQL DBAs and Cloud Engineering to support both on premises and cloud-based projects and improve the provisioning times for IT environments.<p><br></p>Participates in creating documentation for operational readiness activities, designs and builds pilot solutions using new technologies, and implements new product features and enhancements.<p><br></p>Ensures that infrastructure projects are integrated and operate efficiently, and coordinates with colleagues across the enterprise to drive infrastructure builds and resolves any issues that may arise.<p><br></p>Works closely with the Identity and Access Management and Cyber Security teams to properly provision and decommission access to systems as necessary.<p><br></p>Assists with desktop software, OS and hardware upgrades and using SCCM.<p><br></p>Configures and monitors AAOS backup solutions. Consists of backup, restore, on site retention, cloud (Azure) backups and cloud synchronization. Member of the Disaster Recovery team.<p><br></p>Monitors, purchases, and installs DNS name renewal and SSL certificates.<p><br></p>Responsible for 3rd party audio/visual conference subscriptions. Provisioning users and billing reconciliation.<p><br></p><strong><u>Exemplifies The Following Essential Values Of The Academy</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Teamwork: Effective collaboration and team-focus to solve complex problems and drive innovation.</li><li>Empowerment: The authority, information, and skills to make decisions and drive results.</li><li>Accountability: Ownership of process and results that drive decisions and ensure implementation.</li><li>Mindset of Growth/Continuous Learning: Focused on and invested in self and staff development to become more adaptable, making the Academy more agile, innovative, and sustainable.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Travel</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Up to 10 days per year</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Required</strong>:<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree and 3-5 years of relevant infrastructure engineering, network, and desktop support experience </li><li>Hands-on experience with VMware, and experience with Microsoft Azure </li><li>Knowledge and skills in infrastructure management </li><li>Ability to manage multiple assignments, prioritize activities, and work independently. </li><li>Familiarity with ITIL v4, IT standards, procedures, and policies </li><li>Experience in configuring networking components, TCP-IP/tools, VMWare, wired and wireless appliances (using Extreme Networks, Cisco, and Mitel solutions) </li><li>Ability to simplify and standardize complex concepts and processes. </li><li>Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, as well as the ability to prioritize. </li><li>Drive for cross-functional execution, adaptability, and ability to introduce and manage change. </li><li>Team player, detail-oriented, and analytical skills. </li><li>Above average ability in communication and human relations skills </li><li>Strong organizational skills and user orientation</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Desired</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>System administration and IT certifications in Linux, Microsoft, or other network related fields </li><li>Knowledge of IIS running in Windows 2016, 2019 and 2022 </li><li>Experience with cloud-based infrastructure specifically in Microsoft Azure </li><li>1-2 years of experience of project coordination/management</li></ul><p><br></p>If this describes YOU, please apply by sharing the following:<p><br></p><ul><li>Clearly communicate why you are the ideal candidate for this role, providing specific examples and experiences as proof points.</li><li>Resumes must be accompanied by a cover letter with salary expectations to be considered. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Please Note</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>This position is based in Rosemont, Illinois and is open to applicants who are able to commute weekly to this office.</strong><p><br></p>Applicants must already be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of work visas.<p><br></p><strong>JOB CODE: 1000052</strong>

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: Expert experience with Python and SQL, with focus on data manipulation and analysis.<p><br></p>Strong experience with MongoDB, BigQuery, Jira, Git, Kubernetes, Jenkins, Terraform, GCP Deployment Manager, Apache Airflow, Apache Beam, and Apache Spark.<p><br></p>Strong expe rience with Snowflake cloud services<p><br></p>Experience in Pair Programming and Test driven development<p><br></p>Expert experience with building, deploying, and maintaining data pipelines.<p><br></p>Expert experience with sourcing and profiling highly variable data.<p><br></p>Expert experience in software craftsmanship, behavior-driven development (BDD), and unit testing.
description_json: Expert experience with Python and SQL, with focus on data manipulation and analysis.<p><br></p>Strong experience with MongoDB, BigQuery, Jira, Git, Kubernetes, Jenkins, Terraform, GCP Deployment Manager, Apache Airflow, Apache Beam, and Apache Spark.<p><br></p>Strong expe rience with Snowflake cloud services<p><br></p>Experience in Pair Programming and Test driven development<p><br></p>Expert experience with building, deploying, and maintaining data pipelines.<p><br></p>Expert experience with sourcing and profiling highly variable data.<p><br></p>Expert experience in software craftsmanship, behavior-driven development (BDD), and unit testing.

title: Snowflake and Teradata Data Engineer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork, and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>The scope of the Infrastructure Engineer role includes building, managing, and supporting core infrastructure and security services in public cloud to deliver highly available and scalable services, automating everything to minimize manual work and meet security and compliance objectives in all aspects of the secure cloud ecosystem, use native AWS and/or GCP infrastructure services such as IAM, networking, compute, storage, Kubernetes, cloud functions, etc., perform basic system administration tasks, and serve on the on-call team as an escalation contact for service incidents.<p><br></p>Responsible for the technical design, development, monitoring and ongoing support and maintenance of a diverse set of cloud technologies. The role is a technical, hands-on opportunity with a heavy focus on automation, resilient design and deployment of cloud ready systems and services. This role collaborates with Product teams internal and external to IS to provide world class products and services in support of our application development community and our business as whole. This is a ‘DevOps’ position, responsible for the full-stack engineering and support of products that support our hybrid cloud capabilities.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Engineer complex public cloud (AWS, GCP) Solutions</li><li>Implement Configuration Management and Infrastructure as Code (e.g. Terraform, Python, Chef, Cloud Deployment Manager, Puppet, Ansible)</li><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities</li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work</li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms</li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability</li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events</li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities</li><li>Continues professional education and create opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices</li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and is actively fosters the adoption of new technologies</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related</li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related</li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>GCP and AWS public cloud experience in a production environment</li><li>Demonstrates growth mindset, enthusiastic about learning new technologies quickly and applying the gained knowledge to address business problems.</li><li>Comfortable working on agile-based teams comprised of team members with diverse skill-sets (e.g. Quality Assurance Engineers, User Experience Designers, Software Engineers / Architects)</li><li>Capable of collaborating with stakeholders and project leaders to understand requirements, deliverables, and set expectations on tasks that you will be responsible for.</li><li>Consistently demonstrates follow-through in honoring commitments to customers and colleagues. Accepts the challenge of unfamiliar tasks.</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)
