title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: This is an environment <strong>unlike anything</strong> <strong>in the high-tech world</strong> and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture.The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes.Our employees and our members come FIRST.Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others.In 2021, Costco contributed over $58 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals.<p><br></p>Costco IT is responsible for the <strong>technical future of Costco Wholesale</strong>, the third largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in fourteen countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco ranks <strong>seventh in Forbes “World’s Best Employers”</strong>.<p><br></p>Come join <strong>Costco Digital - part of the Costco Wholesale IT family</strong>. Costco Digital is a dynamic, fast-paced environment, working through exciting transformation efforts. We are building the next generation digital retail environment where you will be surrounded by dedicated and highly professional employees. We are embarking on a large digital transformation and need team members like you to help us grow to the next level.<p><br></p>Our Digital team is transforming how we deliver solutions and interact with our members across our Mobile, Commerce and Order Management platforms. We have a culture of improvement &amp; learning with a start up mentality and a customer centric approach for our Costco members and our employees. We are looking for talented individuals to join our team and pursue bold ideas and explore growth opportunities.<p><br></p>The <strong>Software Developer</strong> is responsible for the development of digital analytics tagging strategy and implementation, building A/B tests of new digital features, and creating custom algorithms for product recommendations and personalization for Costco’s digital systems with a mobile first mindset.<p><br></p>If you want to be a part of one of the worldwide<strong> <u>BEST companies “to work for”,</u></strong> simply apply and let your career be reimagined.<p><br></p><strong> <u> ROLE </u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develops or prototypes software modules at various levels of complexity, including but not limited to: service interfaces, process flows, service messages, SOA components, business logic, UI/UX, or data access logic.</li><li>Develops efficient code in various development languages for enhancements and bug fixes.</li><li>Designs, develops, tests, and deploys software solutions and process flows complying with standards, guidelines, and best practices.</li><li>Executes against project plans and delivers assignments within scope, schedule, and budget.</li><li>Creates, executes, and evaluates unit/integration tests.</li><li>Adopts and adapts to newly approved technologies, programming languages, tools, and standards.</li><li>Identifies, assesses, and formulates architectural impacts and solutions from business requirements.</li><li>Collaborates to ensure application designs utilize appropriate patterns and standards.</li><li>Analyzes user needs and software requirements to determine feasibility of design within time and cost constraints, including the ability to estimate work needed.</li><li>Assesses functional and nonfunctional requirements and creates designs to meet both business and technical needs.</li><li>Creates conceptual and detailed technical design documents.</li><li>Provides implementation expertise contributing to rollback, post install, data migration, and other artifacts as required including creation of support plans.</li><li>Adheres to security management practices and promotes established security standards.</li><li>Identifies and resolves problems, often anticipating issues before they occur or before they grow, develops and evaluates options, and implements solutions.</li><li>Participates in requirements gathering sessions to ensure clear understanding of needs for data collection for analytics purposes and other ways the data will be used (e.g. data feeds, fuel segmentation, audience creation, etc.).</li><li>Prepares and presents detailed functional and technical specifications that support digital data collection requirements.</li><li>Develops solutions to specifications on time, within budget, and with quality and precision to specification.</li><li>Prepares and clearly communicates best methods clients can effectively optimize digital data collection methods including: Tag Management (e.g. Adobe, Google, Tealium, Ensighten, etc.), Customer Data and Audience Management (e.g. Adobe, Google, Tealium, etc.), Testing and Targeting (e.g. Adobe, Google), Web Analytics (e.g. Adobe, Google, etc.).</li><li>Partners with analysts and business stakeholders to create a/b tests for new digital features.</li><li>Interacts with other developers, marketers, product managers, and analysts to ensure the technical solution offers scale and supports business needs.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Expert in Web Markup, including HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript.</li><li>Expert understanding of client-side scripting and JavaScript frameworks such as jQuery and React.</li><li>Proficient understanding of server-side CSS pre-processing platforms, such as SASS.</li><li>Proficient understanding of JavaScript pre-processing and packaging frameworks such as Babel and Webpack.</li><li>Good understanding of Web Analytics standards and ensuring that applications will adhere to them.</li><li>Ability to effectively present technical details to a non-technical audience.</li><li>Experience designing and/or developing with Java, J2EE, XML, SOAP, REST, and Web Services.</li><li>Knowledge in Object-Oriented design architecture, analysis, UML modeling, Classic design patterns, J2EE patterns.</li><li>Ability to manage priorities and timelines.</li><li>Proven experience successfully implementing solutions for large cross platform projects.</li><li>Good understanding of design/development methodologies and project management concepts.</li><li>Excellent troubleshooting skills and the ability to logically think through problem resolution.</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills; including ability to work with all management levels.</li><li>Able to work effectively and produce consistent results with minimum supervision.</li><li>Must have high integrity, accountability, a positive attitude, and be willing to do what it takes to make the team successful.</li><li>Database knowledge in a major RDBMS system such as DB2, MS SQL Server or Oracle.</li><li>Scheduling flexibility to meet the needs of the business including weekends, holidays, and 24/7 on call responsibilities on a rotational basis.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Recommended </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Full stack experience.</li><li>Adobe or Google analytics experience</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Documents</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Cover Letter</li><li>Resume</li></ul><p><br></p>California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice.<p><br></p><strong><u>Pay Ranges</u></strong><p><br></p>Level 2 - $105,000 - $135,000<p><br></p>Level 3 - $125,000 - $160,000<p><br></p>We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, health benefits - medical/dental/vision/hearing aid/pharmacy/behavioral health/employee assistance, health care reimbursement account, dependent care assistance plan, short-term disability and long-term disability insurance, AD&amp;D insurance, life insurance, 401(k), stock purchase plan to eligible employees.<p><br></p>Costco is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Costco is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or any other legally protected status. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request to IT-Recruiting@costco.com<p><br></p>If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. In some cases, applicants and employees for selected positions will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.

pre-processing and packaging frameworks such as Babel and Webpack.</li><li>Good understanding of Web Analytics standards and ensuring that applications will adhere to them.</li><li>Ability to effectively present technical details to a non-technical audience.</li><li>Experience designing and/or developing with Java, J2EE, XML, SOAP, REST, and Web Services.</li><li>Knowledge in Object-Oriented design architecture, analysis, UML modeling, Classic design patterns, J2EE patterns.</li><li>Ability to manage priorities and timelines.</li><li>Proven experience successfully implementing solutions for large cross platform projects.</li><li>Good understanding of design/development methodologies and project management concepts.</li><li>Excellent troubleshooting skills and the ability to logically think through problem resolution.</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills; including ability to work with all management levels.</li><li>Able to work effectively and produce consistent results with minimum supervision.</li><li>Must have high integrity, accountability, a positive attitude, and be willing to do what it takes to make the team successful.</li><li>Database knowledge in a major RDBMS system such as DB2, MS SQL Server or Oracle.</li><li>Scheduling flexibility to meet the needs of the business including weekends, holidays, and 24/7 on call responsibilities on a rotational basis.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Recommended </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Full stack experience.</li><li>Adobe or Google analytics experience</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Documents</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Cover Letter</li><li>Resume</li></ul><p><br></p>California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice.<p><br></p><strong><u>Pay Ranges</u></strong><p><br></p>Level 2 - $105,000 - $135,000<p><br></p>Level 3 - $125,000 - $160,000<p><br></p>We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, health benefits - medical/dental/vision/hearing aid/pharmacy/behavioral health/employee assistance, health care reimbursement account, dependent care assistance plan, short-term disability and long-term disability insurance, AD&amp;D insurance, life insurance, 401(k), stock purchase plan to eligible employees.<p><br></p>Costco is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Costco is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or any other legally protected status. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request to IT-Recruiting@costco.com<p><br></p>If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States. In some cases, applicants and employees for selected positions will not be sponsored for work authorization, including, but not limited to H1-B visas.

title: Software Developer - Business Services (Digital Analytics)
description: Cooper's Hawk Winery &amp; Restaurants was created with the inspiration of bringing the Napa Valley experience to all of America, by combining an elegant tasting room with a polished casual restaurant and scratch kitchen. Cooper's Hawk wines have won hundreds of awards and are the Official Wines of the Screen Actors Guild® Awards. We are built upon the belief that food and wine hold the power to forge a COMMUNITY, and with the world's largest wine club membership, we are paving the way to democratizing the good life!<br><br>Cooper’s Hawk Winery &amp; Restaurants is seeking an experienced Cloud Systems Engineer to support our cloud related initiatives. This role will be responsible for the architecture, implementation, and security of cloud-based solutions, primarily utilizing Azure. Additionally, this role will play a critical part in adopting DevOps solutions and best practices in order to assist our rapid growth across data and digital platforms.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li>Management of all Azure tenant resources and other cloud related systems. </li><li>Design and implement enterprise-scale Azure IaaS and PaaS solutions. </li><li>Collaborate with different teams to understand business and technical requirements and ensure solutions meet those requirements. </li><li>Ensure high availability of critical systems and applications. </li><li>Ensure security controls, standards and policies are implemented across entire areas of responsibility. </li><li>Configure and manage monitoring tools. </li><li>Vulnerability management for cloud environments. </li><li>Assist in the implementation and ongoing use of DevSecOps tools and processes. </li><li>Support Power BI and Azure DevOps tenants. </li><li>Identify and implement opportunities to reduce Azure consumption costs. </li><li>Provide support for data related services and deployments within Azure. </li><li>Assist in the management, support and security administration of Linux based operating systems. </li><li>Manage assigned projects and tasks with minimum oversight and ensure timely completion. </li><li>Recommend strategies, roadmaps, and standards for all platform infrastructures, ensuring security, and compliance with industry best practices. </li><li>Provide support for complex issues. </li><li>Automate processes wherever possible. </li><li>Create, update, and maintain documentation of all technology processes and components. </li><li>Provide after-hours support as needed for critical systems. </li><li>Participate in special projects and perform other duties as required. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Skills &amp; Other Requirements<br><br></strong><strong>Applicants must be authorized to work for ANY employer in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment Visa at this time.<br></strong><ul><li>Must Represent Cooper's Hawk values</li><li>Minimum 3 years’ engineer and management experience of Azure based environments, with in depth knowledge of Azure services. </li><li>Minimum 2 years’ experience with DevOps tool chains and processes. </li><li>Experience supporting enterprise cloud data environments. </li><li>Expertise with infrastructure automation using Azure DevOps, ARM and Terraform. </li><li>2-3 years’ experience with other cloud services. </li><li>Expertise in cloud security best practices and implementations. </li><li>Experience managing and troubleshooting SSL certificates. </li><li>Experience administering Linux-based environments. </li><li>Advanced problem solving and analytical skills. </li><li>BS in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, or Information Technology or equivalent. </li><li>Relevant certifications highly preferred. <br><br></li></ul><em>Cooper’s Hawk reviews several factors when establishing compensation. Salaries and hourly wages appearing in a job posting may be published by third parties and may not reflect the salaries or hourly wages offered by Cooper’s Hawk. <br><br></em><em>Cooper’s Hawk is an equal opportunity employer.  All qualified applicants are considered for employment without regard to the person’s race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability, or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Cooper’s Hawk makes reasonable accommodations during all aspects of the employment process, including during the interview process. <br><br></em><em>The information provided above indicates the general nature and level of work required of the position and is not a comprehensive list of all responsibilities or qualifications. The Benefits list is only a highlight of some of the benefits offered to team members; eligibility for certain benefits apply.</em>

title: Azure Cloud Engineer
description: <strong>Employment type: </strong>Full-time &amp; Permanent<p><br></p>Starting salary of <strong>55,000 USD per annum</strong> in a zero-tax environment (plus biannual performance-based bonuses)<p><br></p><strong>Job Location:</strong> Dubai, UAE (We provide visa sponsorship &amp; relocation assistance)<p><br></p><strong>About Cobblestone Energy</strong><p><br></p>Cobblestone Energy is an energy trading company specialising in the Great Britain and European wholesale electricity markets. Founded in 2017, we are part of the next generation of companies defining the future of global commodity trading.<p><br></p>We make use of advanced data analytics and extensive research to drive profitable decision making, trading enough electricity every day to power a small country, and growing every day. In doing so, we help to balance the electricity grid, lowering the cost to end consumers, and aiding the transition to a renewable future. Technology and risk management form the backbone of our business.<p><br></p>At Cobblestone Energy, we are a diverse team of over 50 people from 20+ nationalities - we believe in hiring extraordinary talent from all around the world. Our flat organizational structure helps us in giving our team members complete ownership of the work and ensures ideas come from every level. We believe in providing unlimited growth opportunities to our people alongside constant feedback and support, which allows us to cover our vulnerabilities and grow as a team in new and interesting ways.<p><br></p>Over the years we have grown organically. In light of our further ambitions to be the best in all markets we enter, we would like to welcome talented Software Engineers into our Tech team who have just started their careers and are and looking to take up challenging tasks and being a part of our growth story.<p><br></p><strong>Cobblestone Values: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Lifelong learning with continuous reflection. </li><li>Independent thinking through a meritocracy of ideas. </li><li>The team is more important than the individual</li><li>Being the best in any market we enter. </li><li>Hiring and keeping only the most effective people. </li><li>Others must benefit from our existence. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p>At Cobblestone Energy we are on a mission to build the most advanced European electricity trading and analytics platform, with our technology being used by our teams of commercial traders to create significant value. Being a member of our team, you will work on exciting challenges that come with large-scale data processing, automation, and analytics. We work in an agile and highly collaborative environment and challenge the norms of traditional business leadership. We are looking for enthusiastic and resourceful engineers who are passionate about building highly reliable and performance data processing solutions. Developing a strong domain knowledge of our industry over time is key to long term success in this role.<p><br></p>This is a rare opportunity to take a leading role in the growth of a major player in the European Power Markets. We are looking for someone who would be committed to the long-term success of the business. We operate in the European Power markets, but our commercial trading operations are in Dubai, UAE.<p><br></p>If you have excellent programming skills, strong problem-solving skills and a passion for developing/improving applications utilizing cutting edge technologies, then we would like to meet you.<p><br></p><strong>What We Offer In This Role</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>A full-time position on our Tech team</li><li>Committed and remarkably talented colleagues</li><li>Highly competitive compensation dependent on performance</li><li>An exciting, challenging and fulfilling career</li><li>An opportunity to work on new things from scratch and make independent decisions. </li><li>Investment in your development to ensure that you always remain the best in business</li><li>Equity participation for strong contributors, ensuring our interests are all aligned long term</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Be a key contributor to tech projects critical for commercial operations</li><li>Write software applications and programs for backend/frontend purposes</li><li>Analyse programs and apps to improve their features and functionalities in collaboration with the commercial teams</li><li>Test &amp; debug programs and fix any reported bugs</li><li>Uphold and live our cultural values</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>BS/BE in Computer Science/Computer Engineering or related field</li><li>Programming skills in Python language</li><li>Familiarity &amp; Knowledge in front-end technologies such as HTML5, CSS, JQuery, JS, etc</li><li>Strong knowledge of REST APIs and webservices</li><li>Strong knowledge of Relational Databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server) and SQL language</li><li>Strong problem-solving and analytical skills</li><li>Resilience and a determination to succeed</li><li>Passionate, self-motivated, and fast learner</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Desirable Experience/Skills</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Knowledge of at least one popular Python framework (like Django, Flask)</li><li>Programming skills in Java</li><li>Knowledge of NoSQL databases</li><li>Knowledge of AWS</li><li>Knowledge of data visualization tools, mainly Tableau</li></ul>

debug programs and fix any reported bugs</li><li>Uphold and live our cultural values</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>BS/BE in Computer Science/Computer Engineering or related field</li><li>Programming skills in Python language</li><li>Familiarity &amp; Knowledge in front-end technologies such as HTML5, CSS, JQuery, JS, etc</li><li>Strong knowledge of REST APIs and webservices</li><li>Strong knowledge of Relational Databases (MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server) and SQL language</li><li>Strong problem-solving and analytical skills</li><li>Resilience and a determination to succeed</li><li>Passionate, self-motivated, and fast learner</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Desirable Experience/Skills</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Knowledge of at least one popular Python framework (like Django, Flask)</li><li>Programming skills in Java</li><li>Knowledge of NoSQL databases</li><li>Knowledge of AWS</li><li>Knowledge of data visualization tools, mainly Tableau</li></ul>

title: GRADUATE SOFTWARE ENGINEER - Dubai, UAE
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>The Infrastructure Engineer works on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determines technology patterns for the overall solution. This role takes the lead in guiding more junior engineers and is a role model in fostering the adoption of new technologies. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Golang programing language</li><li>OpenShift/Kubernetes</li><li>Linux administration/scripting skillset</li><li>AWS – RDS</li><li>Git/GitHub, Jenkins CI/CD</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills.</li><li>Strong collaboration skills, responsive to service needs and project demands in a fast-changing environment.</li><li>Working in agile environment</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: <strong>ROLE: R Shiny Developer (Remote)<br><br></strong>We are Cognizant Artificial Intelligence<br><br>Digital technologies, including analytics and AI, give companies a once-in-a-generation opportunity to perform orders of magnitude better than ever before. However, clients need new business models built from analyzing customers and business operations at every angle to really understand them.<br><br>With the power to apply artificial intelligence and data science to business decisions via enterprise data management solutions, we help leading companies prototype, refine, validate, and scale the most desirable products and delivery models to enterprise scale within weeks<br><br>*You must be legally authorized to work in United States/Canada without the need of employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future *<br><br>This is a remote position open to any qualified applicant in the United States/Canada<br><br><strong><u>Qualification<br><br></u></strong>Bachelors in science , engineering or equivalent<br><br><strong><u>Salary And Other Compensation<br><br></u></strong>The annual salary for this position is between $[95,000– 130,000] depending on experience and other qualifications of the successful candidate.<br><br>This position is also eligible for Cognizant’s discretionary annual incentive program and stock awards, based on performance and subject to the terms of Cognizant’s applicable plans.<br><br>Benefits: Cognizant offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements:<br><ul><li> Medical/Dental/Vision/Life Insurance</li><li> Paid holidays plus Paid Time Off</li><li> 401(k) plan and contributions</li><li> Long-term/Short-term Disability</li><li> Paid Parental Leave</li><li> Employee Stock Purchase Plan<br></li></ul>Disclaimer: The salary, other compensation, and benefits information is accurate as of the date of this posting. Cognizant reserves the right to modify this information at any time, subject to applicable law.<br><br>Must Have Skills: R Shiny, Teradata<br><br>Good To Have Skills: Teradata Admin<br><br>Job title: R Shiny DEVELOPER<br><br><strong><u>Job Summary<br><br></u></strong>The developer is responsible for the hands-on implementation of R shiny solutions that meet business requirements goals and objectives and at the same time encompass the full range of technologies employed by client servers networks systems and data management processes.<br><br>Experience: 5to7yrs<br><br>Technical Skills- Teradata HLDM (Healthcare) Teradata Administration<br><br>Roles &amp; Responsibilities<br><br>Expertise in R / R Shiny with standard core packages for data visualization<br><br>Expertise in Teradata sql skills<br><br>Healthcare domain knowledge is plus.<br><br>Knowledge and experience applying software engineering principals.<br><br>Must be capable of developing collaborative relationships with colleagues and stakeholders.<br><br>Must demonstrate the ability to present ideas issues and observations in a clear manner.<br><br>Primary Location: Chicago - IL<br><br>Employee Status : Full Time Employee<br><br>Shift : Day Job<br><br>Travel : No<br><br>Job Posting : Jun 21 2023<br><br><strong><u>About Cognizant<br><br></u></strong>Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 185 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @USJobsCognizant.<br><br>Applicants may be required to attend interviews in person or by video conference. In addition, candidates may be required to present their current state or government issued ID during each interview.<br><br>Cognizant is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.<br><br>If you have a disability that requires a reasonable accommodation to search for a job opening or submit an application, please email CareersNA2@cognizant.com with your request and contact information.

title: R Shiny Developer
description: Joining Collibra’s Support team<p><br></p>As a Collibra Support Senior Escalation Manager, you will be responsible for the end to end management of customer support escalations for Collibra’s growing customer base. Primarily, you will work with stakeholders across all levels of the organization to elevate, communicate, aid in the resolution of and document, all escalated incidents while ensuring the best customer experience during these critical situations. You will lead the charge in establishing, improving and maintaining post escalation processes such as post incident reviews, post mortems and other forms of continuous improvement.<p><br></p><strong><u>Senior Escalation Managers At Collibra Are Responsible For</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Managing the lifecycle of an escalated incident including, but not limited to, acting as the single point of contact, incident intake, impact analysis, internal stakeholder coordination &amp; communication and escalation closure.</li><li>Establishing and maintaining escalation standard operating procedures in accordance with industry standards (ITIL) and best practices (TSIA).</li><li>Building strong working relationships with key stakeholders across Customer Success, Engineering and Product focused on fostering efficient collaboration and driving down resolution times. </li><li>Leading, developing, implementing and coordinating key post escalation processes such as post incident reviews, conducting post mortems, preparing customer facing RCA’s, trend analysis and other key continuous process improvement activities.</li><li>Building, revamping and monitoring escalation KPIs and relevant reporting to ensure support continues to provide the best internal and customer experience possible for escalated incidents.</li><li>Leading, driving and managing incident review meetings focused on critical / major escalations with senior leadership.</li><li>Project management of Service Delivery initiatives to improve and mature related support processes and functions, where relevant.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>You Have</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Exceptional judgment regarding escalation management and incident resolution as well as the ability to make timely decisions from both business and technical standpoints</li><li>10+ years of incident management and/or escalation management experience in fast paced software/technology environments, preferably as a team lead or manager</li><li>Proven ability to cultivate strong working relationships cross-functionally to drive effective teamwork and communication</li><li>Experience working with relevant tooling including ticketing systems such as Zendesk and ServiceNow and dashboard tools such as Zendesk Explore and Tableau</li><li>Demonstrated ability to communicate customer issues in a meaningful way to both technical and business audiences at various levels of seniority</li><li>A bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>You Are</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Customer-centric</li><li>An excellent problem solver</li><li>A skilled collaborator and influencer</li><li>An independent and well organized, project-oriented thinker</li><li>One who thrives in a fast paced environment</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Measures Of Success Are</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Within your first month, you will absorb knowledge about current incident and escalation processes &amp; tools as well as identify key pain points and opportunities for immediate improvement.</li><li>Within your third month, you will be actively managing escalations, implementing improvements to current processes and documenting action plans for new functional post-incident activities.</li><li>Within your sixth month, you will help lead the end to end escalation process as well as any post-incident activities and act as a lead in executing against a project roadmap for further maturing Collibra’s incident &amp; problem management strategy</li></ul><p><br></p>Compensation for this role<p><br></p>The standard base salary range for this position is $116,000.00 - $176,000.00 per year. This position is not eligible for additional commission-based compensation. Salary offers are based on a combination of factors, including, but not limited to, experience, skills, and location.<p><br></p>In addition to base salary, we offer equity ownership at every level, bonus potential, a Flex Fund monthly stipend, pension/401k plans, and more.<p><br></p>Benefits at Collibra<p><br></p>Collibra recognizes and values that everyone has different needs, interests, and life goals. We built our {Be}well benefits program with flexibility in mind to support you and your loved ones through a diverse range of circumstances and life events. These flexible offerings sit on a foundation of competitive compensation, health coverage, and time off.<p><br></p><strong>Professional Development</strong><p><br></p>Collibrians are ambitious and inventive, and we want to develop our skills individually and as a team. You’ll have access to LinkedIn Learning and other development opportunities, as well as other rewards and recognition programs to help grow your career.<p><br></p><strong>Health Coverage</strong><p><br></p>We strive to remain locally competitive and globally equitable. This means comprehensive offerings including medical, dental, vision, and mental health benefits for you and your family.<p><br></p><strong>Paid Time Off and Flexibility</strong><p><br></p>We provide unlimited paid time off, global leave policies for a variety of personal and family circumstances, company-wide wellness days off throughout the year, meeting-free Wednesdays, and a flexible culture to help balance your work and your life.<p><br></p><strong>Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion</strong><p><br></p>We create inclusion and belonging through how we onboard, meet, connect, engage, and communicate. Learn more about diversity, equity, and inclusion at Collibra.<p><br></p><strong><u>Learn More About Collibra’s Benefits.</u></strong><p><br></p>At Collibra, we’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer – which ties directly to our core value, “open, direct, and kind.” We realize the key to creating a company with a world-class culture and employee experience comes from who we hire and creating a workplace that celebrates everyone.<p><br></p>With this, we proudly consider qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, creed, gender, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, pregnancy, sex, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, HIV status, registered domestic partner status, caregiver status, marital status, veteran or military status, citizenship status or any other legally protected category.

title: Enterprise Escalation Engineer
description: Description <br><br>Assess the security posture of our systems, applications, and infrastructure and design and implement strategies for asset hardening (baseline security configurations).<br><br>Identify misconfigurations, and weaknesses in systems and apply appropriate security controls and countermeasures to mitigate risks.<br><br>Collaborate with system administrators, network engineers, and application developers to engineer and harden assets at all layers, including operating systems, cloud platforms, databases, and network devices.<br><br>Engineer and maintain security controls within the Microsoft 365 environment, including Azure Active Directory, Exchange Online, SharePoint, Intune and Teams.<br><br>Configure and enforce security policies, data loss prevention (DLP) measures, and threat protection mechanisms to safeguard our assets.<br><br>Stay informed about emerging security technologies and trends and provide recommendations for their adoption.<br><br>Software Requirements<br><br>Active Directory (Azure, On-prem)<br><br>AWS (Desirable)<br><br>M365<br><br>Windows Servers (2016 and newer)<br><br>Linux (Desirable)<br><br>Containers (Desirable)<br><br> Experience Required <br><br>5 years of experience as a Security Engineer or in a similar role, with a demonstrated background in asset hardening and Microsoft 365 security.<br><br>Scripting/automation experience such as Python and PowerShell<br><br> Knowledge, Skills, Ablilties, And Behaviors Required <br><br>Ability to work both independently and with a team while managing workload with minimal supervision.<br><br>Strong knowledge of servers, networking, cloud technologies, and related security considerations.<br><br>Familiarity with security principles, frameworks, and compliance standards (e.g., NIST, CIS)<br><br>Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to analyze complex technical issues.<br><br>Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.<br><br>Ability to travel and collaborate in the downtown Chicago office two days a week.<br><br> Skills <br><br>security, information security, firewall, network security, cloud<br><br> Top Skills Details <br><br>security,information security,firewall,network security,cloud<br><br> Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications <br><br>Education Requirements<br><br>4 year college degree in Information Technology or equivalent experience<br><br>Security certifications (CISSP, GSEC, MS—500, MS-700, CCSP, etc.) preferred<br><br> Experience Level <br><br>Intermediate Level<br><br> About TEKsystems <br><br>We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.<br><br>The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Security Engineer
description: <p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p><strong>Role: Senior Anaplan Developer</strong></p><p><strong>Location: Chicago, IL</strong></p><p><span>&nbsp;</span></p><p><strong>Job description</strong> </p><p><span> </span></p><p><br></p><p><span> </span></p><p><span> The primary responsibilities include:</span></p><p><span> </span></p><p><span> 1)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Understand clients’ business planning &amp; performance management processes and related business requirements</span></p><p><span> 2)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Conceive and develop Proof of Concept POC models efficiently to provide pursuit support and establish credibility of Anaplan platform flexibility with the customers</span></p><p><span> 3)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Design effectively &amp; efficiently to cover processes &amp; requirements into detailed blueprint: enterprise models with associated modules, lists / line items, and calculations as supported by multi-dimensional Anaplan platform</span></p><p><span> 4)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Translate design into development plan / timeline and development effort to generate detailed staffing plans &amp; project schedules through sprint cycles</span></p><p><span> 5)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Manage / support several concurrent customer threads across pursuit and implementation streams. Ability to self-manage time across competing priorities for optimal results.</span></p><p><span> 6)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Guide and mentor team members throughout the implementation process</span></p><p><span> 7)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Strong expertise and deep understanding of multi-dimensional modelling</span></p><p><span> 8)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Expert skills of Excel spreadsheet modelling, macros, pivot tables, formulas, charts, etc.</span></p><p><span> 9)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Ability to translate current customer spreadsheet models to effective and efficient Anaplan model designs. Design ability to translate complex excel models into scalable (low sparsity) multi-dimensional Anaplan models.</span></p><p><span> 10)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Strong client facing skills and a successful track record of engagement management</span></p><p><span> 11)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Subject matter expertise in Financial Planning &amp; Analysis FP&amp;A / Enterprise Performance Management EPM, Sales Performance Management (Quota / Territory Planning, Incentive Compensation Management), or Sales &amp; Operations Planning S&amp;OP / Integrated Business Planning IBP domains.</span></p><p><span> 12)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Strong understanding of data/integration both inbound as well as outbound with customer source systems (ERP, CRM, APS, etc.). Experience with standard connectors like MuleSoft, Informatica Cloud, Anaplan APIs highly desired.</span></p><p><span> 13)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Excellent communication and soft skills. Strong client facing skills and a successful track record of engagement management.</span></p><p><span> 14)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Familiarity with Anaplan Agile methodology.</span></p><p><span> 15)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Lead a team of 5-15 members and manage the deliveries on time</span></p><p><span> </span></p><p><span> </span></p><p><span> </span></p><p><span> Qualifications and Skills</span></p><p><span> •&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Bachelor’s Degree ( Computer Science, Mathematics or Statistics)</span></p><p><span> •&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5-9 years’ relevant experience</span></p><p><span> •&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2-3 year or more experience of successfully implementing Anaplan solutions as Solution Architect or Model Builder on 3 or more Anaplan implementation projects</span></p><p><span> •&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Anaplan Hands-On Model building experience of 1-5 years</span></p><p><span> •&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Advanced Excel knowledge</span></p><p><span> </span></p><p><span>&nbsp;</span></p><p><span>Thanks &amp; Have a nice day,</span></p><p><span>&nbsp;</span></p><p><span>Kaushal | Associate Recruiter</span></p><p><span>D: (248)-565-4747 Ext 120| </span>Kaushal@tekshapers.com</p><p><span>M: (248)-306-8423</span></p><p><span>&nbsp;</span></p>

title: Linux Engineer
description: Cooler Screens is backed and led by some of the most prominent Chicago &amp; Silicon Valley leaders, advisers, and investors and has developed a digital solution to transform a multi-billion dollar industry and positively affect the buying experiences of consumers in the US and beyond. If you’re looking to get on the ground floor of the next digital revolution and Chicago tech success story – this opportunity may be for you.<p><br></p>As a Front End Developer with Cooler Screens, you will use your experience to help us reimagine the digital in-store shopper experience. You will be working hands-on with our technical and design teams creating our in-store IoT solutions.<p><br></p><strong>Who You Are:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You are passionate about development and eager to expand your knowledge within a fast-paced start-up environment.</li><li>You are an innovator who thrives on tough technical challenges and finds ways to apply technology to solve business problems.</li><li>You’ll work directly with proven leaders as an integral part of the development and growth of our company. Our digital- and design-led culture allows you to think creatively, challenge the status quo, and use your abilities to change the face of retail forever. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What You Need:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>2+ years of experience in a full-time development role</li><li>Proven experience with front-end technologies such as JavaScript and React</li><li>B.S. preferred, in Computer Science or related discipline</li><li>Azure platform experience preferred</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>About Cooler Screens:</strong><p><br></p>We are transforming retail cooler surfaces into IoT-enabled screens. Our media platform reimagines the brick-and-mortar shopping experience for consumers in the cooler and freezer aisle while delivering new marketing opportunities and smart merchandising for brands and retailers.<p><br></p>We have an excellent benefits package that includes medical, dental, vision, 401(k), life insurance, paid time off, and many other perks. Come join our fast-growing team at our headquarters in heart of Chicago.<p><br></p>We are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, native origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or veteran status.<p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR<p><br></p>crBAYGBay2

title: Programmer
description: <strong>Start a Rewarding Career with Alliant </strong><p><br></p>The Systems Engineer (Linux) serves as the first line of support for assigned team responsible for troubleshooting 3rd level service desk tickets until resolution and working directly with the service desk.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Serve as an administrator on Active Directory and manage additions, changes or deletions to the tree structure and group policies </li><li> Ensure environment is updated with current, stable versions of software products; maintain currency with operating system and support software; plan and implement major software upgrades; ensure change management procedures and methodologies are implemented and followed; provide a current, well-managed operating environment for production processing and application development </li><li> Troubleshoot and diagnoses server hardware or software problems in varying levels of complexity </li><li> Provide support for data located on encrypted storage </li><li> Troubleshoots 3rd level service desk tickets until resolution and work directly with hardware software vendors as appropriate </li><li> Provide support to core server systems which include firmware upgrades, releases, patches, Disaster recovery planning and testing, backup and vaulting of data </li><li> Provide support for Multi-Hosts Nodes as well as upgrades, updates and patches </li><li> Provide support on systems to meet departmental service level agreements </li><li> Provide support for business continuity by ensuring backup schedules are completed and provide on-site support for annual disaster recovery test </li><li> Build, develop, and manage the Windows Systems, including organizing the development of Operating System technical support, operational software, and server hardware platform capabilities </li><li> Define and monitor multiple project priorities and provide technical and administrative supervision ensuring appropriate management is apprised of operational status of projects </li><li> Provide appropriate hardware/software resources for business applications; perform capacity planning, workload modeling/prediction, and purchasing recommendations for new hardware/software upgrades; provide business applications enough resources for their short-term and long-term growth </li><li> Document projects deployed and ensure cross-training to team members is completed </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><strong>Education</strong><p><br></p>Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering or Related – Minimum<p><br></p><strong><u>Experience</u></strong><p><br></p>3+ Years’ of Experience in Network Hardware and Software Design/Configuration/Deployment, or Related – Minimum<p><br></p><strong><u>Experience In Lieu Of Education</u></strong><p><br></p>8+ Years’ of Experience in Network Hardware and Software Design/Configuration/Deployment<p><br></p><strong>When you’re happy, we’re happy!</strong><p><br></p>As a thank you for joining our team, you’ll benefit from:<p><br></p><ul><li> Competitive medical, dental, and free vision benefits </li><li> Competitive compensation plan </li><li> Contributions towards gym memberships </li><li> Generous PTO and banking holidays off </li></ul><p><br></p>Adhere to and ensure compliance of all business transactions with policy and process of the Bank Secrecy Act. Ensures compliance with all applicable state and federal laws, company procedures and policies. Maintains integrity and ethics in all actions and conversations with or regarding credit union members and their accounts; complies with Privacy Act directives.<p><br></p>The responsibilities listed do not contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this position. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.<p><br></p><strong>Still not convinced?</strong><p><br></p>For more details you can also visit our Glassdoor and <u> LinkedIn </u>profiles.<p><br></p>

title: Front End Developer
description: Role: Application Engineer<p><br></p>Level: Entry &amp; Mid-Level<p><br></p>Position: Full-time<p><br></p>Location: West Loop, Chicago, IL<p><br></p>Reports to: Head of Application Engineering<p><br></p><strong>About Us:</strong><p><br></p>Fast Radius is the leading software-enhanced, industrial-grade, 3D printing manufacturer. Our strategic partnership with UPS allows us to offer turnaround as quickly as same-day. From functional prototypes to real engineered parts produced in the tens of thousands, Fast Radius guarantees quality with the fastest delivery times in the industry.<p><br></p>Familiar global corporations and new innovators are choosing Fast Radius to deliver on the promise of on-demand manufacturing, reduce upfront production costs, accelerate product development and make the once unthinkable goal of ‘zero inventory’ a reality.<p><br></p>In addition to UPS, Fast Radius is backed by some of the leading investment firms in the US, including Drive Capital, Jump Capital, Hyde Park Venture Partners and others.<p><br></p><strong>What we’re looking for:</strong><p><br></p>An Engineering athlete. Someone who has driven product design, industrial design, and application engineering projects. Someone who has taken physical products from concept to market. The Application Engineer will work with our clients throughout the product development and execution life cycle, including: concept development; product design; product architecture and systems design; design for manufacturing; production scale up; and order fulfillment. The Application Engineer will responsible for mechanical engineering and industrial design of products that take advantage of additive manufacturing.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Managing product development throughout its lifecycle</li><li>Own client engineering relationship</li><li>Stay up to date on latest additive manufacturing technologies including design software, manufacturing equipment, and materials</li><li>Collaborate internally with sales and manufacturing to ensure project success</li><li>Provide feedback on customer designs, including manufacturability and design for additive manufacturing</li><li>Excited and ready to travel to customer sites (up to 50%)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Between 2-10 years experience (multiple roles open at various levels within the team)</li><li>Bachelors degree in mechanical engineering or related field from top-tier institution (Masters degree a plus)</li><li>Prior 3D printing or manufacturing experience/knowledge (a plus but not required)</li><li>Smart, forward-thinkers</li><li>Excellent written and oral communication skills</li><li>Appreciation for building and working with materials hands on (required)</li><li>Detail oriented and interested in learning more about new manufacturing technologies</li><li>Willingness to dive in for the entire process – from product concept to final part inspection and delivery</li><li>Flexible timing and able to work independently</li><li>Thrives in a fast pace and adaptable environment</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What we will provide you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Competitive compensation + bonus structure + equity opportunities</li><li>Comprehensive medical benefits, a excellent vacation policy and office holidays</li><li>A fun environment to collaborate with like-minded professionals</li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR<p><br></p>wCuHYDYEir

title: Systems Engineer - Linux
description: <strong>Want to be a part of our team?</strong><p><br></p>The MS Engineer (L1) is responsible for providing a managed service to clients to ensure that their IT infrastructure and systems remain operational through proactively identifying, investigating and resolving technical incidents and problems and to restore service to clients by managing incidents to resolution. Their primary objective is to ensure zero missed service level agreement conditions. The MS Engineer (L1) focuses on first line support for standard and low complexity incidents and service requests.<p><br></p>Radford reference:<p><br></p>"Performs IT functions such as design, analysis, evaluation, testing, debugging and implementation of applications programs supporting the company infrastructure business processes and operations and/or network-based (cloud) product systems. Analyzes, installs, acquires, modifies and supports operating systems, database or utilities software. Plans, conducts and directs the analysis of business problems with automated systems solutions. Analyzes, designs, acquires and implements projects for LAN and/or WAN systems. Plans, designs, acquires and implements telecommunications voice/wire systems. At higher job levels, may contribute to the development, testing, evaluation or design of system or infrastructure architecture used throughout the IT solution set."<p><br></p><strong>Working at NTT</strong><p><br></p><strong>Key Roles and Responsibilities: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Monitors client infrastructure and solutions</li><li>Identify problems and errors prior to or when they occur</li><li>Routinely identify common incidents and opportunities for avoidance as well as general opportunities for incident reduction</li><li>Investigate first line incidents assigned and identify the root cause of incidents and problems</li><li>Fulfil approved requests following agreed procedures</li><li>Provide telephonic or chat support to clients when required</li><li>Execute approved maintenance activities including patching and configuration changes</li><li>Follow the required handover procedures for shift changes to ensure service continuity</li><li>Report and escalate incidents where necessary</li><li>Ensure the efficient and comprehensive resolutions of incidents and requests</li><li>Proactively identify opportunities for work optimisation</li><li>Update existing knowledge articles or create new ones</li><li>Identify opportunities for work optimisation including opportunities for automation of work, request fulfilment, incident resolution and other general process improvement opportunities. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Knowledge, Skills and Attributes:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to communicate and work across different cultures and social groups</li><li>Ability to plans activities and projects well in advance, and takes into account possible changing circumstances</li><li>Ability to maintain a positive outlook at work</li><li>Ability to work well in a pressurised environment</li><li>Ability to work hard and put in longer hours when it is necessary</li><li>Ability to apply active listening techniques such as paraphrasing the message to confirm understanding, probing for further relevant information and refraining from interrupting</li><li>Ability to adapt to changing circumstances</li><li>Ability to place client at the forefront of all interactions, understanding their requirements and creating a positive client experience throughout the total client journey</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Academic Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Diploma, degree or relevant qualification in IT/Computing (or demonstrated equivalent work experience)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Advantageous certifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Up to date and relevant ITIL certification (Foundation Level)</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Associate - Routing and Switching (CCNA-R/S)</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Associate - Wireless (CCNA-WL)</li><li>Riverbed Certified Solutions Associate - WAN Optimization (RCSA-W)</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Associate - Security (CCNA-SEC)</li><li>Check Point Certified Security Administrator (CCSA)</li><li>Check Point Certified Security Administrator NG with Application Intelligence (CCSA-NG AI)</li><li>VMware Certified Professional vSphere</li><li>IP, WINS, DHCP, DNC, etc</li><li>MS-Office, MS-Outlook, Symantec Backup Exec, Symantec EndPoint Protection, Symantec System Recovery, Citrix Go-To-Assist</li><li>MS-Active Directory</li><li>MS-Windows Server</li><li>MS-Windows XP Professional</li><li>MS-Windows Terminal Server</li><li>MS-Exchange Server</li><li>MS-SQL Server</li><li>MS-IIS Server</li><li>Citrix Metaframe</li><li>Switches and Routers</li><li>SonicWall Firewalls and SSL VPN Security Appliances</li><li>Cisco Firewalls and Routers</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Associate - Data Center (CCNA-DC)</li><li>MCSA+VCP, RHCE or equivalent</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Associate - Video (CCNA-VID)</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Associate - Voice (CCNA-V)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Additional Certifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Cisco Certified Network Professional - Routing and Switching (CCNP-R/S)</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Professional - Wireless (CCNP-W)</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Professional - Security</li><li>Check Point Certified Security Expert (CCSE)</li><li>Certified Partner SE - Security</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Professional - Data Center (CCNP-DC)</li><li>Blue Coat Certified Proxy SG Professional</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Professional - Voice (CCNP-V)</li></ul><p><br></p>Any of the above certifications is a plus. The MS – Services Engineer (L1) is expected to gain certifications relevant to services supported. Certifications carry additional weight on candidate’s qualification for the role.<p><br></p><strong>Required Experience:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Entry level experience or completion of relevant intern program</li><li>Entry level experience with troubleshooting and providing support required in network/ data centre/ systems/ storage administration and monitoring Services within a medium to large ICT organisation. </li><li>Working knowledge of management agent, redundancy concepts, and products within the supported technical domain (i.e. Network, Data Center, Telephony, Exchange, Storage, Cloud, Backup etc)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What will make you a good fit for the role?</strong>
description_json: <strong>Want to be a part of our team?</strong><p><br></p>The MS Engineer (L1) is responsible for providing a managed service to clients to ensure that their IT infrastructure and systems remain operational through proactively identifying, investigating and resolving technical incidents and problems and to restore service to clients by managing incidents to resolution. Their primary objective is to ensure zero missed service level agreement conditions. The MS Engineer (L1) focuses on first line support for standard and low complexity incidents and service requests.<p><br></p>Radford reference:<p><br></p>"Performs IT functions such as design, analysis, evaluation, testing, debugging and implementation of applications programs supporting the company infrastructure business processes and operations and/or network-based (cloud) product systems. Analyzes, installs, acquires, modifies and supports operating systems, database or utilities software. Plans, conducts and directs the analysis of business problems with automated systems solutions. Analyzes, designs, acquires and implements projects for LAN and/or WAN systems. Plans, designs, acquires and implements telecommunications voice/wire systems. At higher job levels, may contribute to the development, testing, evaluation or design of system or infrastructure architecture used throughout the IT solution set."<p><br></p><strong>Working at NTT</strong><p><br></p><strong>Key Roles and Responsibilities: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Monitors client infrastructure and solutions</li><li>Identify problems and errors prior to or when they occur</li><li>Routinely identify common incidents and opportunities for avoidance as well as general opportunities for incident reduction</li><li>Investigate first line incidents assigned and identify the root cause of incidents and problems</li><li>Fulfil approved requests following agreed procedures</li><li>Provide telephonic or chat support to clients when required</li><li>Execute approved maintenance activities including patching and configuration changes</li><li>Follow the required handover procedures for shift changes to ensure service continuity</li><li>Report and escalate incidents where necessary</li><li>Ensure the efficient and comprehensive resolutions of incidents and requests</li><li>Proactively identify opportunities for work optimisation</li><li>Update existing knowledge articles or create new ones</li><li>Identify opportunities for work optimisation including opportunities for automation of work, request fulfilment, incident resolution and other general process improvement opportunities. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Knowledge, Skills and Attributes:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to communicate and work across different cultures and social groups</li><li>Ability to plans activities and projects well in advance, and takes into account possible changing circumstances</li><li>Ability to maintain a positive outlook at work</li><li>Ability to work well in a pressurised environment</li><li>Ability to work hard and put in longer hours when it is necessary</li><li>Ability to apply active listening techniques such as paraphrasing the message to confirm understanding, probing for further relevant information and refraining from interrupting</li><li>Ability to adapt to changing circumstances</li><li>Ability to place client at the forefront of all interactions, understanding their requirements and creating a positive client experience throughout the total client journey</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Academic Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Diploma, degree or relevant qualification in IT/Computing (or demonstrated equivalent work experience)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Advantageous certifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Up to date and relevant ITIL certification (Foundation Level)</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Associate - Routing and Switching (CCNA-R/S)</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Associate - Wireless (CCNA-WL)</li><li>Riverbed Certified Solutions Associate - WAN Optimization (RCSA-W)</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Associate - Security (CCNA-SEC)</li><li>Check Point Certified Security Administrator (CCSA)</li><li>Check Point Certified Security Administrator NG with Application Intelligence (CCSA-NG AI)</li><li>VMware Certified Professional vSphere</li><li>IP, WINS, DHCP, DNC, etc</li><li>MS-Office, MS-Outlook, Symantec Backup Exec, Symantec EndPoint Protection, Symantec System Recovery, Citrix Go-To-Assist</li><li>MS-Active Directory</li><li>MS-Windows Server</li><li>MS-Windows XP Professional</li><li>MS-Windows Terminal Server</li><li>MS-Exchange Server</li><li>MS-SQL Server</li><li>MS-IIS Server</li><li>Citrix Metaframe</li><li>Switches and Routers</li><li>SonicWall Firewalls and SSL VPN Security Appliances</li><li>Cisco Firewalls and Routers</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Associate - Data Center (CCNA-DC)</li><li>MCSA+VCP, RHCE or equivalent</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Associate - Video (CCNA-VID)</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Associate - Voice (CCNA-V)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Additional Certifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Cisco Certified Network Professional - Routing and Switching (CCNP-R/S)</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Professional - Wireless (CCNP-W)</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Professional - Security</li><li>Check Point Certified Security Expert (CCSE)</li><li>Certified Partner SE - Security</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Professional - Data Center (CCNP-DC)</li><li>Blue Coat Certified Proxy SG Professional</li><li>Cisco Certified Network Professional - Voice (CCNP-V)</li></ul><p><br></p>Any of the above certifications is a plus. The MS – Services Engineer (L1) is expected to gain certifications relevant to services supported. Certifications carry additional weight on candidate’s qualification for the role.<p><br></p><strong>Required Experience:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Entry level experience or completion of relevant intern program</li><li>Entry level experience with troubleshooting and providing support required in network/ data centre/ systems/ storage administration and monitoring Services within a medium to large ICT organisation. </li><li>Working knowledge of management agent, redundancy concepts, and products within the supported technical domain (i.e. Network, Data Center, Telephony, Exchange, Storage, Cloud, Backup etc)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What will make you a good fit for the role?</strong>

title: Application Engineer
description: Passionate about making a difference in the world of cancer genomics?<p><br></p>With the advent of genomic sequencing, we can finally decode and process our genetic makeup. We now have more data than ever before but providers don't have the infrastructure or expertise to make sense of this data. We're on a mission to connect an entire ecosystem to redefine how genomic and clinical data is used in clinical settings.<p><br></p>We are looking for an Operations Analyst to work with our Clinical Data team.<p><br></p>Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li>Maintain clinical data abstraction pipeline, set team priorities to appropriately match commercial delivery timelines</li><li>Maintain research pipeline and capacity</li><li>Manage clinical data infrastructure, reporting, and KPIs </li><li>Collaborate cross-functionally to ensure data is appropriately reflected and consumed by all Tempus teams</li><li>Ad hoc projects to ensure operational excellence is maintained </li></ul><p><br></p>Qualifications:<p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in analytics, business, computer science, finance or economics</li><li>1-2 years of consulting, investment banking or operations </li><li>Familiarity with SQL, Excel, and Tableau</li><li>Excellent project management skill, with proven ability to execute highly complex projects with multiple cross-functional stakeholders</li><li>Ability to effectively prioritize in a dynamic, and time sensitive environment with minimal guidance </li><li>Impeccable written and verbal communication skills</li><li>Ability to create tactical action plans and solve complex problems</li><li>Highly analytical, entrepreneurial, and self-motivated</li><li>Solution oriented mindset</li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR<p><br></p>ss8aNAlOTg

description: Ocean Import Coordinator Position Overview: The Ocean Import Coordinator is primarily responsible for operationally filing entry documents, tracking and updating the movement of ocean freight, and ensuring compliance with import and export clearance regulations. Essential Duties &amp; Responsibilities: <li>Tracking, tracing, and updating the status of shipments on a daily basis. <li>Work collaboratively with the Traffic Department and Accounting to provide top-notch, timely, and efficient service to customers. <li>Monitoring of reports. <li>Accurate and timely billing to customers. <li>Providing customer service via email and telephone correspondence to address customer questions and concerns. <li>Ensure customer needs are consistently met and assist to resolve inquiries <li>Expedite clearance and delivery to exceed customer requirements <li>Work well in a team environment and assist other peers when needed <li>Maintaining good relationships with various vendors such as carriers, truckers, terminals, etc. <li>Process and manage import and/or export shipments <li>Prepare price quotes on the international freight <li>Prepare necessary documents for shipments <li>Develop and maintain relationships with customers as well as vendors specifically steamship lines and customs <li>Research and resolve operational problems <li>Ensure customer needs are consistently met and assist to resolve inquiries <li>Additional duties as assigned Requirements and Qualifications: <li>Strong verbal and written communication skills <li>Excellent listening and analytical skills <li>Ability to prioritize, multitask, organize, and manage time effectively <li>Previous experiences in logistics, cargo management, supply chain, customer service, dispatcher, warehouse, logistics specialist, administrative assistant, data entry, transportation, and logistics analyst are preferred Pay, Benefits and More: <li>Competitive compensation package <li>Full health insurance (medical, dental and vision), 401(k), Life insurance, tuition assistance, PTO and MORE <li>Growing company with a performance record that continues to climb <li>Opportunity to drive significant changes in Talent Acquisition with an ability to make an impact across the organization <li>Open-door work environment <li>High Performance culture with a focus on a growth mindset where continuous improvement is embraced <li>Opportunities for advancement CJ Logistics America About Statement: CJ Logistics America delivers integrated and multimodal logistics services, connecting every corner of the world via air, sea and land. As a lead logistics partner (LLP), third-party logistics provider (3PL) and supply chain consultant, we help customers leverage supply chain management as a competitive advantage, reducing total system costs, transforming business processes, improving service and facilitating growth and change. With a focus on social responsibility and sustainability through growth with customers and communities, we prioritize the wellbeing of the end consumer, our customers and our employees. CJ Logistics America is responsible for the North America region, specializing in solutions for regulated industries such as food and beverage, consumer-packaged goods, healthcare and medical supplies, and tire and automotive. CJ Logistics America is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. We prohibit discrimination and or/harassment of any type, including but not limited to discrimination and or harassment based upon race, religion, religious creed, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, pregnancy or relation medical conditions, childbirth, breastfeeding, parental status, veteran and/or military statue, disability (physical or mental) medical condition, genetic information or characteristics, political affiliation, domestic violence survivor status, marital status, or other characteristics prohibited by federal, state, or local law. Additionally, CJ Logistics America participates in the E-Verify program in certain locations. Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.</li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li></li>

title: Security Engineer
description: <strong>Job Role: ODI Developer with EDI X12</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Description: Chicago, IL (Hybrid)</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>The EDI X12/Oracle SOA B2B/SOA/ODI Developer will be responsible for designing, developing, testing, and maintaining Oracle SOA B2B, SOA, and ODI solutions for a variety of clients. The ideal candidate will have expertise in EDI X12/EDIFACT standards and experience working with B2B integrations in Oracle SOA. They will also have experience with Oracle Data Integrator (ODI) and the ability to work with complex data mappings and transformations.<p><br></p>Key Responsibilities:<p><br></p><ul><li> Design, develop, test, and maintain Oracle SOA B2B, SOA, and ODI solutions</li><li> Develop EDI X12 mapping and document specifications</li><li> Create and configure B2B trading partner agreements in Oracle SOA</li><li> Build and configure SOA composites for data integration</li><li> Develop complex data mappings and transformations in ODI</li><li> Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to Oracle SOA B2B, SOA, and ODI solutions</li><li> Collaborate with other developers and stakeholders to ensure the successful delivery of projects</li></ul><p><br></p>Qualifications:<p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field</li><li> At least 5-7 years of experience in developing Oracle SOA B2B, SOA, and ODI solutions</li><li> Expertise in EDI X12 standards and B2B integrations in Oracle SOA</li><li> Experience with Oracle Data Integrator (ODI)</li><li> Strong understanding of XML, XSD, XSLT, SOAP, REST, and WSDL</li><li> Proficiency in SQL and PL/SQL</li><li> Experience with Agile development methodologies</li><li> Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills</li><li> Strong communication and collaboration skills</li></ul>
