title: Operations Analyst
description: <strong>Description</strong><p><br></p>Are you interested in a new project or rotation opportunity? Ready to advance your career, team up with global thought leaders across industries and make a difference every day?<p><br></p>We are looking for a <strong>Quality Assurance Analyst </strong> to work <strong><strong>onsite</strong></strong> in <strong>Chicago, IL</strong>!<p><br></p><strong>Main Duties</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Gather and analyze data in support of business cases, proposed projects, and systems requirements.</li><li>Write test plans and scripts for tracking defects and fixes in product development, software application development, information systems, and operations systems.</li><li>Develop and establish quality assurance measures and testing standards for new development and enhancements.</li><li>Create and execute test plans and scripts that will determine application quality.</li><li>Communicate test progress, test results, and quality of application changes.</li><li>Analyze test results to discover and report out on defects.</li><li>Work with business community to plan and execute UAT.</li><li>Assist in environment setup and management in preparation for test execution.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong><p><br></p><strong>Must Haves: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Mobile Testing Experience using Dev Tools, Browserstack, and responsive design.</li><li>Manual testing experience</li><li>Proven analytical and problem-solving skills to help validate IT processes through careful testing in order to maximize the benefit of business investments in IT initiatives.</li><li>10+ years direct experience as a lead tester for major application integration and/or major application product release.</li><li>Strong knowledge of system testing best practices and methodologies. Extensive experience with core software applications.</li><li>Direct hands-on experience with ad hoc query programs, automated testing tools, and reporting software.</li><li>Experience with statistical reporting and analysis.</li><li>Good project management skills and/or substantial exposure to project-based work structures.</li><li>Excellent written and oral communication skills.</li><li>Excellent listening, presentation, and interpersonal skills.</li><li>Able to prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.</li><li>Experience working in a team-oriented, collaborative environment.</li><li>Experience with communication tools like MS-Word, MS-Excel, MS-PowerPoint.</li><li>Comfortable with test planning and tracking tools</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Benefits</strong>Intrigued to find more about us?If you like what you have read, send us your resume and let’s start talking!<ul><li>Why Qualitest?</li><ul><li>Be a part of a company who strives to support for diversity and inclusion in the workplace – we are one, we are many at Qualitest. Celebrate culture, share knowledge with engineers from around the globe, and inspire each other through our differences.</li><li>Local and global opportunities – we offer you internal rotation and international mobility opportunities to grow your career.</li><li>Clear view of your career and progression with the company – Qualitest is growing massively (since Jan 2021 – added more than 2000 engineers) and giving you the opportunity to grow with us.</li><li>Work hard and play harder with our flexible and casual culture. Take a break from work and join an employee event, or enjoy the amenities and games provided from one of our Employees Centers.</li><li>Save your earnings and prepare for your future by enrolling in our 401k plan where Qualitest will match your contributions accelerating your savings plan.</li><li>Take care of health with enrollment into one of our competitive healthcare benefits. Qualitest will match towards your HSA if you choose to participate.</li><li>Never stop experimenting and learning with Qualitest Tech academy: Tuition Reimbursement Program, 3000+ training courses, mentorship programs, technical tribes, sponsored certifications, leadership programs and much more</li><li>Stay active and get rewarded with our Corporate Wellness Program. We pay your Gym membership and giving you opportunities to Earn additional vacation times for attendance the gym!</li><li>We invest in our Senior Engineers and leaders with our Equity program</li><li>Earn bonuses via our Client Referral and Employee Referral Program’s. Refer and earn – tap your network for net-worth.</li><li>Planning a vacation? Looking for car insurance? Get access to Qualitest Employee Perks for discounts on anything from travel to electronics. With so many offerings the savings are endless!</li><li>A Competitive pay, the salary range for the role is $80,000 - $105,000 </li><li>Visit our website at www.qualitestgroup.com </li><li>Check out our Career page: https://qualitestgroup.com/careers/</li></ul></ul>

title: Ocean Import Coordinator
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>As a Platform Engineer(DevOps), you will build, maintain, and support the OpenShift Container Platform in a DevOps model. You’ll use code to bridge the gap between software and hardware and produce an efficient and reliable infrastructure. By harnessing your creativity and passion for continuous learning, you’ll create a fully digitized end-to-end process for managing the lifecycle of infrastructure resources. You’ll deploy programmable, easily customizable infrastructure that embraces change and automates the deployment process to reduce risk. You’ll also analyze all platform level changes, monitor application impact, and provide appropriate technical solutions to resolve all issues quickly and efficiently. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Understanding of OpenShift / k8s Master control plane components. </li><li>Understanding of k8s operator model. </li><li>Understanding of any one OpenShift / K8s supported Networking CNI. (Plus if you know Calico ) </li><li>High level understanding of AWS infrastructure (VPC / Security groups / EC2 / Storages / Load Balancers) </li><li>Understanding of platform automation products like RH ACM / Terraform / Ansible</li><li>Programing skills in Golang language (is a Super Advantage) </li><li>Scripting languages like shell / Helm modules or some programming experience. </li><li>Nice to have event driven programing understanding. </li><li>Any cloud experience like Azure / Google as infra as a service provider </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. description_json: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>As a Platform Engineer(DevOps), you will build, maintain, and support the OpenShift Container Platform in a DevOps model. You’ll use code to bridge the gap between software and hardware and produce an efficient and reliable infrastructure. By harnessing your creativity and passion for continuous learning, you’ll create a fully digitized end-to-end process for managing the lifecycle of infrastructure resources. You’ll deploy programmable, easily customizable infrastructure that embraces change and automates the deployment process to reduce risk. You’ll also analyze all platform level changes, monitor application impact, and provide appropriate technical solutions to resolve all issues quickly and efficiently. (Plus if you know Calico ) </li><li>High level understanding of AWS infrastructure (VPC / Security groups / EC2 / Storages / Load Balancers) </li><li>Understanding of platform automation products like RH ACM / Terraform / Ansible</li><li>Programing skills in Golang language (is a Super Advantage) </li><li>Scripting languages like shell / Helm modules or some programming experience. </li><li>Nice to have event driven programing understanding. </li><li>Any cloud experience like Azure / Google as infra as a service provider </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. title: Software Engineer - Hybrid Chicago
description: <strong>Overview<br><br></strong><strong> PLS ® : People. Location. Service <br><br></strong>PLS—which stands for People – Location - Service—is a leading retail provider of alternative financial services. The PLS Group, headquartered in Chicago, is comprised of over 200 financial service centers in 12 states. Through our check cashing stores, we provide consumers with convenient financial products and services to help them manage their day-to-day financial needs. Although many of our customers have banking relationships, we believe that our customers use our financial services because they are convenient, transparent, and frequently more affordable than available traditional alternatives. PLS was founded in 1997 by Bob and Dan Wolfberg, who serve as Co-Presidents.<br><br><strong> Position Overview: <br><br></strong>Codes, tests, maintain, and documents computer programs, working under limited supervision. Creates reports and associated database stored procedures. The developer works with senior development staff and database administrator in the support of business applications. This is an entry-level position in support of business applications and senior development staff.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br><br></strong><strong> Job Responsibilities: <br></strong><ul><li> Identify and/or resolve technical issues (troubleshooting). </li><li> Assist Project Manager in gathering data on software products that are available in the marketplace. </li><li> Assist Project Manager in determination and recommendation for product support/non-support. </li><li> Prepares reports outlining systems or revisions. </li><li> Analyzes new system's functions and use of information in the development of general specifications. Reviews general specifications to develop detailed specifications. </li><li> Performs specialized programming tasks requiring a high degree of technical proficiency in such areas as database, data communications, and the client server architecture. </li><li> Codes, tests and documents with .Net, C# and MS-SQL according to systems standards. </li><li> Prepares test data for unit, system, integration and parallel testing. </li><li> Establishes and maintains user's knowledge and confidence in the systems in order to ensure its full potential is realized. This entails: Conducting staff training including presentations and demonstrations at User locations; and advising on operational problems. . </li><li> Investigates operational or systematic problems and user queries arising during day‑to‑day running and provides solutions to them. </li><li> Package/assemble and test software products in our technical environment. </li><li> Document and communicate technical requirements and issues to product vendors. </li><li> Provide technical training to test labs. </li><li> Deploy features and functions of product to the PLS store environment. </li><li> Effectively communicate store status and support issues. </li><li> Programming ability in the .Net platform, the C# language, and SSRS. </li><li> Knowledge of Microsoft programming technologies, such as Sockets, Web Services, Threading, .Net Reporting, and COM. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Key Customers:<br></strong><ul><li> IT Management </li><li> Business Analysts </li><li> PMO <br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications<br><br></strong><strong> Job Requirements: <br></strong><ul><li> Bachelor of Science within the discipline of Information Technology. </li><li> One or more years of software application development. <br><br></li></ul><strong> Physical Requirements: <br></strong><ul><li> Must be able to sit and/or stand for long periods of time </li><li> Ability to lift 15 lbs. <br><br></li></ul><strong> Benefits: <br><br></strong>Benefits for eligible employees include medical/dental/vision, 401k, vacation, opportunities for advancement, on-going training available.<br><br><strong> We strive to demonstrate our Core Values in all positions at PLS: <br><br></strong>Communication<br><ul><li>Customer Focus</li><li>Integrity and Trust</li><li>Teamwork</li><li>Results<br><br></li></ul>PLS Financial Services is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, marital status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. PLS Financial Services will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. PLS Financial Services is a drug-free workplace. PLS provides reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities. If you need a reasonable accommodation for any part of the application and hiring process, please notify your Recruiter or a member of our Human Resources team talent@PLS247.com to make arrangements. The decision on granting reasonable accommodation will be made on a case-by-case basis.

title: ODI Developer with EDI X12
description: Position Summary...<p><br></p>What you'll do...<p><br></p>www.walmartconnect.com<p><br></p>Walmart Connect is building industry defining omni-channel retail analytics capabilities that enable brand advertisers to invest strategically, confidently, and effectively. If you are motivated by complex, purposeful challenges; Walmart Connect has the stability and fit you are looking for.<p><br></p>Our Measurements Data Scientist have years of professional experience in Advertising and Marketing Measurements determining the impact of our clients marketing efforts and ad campaigns. They lead communications and interactions with our clients and stakeholders. They present their findings and make recommendations that have a direct impact on our clients and stakeholders ROAS and ROI. They partner with cross-functional team to streamline data science solutions.<p><br></p>LOCATION: Chicago, IL This position requires a hybrid in-office schedule.<p><br></p>You'll sweep us off our feet if...<p><br></p><ul><li>You're proficient in modeling algorithms and programming languages</li><li>Must have professional experience in Digital Advertising, Retail Media, and Ads measurement</li><li>You're comfortable influencing others, communicating clearly with clients and working with cross functional stakeholders</li><li>You're customer-centric in spirit and in execution</li><li>You have a test and learn mentality and an agile way of working to improve your solutions</li><li>You are adaptable and don't miss a beat with changing asks</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>To Be Considered You Must Have ALL Of This</u></strong><p><br></p>2-4 years current professional experience as a Data Scientist in with Linear Regression, Statistics, Quantitative Analysis<p><br></p>2-4 years current professional experience as a Data Scientist with Marketing Mix Modeling (MMM) and advertising technology platforms<p><br></p>2-4 years current professional experience as a Data Scientist with Machine Learning, Predictive Modeling, and Optimization<p><br></p>2-4 years current professional experience as a Data Scientist with Hands on with SQL and Python<p><br></p>2-4 years current professional experience as a Data Scientist Presenting to Client, Stakeholder, Internal and External Teams about Measurements, ROAS, ROI, KPI, and similar metrics.<p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p>Masters degree or higher in Statistics, Economics, Operations Research, or related field<p><br></p>Experience with advertising technology platforms Ad servers, DSPs, DMPs, etc.<p><br></p>#WMC #datascience #walmartconnect<p><br></p><strong><u>Minimum Qualifications...</u></strong><p><br></p>Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications.<p><br></p>Option 1: Bachelors degree in Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology or related field and 2 years' experience in an analytics or related field. Option 2: Masters degree in Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology or related field. Option 3: 4 years' experience in an analytics or related field.<p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Qualifications...</u></strong><p><br></p>Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications.<p><br></p>Data science, machine learning, optimization models, Master's degree in Machine Learning, Computer Science, Information Technology, Operations Research, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Econometrics, Successful completion of one or more assessments in Python, Spark, Scala, or R, Using open source frameworks (for example, scikit learn, tensorflow, torch)<p><br></p>Primary Location...<p><br></p>125 S CLARK STREET, CHICAGO, IL 60603-0000, United States of America<p><br></p>

title: #10004 - Quality Assurance Analyst
description: WorldQuant develops and deploys systematic financial strategies across a broad range of asset classes and global markets. We seek to produce high-quality predictive signals (alphas) through our proprietary research platform to employ financial strategies focused on market inefficiencies. Our teams work collaboratively to drive the production of alphas and financial strategies – the foundation of a balanced, global investment platform.<p><br></p>WorldQuant is built on a culture that pairs academic sensibility with accountability for results. Employees are encouraged to think openly about problems, balancing intellectualism and practicality. Excellent ideas come from anyone, anywhere. Employees are encouraged to challenge conventional thinking and possess an attitude of continuous improvement.<p><br></p>Our goal is to hire the best and the brightest. We value intellectual horsepower first and foremost, and people who demonstrate an outstanding talent. There is no roadmap to future success, so we need people who can help us build it.<p><br></p><strong>The Role</strong>: We are seeking a highly-qualified Trading Systems Engineer to work in our Front Office Technology group. This team is responsible for building both the large-scale quantitative-research platforms that drive WorldQuant’s operations and for building the global execution systems that execute WorldQuant’s strategies in global financial markets. We are looking for someone who will be responsible for developing, extending, monitoring, configuring, and troubleshooting a complex and distributed platform. Responsibilities (include, but not limited to the following):<p><br></p><ul><li>Provide support for the real-time global execution system. Manage and improve operational infrastructure</li><li>Troubleshoot critical production issues, identifying and patching bugs and inefficiencies</li><li>Handle configuration, testing, installation, monitoring of applications and back end processes of a complex platform</li><li>Handle numerous requests sent by users, follow-up with users, and work with other groups on resolving issues</li><li>Analyze and optimize latencies</li><li>Participate in all facets of a project’s life cycle from design, implementation, testing, documentation and deployment, with a focus on deployment and production support</li><li>Coordinate with other technology groups around releases and upgrades</li><li>Interact with developers, quants, portfolio managers, and remote support staff</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You’ll Bring</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Degree in engineering or related field</li><li>Experience with DevOps lifecycle</li><li>Strong ability to understand source control systems and how they work</li><li>Experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (Experience with Gitlab CI is a plus)</li><li>Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases</li><li>Experience with Python scripting and debugging C++ code</li><li>Experience with change management in a regulated / critical environment such as finance</li></ul><p><br></p>WorldQuant is a total compensation organization where you will be eligible for a base salary, discretionary performance bonus, and benefits. The estimated salary range for this position is $125,000 to $250,000 which is specific to New York and may change in the future. When finalizing an offer we will take into consideration an individual’s experience level and the qualifications they bring to the role to formulate a competitive total compensation package.<p><br></p>By submitting this application, you acknowledge and consent to terms of the WorldQuant Privacy Policy. The privacy policy offers an explanation of how and why your data will be collected, how it will be used and disclosed, how it will be retained and secured, and what legal rights are associated with that data (including the rights of access, correction, and deletion). The policy also describes legal and contractual limitations on these rights. The specific rights and obligations of individuals living and working in different areas may vary by jurisdiction.<p><br></p>Copyright © 2023 WorldQuant, LLC. All Rights Reserved.<p><br></p>WorldQuant is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in hiring on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation or preference, age, marital status, citizenship, national origin, disability, military status, genetic predisposition or carrier status, or any other protected characteristic as established by applicable law.

Manage and improve operational infrastructure</li><li>Troubleshoot critical production issues, identifying and patching bugs and inefficiencies</li><li>Handle configuration, testing, installation, monitoring of applications and back end processes of a complex platform</li><li>Handle numerous requests sent by users, follow-up with users, and work with other groups on resolving issues</li><li>Analyze and optimize latencies</li><li>Participate in all facets of a project’s life cycle from design, implementation, testing, documentation and deployment, with a focus on deployment and production support</li><li>Coordinate with other technology groups around releases and upgrades</li><li>Interact with developers, quants, portfolio managers, and remote support staff</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You’ll Bring</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Degree in engineering or related field</li><li>Experience with DevOps lifecycle</li><li>Strong ability to understand source control systems and how they work</li><li>Experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (Experience with Gitlab CI is a plus)</li><li>Advanced working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases</li><li>Experience with Python scripting and debugging C++ code</li><li>Experience with change management in a regulated / critical environment such as finance</li></ul><p><br></p>WorldQuant is a total compensation organization where you will be eligible for a base salary, discretionary performance bonus, and benefits. The estimated salary range for this position is $125,000 to $250,000 which is specific to New York and may change in the future. When finalizing an offer we will take into consideration an individual’s experience level and the qualifications they bring to the role to formulate a competitive total compensation package.<p><br></p>By submitting this application, you acknowledge and consent to terms of the WorldQuant Privacy Policy. The privacy policy offers an explanation of how and why your data will be collected, how it will be used and disclosed, how it will be retained and secured, and what legal rights are associated with that data (including the rights of access, correction, and deletion). The policy also describes legal and contractual limitations on these rights. The specific rights and obligations of individuals living and working in different areas may vary by jurisdiction.<p><br></p>Copyright © 2023 WorldQuant, LLC. All Rights Reserved.<p><br></p>WorldQuant is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate in hiring on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, sex, sexual orientation or preference, age, marital status, citizenship, national origin, disability, military status, genetic predisposition or carrier status, or any other protected characteristic as established by applicable law.

title: Infrastructure Engineer (Platform)
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork, and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>As an Infrastructure Engineer (SharePoint Developer), you will be responsible for building, configuring, and customizing a modern Intranet solution utilizing modern SharePoint &amp; Microsoft Viva Connections. Additionally, you will own and build out the governance process for managing M365 integrations, MS graph API, power automate, and power applications. Responsibilities include building systems according to company specifications, building Microsoft Viva adaptive cards, writing, and modifying code, debugging software and training staff.<p><br></p>The ideal candidate will have the following skills: Modern SharePoint Design, Microsoft Graph API, UI/UX design process, proficient with .Net, JavaScript, C#, CSS &amp; HTML, Microsoft framework, and automation applications (power applications, power automate).<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Delivers technology solutions that support business goals. Partners with the product owner to understand business requirements, evaluates features, and translates application specifications into workable technical solutions.</li><li>Maintains application software and systems. Ensures all projects and releases are appropriately tested and risks are mitigated. </li><li>Oversees and reviews development activities of team members and contractors.</li><li>Supports technical initiatives and provides input best practices to team.</li><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>In depth knowledge with PowerShell scripting and automation builds</li><li>Familiar with Jira and Agile Scrum methods (ceremonies)</li><li>Actively fosters the adoption of new technologies</li><li>Continues professional education and create opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices</li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability</li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy event</li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities</li><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview<p><br></p>#Remote<p><br></p>#BI-Remote<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)<p><br></p>

title: Application Services Developer 1
description: <ul><li>Act as this growth stage (self funded) startup's frontend expert|Work with CSS, HTML, JavaScript and modern technologies like React and Angular<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>About Our Client<br><br></strong>Our client is a growth stage self funded start-up based just north of the city of Chicago. They have created a sports management system that powers scheduling and payments for sports organizations across the US.<br><br><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong>This Front-end Developer will act as the expert of all front-end development on projects and initiatives. This individual will contribute code in bi-weekly agile sprints, help CTO and other Sr Leaders plan long term vision and strategy, and have the opportunity to step up to a team leadership role as the front-end team grows long-term. This team member will be expected to be Hybrid 1x/week out of their Highland Park, IL office.<br><br><em>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.<br><br></em><strong>The Successful Applicant<br><br></strong><ul><li>6-8 years of Front-end Development experience</li><li>Technologies: JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and React</li><li>Agile experience</li><li>Team first mentality</li><li>Strong communication skills</li></ul><strong>What's on Offer<br></strong><ul><li>Base salary ranging from $110k-$160k dependent on experience and expertise brought to the role</li><li>80-85% of all health care out of pocket costs covered</li><li>6% 401k match</li><li>Unlimited PTO (avg 5 weeks)</li><li>Office closed last 2 weeks of calendar year</li><li>Metra commuter benefits<br></li></ul><strong>Contact: Jordan Kurth<br><br></strong><strong>Quote job ref: JN-062023-6093864</strong>

title: Associate Data Scientist
description: <strong>Key Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design, deploy and maintain IAM solutions to manage internal and external user access to our cloud based applications and services</li><li>Develop, implement and maintain automated IAM workflows and processes using e.g., AWS Cognito, Azure AD, MS Entra</li><li>Collaborate with cross functional teams to integrate IAM solutions with other in-house developed platforms and solutions</li><li>Collaborate with the security monitoring team to monitor and analyze IAM metrics and logs to identify security issues</li><li>Provide technical expertise and support to mobile and web development teams to ensure that IAM requirements are met during the development process</li><li>Stay up-to-date with industry trends and developments in IAM technologies and risks and recommend changes to improve our IAM solutions</li><li>Other duties as assigned</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer science, Information technology or related field</li><li>4+ years of experience in DevOps or IAM engineering roles</li><li>Strong experience with AWS security best practices, including IAM, KMS and Cloudtrail</li><li>Hands on experience with AWS Cognito, including user authentication, authorization and security flows</li><li>Extra bonus - hands one experience with Azure AD and MS Entra</li><li>Experience with automation tools, such as Terraform</li><li>Excellent problem solving and troubleshooting skills</li><li>Be flexible to Hybrid and live in Chicago.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong> Nice To Have </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Basic knowledge of cryptocurrency and blockchains</li><li>General passion and knowledge of fintech and crypto</li></ul><p><br></p>Oscar Associates Limited (US) is acting as an Employment Agency in relation to this vacancy.

title: Data Scientist - Ads Measurement - Chicago, IL
description: This is an environment <strong>unlike anything</strong> <strong>in the high-tech world</strong> and the secret of Costco’s success is its culture. The value Costco puts on its employees is well documented in articles from a variety of publishers including Bloomberg and Forbes. Our employees and our members come FIRST. Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. In 2018, Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals.<p><br></p>Costco IT is responsible for the <strong>technical future of Costco Wholesale</strong>, the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the <strong>top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers”</strong>.<p><br></p>Costco is seeking a dedicated and experienced <strong>Software Developer</strong> to join our Merchandising Solutions team. The selected candidate will be responsible for analysis, solution design, development, successful deployment and support of merchandising applications on iSeries. This position will involve working with Database, Data Development, warehouse application, transportation, ecommerce and several other teams. This role will also work closely with Business end-users in the Buying Department, Solution Architects, Product Owners, Product Managers and Business Analysts. Responsibilities will include coordinating, mentoring, incident ticket management, on-call production support, collaborating and leading others on development and delivery of solutions following Costco’s change management policies, procedures and SDLC. Experience with iSeries development and a commitment to/passion for delivering quality solutions is a must.<p><br></p>If you want to be a part of one of the<strong> <u>BEST “to work for” companies</u> in the world</strong>, simply apply and let your career be reimagined.<p><br></p><strong> <u> ROLE </u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Analyzes, designs and develops iSeries code that supports Merchandising applications, including any interfaces with external systems that communicate with the iSeries system. </li><li> Determines programs, objects and files that need to be changed in order to deliver enhancements or new functionality to the business. </li><li> Creates functional specifications for applications supported using our standard practices, processes and procedures. </li><li> Performs design reviews, code reviews, unit testing, coordinates with development team members on development and QA tasks. </li><li> Develops technical specifications documentation. </li><li> Adheres to IT division development standards and deployment processes and procedures. </li><li> Collaborates with Business Owners, Product Owners, Product Managers, team members and QA to ensure requirements are clearly defined, understood and documented. </li><li> Participates in development estimation, deployment and release planning to ensure delivery of solutions. </li><li> Oversees 2nd level support, resolution of daily incident tickets, creation of KB articles for 1st level support and provides on-call support. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> 5 years’ functional and technical design experience. </li><li> 5 years’ programming experience with IBM iSeries, CL, RPG (including IV and Free-Format), ILE, MQ and SQL. </li><li> Experience with iSeries DB2/400, Turnover, and X Analysis. </li><li> Experience designing, developing and maintaining real-time large scale business applications. </li><li> Strong data analysis skills, particularly with iSeries Database files and fields. </li><li> Experience with software development lifecycle methodologies. </li><li> Responsible for continued personal growth in areas of technology, business knowledge and Costco policies. </li><li> Strong analytical and problem solving skills with the ability to effectively negotiate with other teams to create a mutually beneficial solution. </li><li> Ability to manage and prioritize multiple requests. </li><li> Scheduling flexibility to meet the needs of the business including weekends, holidays, and 24/7 on call responsibilities on a rotational basis. </li></ul> <strong> Recommended </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Familiarity around Retail and Supply chain management specific processes. </li><li> Familiarity with data services, JSON and XML parsing on iSeries, FTP. </li><li> Familiarity with integration tools such as IBM Websphere Broker, Axway and UC4. </li><li> Familiarity with Job Schedulers like ROBOT and UC4. </li><li> Good understanding of Agile development practices and methodologies. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Documents</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Cover Letter </li><li> Resume </li></ul><p><br></p>California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice.<p><br></p>Pay Range: $125,000 - $160,000<p><br></p>We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, health benefits — medical/dental/vision/hearing aid/pharmacy/behavioral health/employee assistance, health care reimbursement account, dependent care assistance plan, commuter benefits, short-term disability and long-term disability insurance, AD&amp;D insurance, life insurance, 401(k), stock purchase plan, SmartDollar financial wellness program, to eligible employees.<p><br></p>Costco is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Costco is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or any other legally protected status. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request to IT-Recruiting@costco.com<p><br></p><strong>If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States.</strong>

iSeries Database files and fields. </li><li> Experience with software development lifecycle methodologies. </li><li> Responsible for continued personal growth in areas of technology, business knowledge and Costco policies. </li><li> Strong analytical and problem solving skills with the ability to effectively negotiate with other teams to create a mutually beneficial solution. </li><li> Ability to manage and prioritize multiple requests. </li><li> Scheduling flexibility to meet the needs of the business including weekends, holidays, and 24/7 on call responsibilities on a rotational basis. </li></ul> <strong> Recommended </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Familiarity around Retail and Supply chain management specific processes. </li><li> Familiarity with data services, JSON and XML parsing on iSeries, FTP. </li><li> Familiarity with integration tools such as IBM Websphere Broker, Axway and UC4. </li><li> Familiarity with Job Schedulers like ROBOT and UC4. </li><li> Good understanding of Agile development practices and methodologies. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Required Documents</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Cover Letter </li><li> Resume </li></ul><p><br></p>California applicants, please click here to review the Costco Applicant Privacy Notice.<p><br></p>Pay Range: $125,000 - $160,000<p><br></p>We offer a comprehensive package of benefits including paid time off, health benefits — medical/dental/vision/hearing aid/pharmacy/behavioral health/employee assistance, health care reimbursement account, dependent care assistance plan, commuter benefits, short-term disability and long-term disability insurance, AD&amp;D insurance, life insurance, 401(k), stock purchase plan, SmartDollar financial wellness program, to eligible employees.<p><br></p>Costco is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Costco is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or any other legally protected status. If you need assistance and/or a reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, please send a request to IT-Recruiting@costco.com<p><br></p><strong>If hired, you will be required to provide proof of authorization to work in the United States.</strong>

title: Infrastructure Engineer (SharePoint Developer)
description: If you are a Linux Embedded Software Engineer with experience, please read on!<br><br>Salary: $110k-$140k+<br><br>Location: Hartford WI<br><br>WFH 2-3 times per week<br><br>What You Will Be Doing<br><br>Design, develop, and test firmware and applications on the company's hardware running Linux operating system.<br><ul><li> Designing and developing Linux BSP</li><li> Designing and developing Linux Applications</li><li> Provide customer technical support</li><li> Provide product support (Production, resolving bugs, etc.)<br></li></ul>What You Need for this Position<br><ul><li> 2+ Years of Linux Embedded Development Experience<br></li></ul><strong><u>You Should Know Some Of The Following<br></u></strong><ul><li> C/C++</li><li> Embedded Development</li><li> Scripting (Bash, Python, etc.)</li><li> Linux Kernal</li><li> Microprocessor peripheral driver development</li><li> working with hardware, schematics, and component data sheets</li><li> SVN</li><li> GIT</li><li> U-Boot or other standard boot loaders</li><li> GNU<br></li></ul>What's In It for You<br><ul><li> Great work environment</li><li> Amazing/Generous compensation package</li><li> Generous PTO</li><li> Full Benefits</li><li> 401(k) Plan</li><li>More!<br></li></ul>If you're interested, please provide the following to get the ball rolling:<br><ul><li> Updated resume</li><li> Salary requirements (a range would suffice)</li><li> Interview availability this week<br></li></ul>My email is Justin.Johnson@cybercoders.com.<br><br><strong><u>Email Your Resume In Word To<br><br></u></strong>Looking forward to receiving your resume through our website and going over the position with you. Clicking apply is the best way to apply, but you may also:<br><br>Justin.Johnson@CyberCoders.com<br><ul><li>Please do NOT change the email subject line in any way. You must keep the JobID: linkedin : JJ5-1739045L208 -- in the email subject line for your application to be considered.***<br></li></ul>Justin Johnson - Lead Recruiter - CyberCoders<br><br>Applicants must be authorized to work in the U.S.<br><br><strong>CyberCoders is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer<br><br></strong>All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.<br><br><strong>Your Right to Work</strong> – In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.<br><br>

title: Frontend Developer - Hybrid
description: <strong>Chicago / Low Latency Linux Environment</strong><p><br></p>This Jobot Job is hosted by: Katrina McFillin<p><br></p>Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button and sending us your resume.<p><br></p>Salary: $120,000 - $160,000 per year<p><br></p><strong>A bit about us:</strong><p><br></p>We are a global trading firm committed to leveraging technology and quantitative research to implement a diverse set of trading strategies while managing risk and responding to dynamic market conditions.<p><br></p><strong>Why join us?</strong><p><br></p>We are a team of collaborative, entrepreneurs who thrive on innovation and building greatness. We are truly passionate about what we are building and looking for likeminded individuals who want to wear multiple hats and chart their own course.<p><br></p>In addition to working with a group of passionate and determined people we also value the time and work you put in daily and want to reward the best way possible.<p><br></p>Benefits:<p><br></p>401(k)<p><br></p>Blue Cross and Blue Shield PPO plan with the employer paying 100% of employee premiums and 50% of their dependents<p><br></p>Unlimited PTO<p><br></p>12 weeks of paid maternity/paternity leave<p><br></p>Bonus based on individual performance and company performance<p><br></p>Short and long-term disability<p><br></p>multi-monitor setup with laptop etc.<p><br></p>Office stocked with food and beverages<p><br></p><strong>Job Details</strong><p><br></p>Your primary focus will be around installing, building, deploying, and optimizing low-latency Linux servers (both bare metal and virtual). You will also be building and automating CI/CD pipelines, and working on operating system and networking upgrades. This position has no limits. There is plenty of opportunity to roll your sleeves up and tackle multiple projects in different areas. The majority of our environment is Linux based but there is some Windows as well. Our research and development arm is all built in AWS. So the majority of your time will be spent working with the physical servers but there will be opportunity to work with AWS and virtual machines as well.<p><br></p>You are someone who has a strong Linux background, worked heavily with ansible, has done scripting with either bash or python and has experience working with bare metal servers. Experience with windows and AWS is a plus.<p><br></p>Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button. Linux Engineer

title: IAM Engineer
description: <strong>Job#: 1330430</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p><u><strong>API Developer </strong></u><p><br></p><strong>Job Description: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>This position is on the API Management team within Digital. The team is responsible for the process, controls, and tools that support API development, security, publishing, consumption, and monitoring.</li><li>Competent to perform all programming, project management, and development assignments without close supervision; normally assigned the more complex aspects of systems work.</li><li>Works directly on complex application/technical problem identification and resolution, including responding to off-shift and weekend support calls.</li><li>Works independently on complex systems or infrastructure components that may be used by one or more applications or systems.</li><li>Drives application development focused around delivering business valuable features</li><li>Maintains high standards of software quality within the team by establishing good practices and habits 6. Identifies and encourage areas for growth and improvement within the team</li><li>Guide the team to develop a structured application/interface code, new program documentation, operations documentation, and user guides in a casual, flexible environment.</li><li>Communicate with end-users and internal customers to help direct the development, debugging, and testing of application software for accuracy, integrity, interoperability, and completeness.</li><li>Performs integrated testing and customer acceptance testing of components that requires careful planning and execution to ensure timely, quality results.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Typical Day</strong>:<p><br></p><ul><li>Work within API Management team, hands-on APIGEE Edge, OAS Spec review, Proxy development. Hybrid work, need to be at located at commutable distance from Chicago. There will be an in person interview.</li><li>Will be working with team members across the world virtually. Will also be interacting with team members in the Chicago office twice a week.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education/Experience:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Position requires a four-year degree from an accredited college or university. 2. 2+ years or more of software development experience</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Technical Skills Required</strong>:<p><br></p>(Required)<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience writing API proxies on platforms such as Apigee Edge, AWS API Gateway or Azure API Gateway or similar.</li><li>Hands on experience with API tools such as Swagger Editor &amp; Postman, and linting tools like Spectral.</li><li>Knowledge of security standards such as OAuth 2.0 and TLS.</li></ul><p><br></p>(Desired)<p><br></p><ul><li>Familiarity working in a Scrum environment</li><li>Must demonstrate solid knowledge of computer science fundamentals like data structures and algorithms.</li><li>Hands on experience with metrics and visualization tools like Kibana, Grafana, or equivalent.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Soft Skills Required:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Excellent written and verbal skills</li><li>Ability to work under pressure and within time constraints.</li><li>Passion for technology and an eagerness to contribute to a team-oriented environment.</li><li>Must be reliable and proactive – able to work independently and meet deadlines.</li></ul><p><br></p>EEO Employer<p><br></p>Apex Systems is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate or allow discrimination on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related medical conditions), age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, genetic information, registered domestic partner status, marital status, disability, status as a crime victim, protected veteran status, political affiliation, union membership, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please contact our Employee Services Department at [email protected] or 844-463-6178.<p><br></p>Apex Systems is a world-class IT services company that serves thousands of clients across the globe. When you join Apex, you become part of a team that values innovation, collaboration, and continuous learning. We offer quality career resources, training, certifications, development opportunities, and a comprehensive benefits package. Our commitment to excellence is reflected in many awards, including ClearlyRated's Best of Staffing® in Talent Satisfaction in the United States and Great Place to Work® in the United Kingdom and Mexico.<p><br></p>Apex Systems is a world-class IT services company that serves thousands of clients across the globe. title: iSeries Software Developer
description: <strong>Description</strong><p><br></p>KBX Technologies is looking for a Software Technical Lead to join our team! The role will be part of a team of engineers that are responsible for building, supporting and enhancing our external and internal integrations capability. Responsibilities include working with our internal teams to understand APIs, documenting integrations, working with customers to establish integrations, participate and build a community of practice around our integration capabilities. We are seeking an individual that possesses strong collaboration and communication skills, with a strong track record of displaying high initiative and ownership of opportunities.<p><br></p>KBX Technology Solutions provides logistics solutions for its customers through innovative technology that help deliver actionable intelligence, eliminate waste and redundancies, and create greater operational efficiencies in the marketplace. KBX Technology Solutions is a subsidiary of KBX – a Koch Industries Inc. company – and complements all KBX subsidiaries (Rail, Logistics, and International) to drive enhanced data and analytics across the global supply chain for customers. Based in Wichita, Kansas, Koch Industries is one of the largest private companies in America, with estimated annual revenues as high as $115 billion, according to Forbes. For more information on KBX, visit www.KBX.com.<p><br></p>What You Will Do In Your Role<p><br></p><ul><li>Work independently, or within the construct of a product team, to understand customer and business requirements to deliver creative solutions which meet or exceed those business needs</li><li>Execution of this role will involve both the deployment of standardized integrations and the creation of new solutions and services as required to meet customer needs</li><li>Produce and maintain documentation to support solutions that you have developed/deployed to aid in the support of the solution</li><li>Automating our operational processes as needed</li><li>Working with a team of engineers and analysts through discovery, delivery, and support of new platforms that are focused on the transformation of our transportation management systems</li><li>Ensuring delivery of technical solutions that meet the business outcomes, consistent with software development standards and best practices for a service-oriented architecture</li><li>Develop, test and deploy solutions based on requirements.</li></ul><p><br></p>The Experience You Will Bring<p><br></p>Requirements:<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience serving as a lead software developer/engineer building, supporting and enhancing applications in a cloud environment</li><li>Experience creating web services/API development with REST and SOAP protocols, XML and JSON formats, GRPC </li><li>Experience with TFS/VSTS/Azure DevOps, CI/CD and Fiddler, SoapUI, Postman or equivalent tools </li><li>Experience with C#, .NET and SQL</li><li>Experience conducting peer reviews with software developers </li></ul><p><br></p>What Will Put You Ahead<p><br></p><ul><li>Degree in Computer Science/MIS, Engineering, or equivalent</li><li>Transportation knowledge ranging from WMS, ERP and external vendor integrations.</li><li>Experience working in a microservices environment</li><li>Experience with containerization and virtualization, Infrastructure as Code (Helm Charts, YAML, CloudFormation, or similar tools) and AWS technology stack (EC2 Instances &amp; Volumes, S3 Buckets, IAM Policies)</li><li>Experience programming with Visual Basic .NET</li><li>Experience with General Queuing Technologies (RabbitMQ\Apache-Kafka) </li><li>Experience developing ASP.NET Web Forms, ASP.NET MVC, Angular Version 2 (NgRx Store Redux pattern) </li></ul><p><br></p>Our goal is for each employee, and their families, to live fulfilling and healthy lives. We provide essential resources and support to build and maintain physical, financial, and emotional strength - focusing on overall wellbeing so you can focus on what matters most. Our benefits plan includes - medical, dental, vision, flexible spending and health savings accounts, life insurance, ADD, disability, retirement, paid vacation/time off, educational assistance, and may also include infertility assistance, paid parental leave and adoption assistance. Specific eligibility criteria is set by the applicable Summary Plan Description, policy or guideline and benefits may vary by geographic region. If you have questions on what benefits apply to you, please speak to your recruiter.<p><br></p>At Koch companies, we are entrepreneurs. This means we openly challenge the status quo, find new ways to create value and get rewarded for our individual contributions. Any compensation range provided for a role is an estimate determined by available market data. industry: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage
description_json: <strong>Description</strong><p><br></p>KBX Technologies is looking for a Software Technical Lead to join our team! The role will be part of a team of engineers that are responsible for building, supporting and enhancing our external and internal integrations capability. Responsibilities include working with our internal teams to understand APIs, documenting integrations, working with customers to establish integrations, participate and build a community of practice around our integration capabilities. We are seeking an individual that possesses strong collaboration and communication skills, with a strong track record of displaying high initiative and ownership of opportunities.<p><br></p>KBX Technology Solutions provides logistics solutions for its customers through innovative technology that help deliver actionable intelligence, eliminate waste and redundancies, and create greater operational efficiencies in the marketplace. KBX Technology Solutions is a subsidiary of KBX – a Koch Industries Inc. company – and complements all KBX subsidiaries (Rail, Logistics, and International) to drive enhanced data and analytics across the global supply chain for customers. Based in Wichita, Kansas, Koch Industries is one of the largest private companies in America, with estimated annual revenues as high as $115 billion, according to Forbes. For more information on KBX, visit www.KBX.com.<p><br></p>What You Will Do In Your Role<p><br></p><ul><li>Work independently, or within the construct of a product team, to understand customer and business requirements to deliver creative solutions which meet or exceed those business needs</li><li>Execution of this role will involve both the deployment of standardized integrations and the creation of new solutions and services as required to meet customer needs</li><li>Produce and maintain documentation to support solutions that you have developed/deployed to aid in the support of the solution</li><li>Automating our operational processes as needed</li><li>Working with a team of engineers and analysts through discovery, delivery, and support of new platforms that are focused on the transformation of our transportation management systems</li><li>Ensuring delivery of technical solutions that meet the business outcomes, consistent with software development standards and best practices for a service-oriented architecture</li><li>Develop, test and deploy solutions based on requirements.</li></ul><p><br></p>The Experience You Will Bring<p><br></p>Requirements:<p><br></p><ul><li>Experience serving as a lead software developer/engineer building, supporting and enhancing applications in a cloud environment</li><li>Experience creating web services/API development with REST and SOAP protocols, XML and JSON formats, GRPC </li><li>Experience with TFS/VSTS/Azure DevOps, CI/CD and Fiddler, SoapUI, Postman or equivalent tools </li><li>Experience with C#, .NET and SQL</li><li>Experience conducting peer reviews with software developers </li></ul><p><br></p>What Will Put You Ahead<p><br></p><ul><li>Degree in Computer Science/MIS, Engineering, or equivalent</li><li>Transportation knowledge ranging from WMS, ERP and external vendor integrations.</li><li>Experience working in a microservices environment</li><li>Experience with containerization and virtualization, Infrastructure as Code (Helm Charts, YAML, CloudFormation, or similar tools) and AWS technology stack (EC2 Instances &amp; Volumes, S3 Buckets, IAM Policies)</li><li>Experience programming with Visual Basic .NET</li><li>Experience with General Queuing Technologies (RabbitMQ\Apache-Kafka) </li><li>Experience developing ASP.NET Web Forms, ASP.NET MVC, Angular Version 2 (NgRx Store Redux pattern) </li></ul><p><br></p>Our goal is for each employee, and their families, to live fulfilling and healthy lives. We provide essential resources and support to build and maintain physical, financial, and emotional strength - focusing on overall wellbeing so you can focus on what matters most. Our benefits plan includes - medical, dental, vision, flexible spending and health savings accounts, life insurance, ADD, disability, retirement, paid vacation/time off, educational assistance, and may also include infertility assistance, paid parental leave and adoption assistance. Specific eligibility criteria is set by the applicable Summary Plan Description, policy or guideline and benefits may vary by geographic region. If you have questions on what benefits apply to you, please speak to your recruiter.<p><br></p>At Koch companies, we are entrepreneurs. This means we openly challenge the status quo, find new ways to create value and get rewarded for our individual contributions. Any compensation range provided for a role is an estimate determined by available market data. The actual amount may be higher or lower than the range provided considering each candidate’s knowledge, skills, abilities, and geographic location. If you have questions, please speak to your recruiter about the flexibility and detail of our compensation philosophy.<p><br></p>For this role, we anticipate paying $130,000 - $150,000 per year. This role is eligible for variable pay, issued as a monetary bonus or in another form.<p><br></p>Equal Opportunity Employer.<p><br></p>Except where prohibited by state law, all offers of employment are conditioned upon successfully passing a drug test.<p><br></p>This employer uses E-Verify. Please visit the following website for additional information: www.kochcareers.com/doc/Everify.pdf

description: <strong>What Will You Be Working On?</strong><p><br></p>Seeking passionate developers with the quality-oriented mindset to join the iManage team as Software Engineers in Test. This position will work on Agile teams, will closely collaborate with development, user experience, quality assurance organizations as well as product stakeholders. Candidates must have knowledge of major programming languages and scripting languages. Experience with Operating Systems, databases and networking is expected. Knowledge of Software Development methodologies is also required, with special emphasis on unit testing, performance testing and continuous integration.<p><br></p><strong>Key Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Analyzes requirements/designs and determines test scripts, coding, automation, and integration activities required based on general objectives and knowledge of the overall architecture of product or solution</li><li>Designs and builds test environments and data sets</li><li>Represents the software quality engineering team for all phases of larger and more-complex development projects</li><li>Collaborates and communicates with team and management regarding test status, project progress, and issue resolution</li><li>Maintain awareness of current development, deployment tools, programming languages, testing, commercial and open source offerings of interest and general development trends</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Bachelor of Science in Computer Engineering or equivalent</li><li>0 - 5 years in software development or test automation development</li><li>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills</li><li>Major programming language experience (Java, C, C++, C#, etc.)</li><li>Experience with scripting (Perl, Python, VB, batch, shell, etc.)</li><li>Operating System, database and networking knowledge</li><li>Software Development methodologies</li><li>Unit testing and white-box testing</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li><li>Performance, security, stress, reliability, load testing</li><li>Mobile application testing and development</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>About IManage</strong><p><br></p>iManage transforms how professionals in legal, accounting and financial services get work done by combining the power of artificial intelligence with market leading document and email management. iManage automates routine cognitive tasks, provides powerful insights and streamlines how professionals work while maintaining the highest level of security and governance over critical client and corporate data. title: Embedded Software Engineer (HYBRID - WFH)
description: <strong>Want to be a part of our team?</strong><p><br></p>Responsible for setup and installation of technical systems, applications, or process designs for client’s purchased or outsourced technology and business process solutions. Works directly with client to manage initial access, map and transfer data, create process documentation, and train or coordinate training for client users. Tests and troubleshoots functionality of installed systems; identifies and documents technical issues to be escalated to product and system integration teams for resolution. Provides feedback based on client experiences to product and professional services teams for product and process improvements. May work directly with clients on-site or provide installation support remotely.<p><br></p><strong>Working at NTT</strong><p><br></p>The primary responsibility of the TS Implementation Engineer is to provide technical support to NTT (Ltd) clients. This includes remotely supporting clients within service level agreements (SLAs), to install and configure software and hardware, resolve incidents, perform root cause analysis and adhere to any related processes such as change management. The TS Implementation Engineer (L3) is involved in more complex environments for installation, configuration and fault management.<p><br></p><strong>Key Roles and Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Interact with clients on site to meet complex requirements of a solution. </li><li>Escalate unresolved problems and issues to the relevant third parties. </li><li>Respond to escalated client requests and support client applications to a first line resolution. </li><li>Escalate complex problems to the relevant third parties. </li><li>Write reports and proposals and complete and maintain project documentation. </li><li>Assist with the documentation of standard operating procedures relating to installations and fixes. </li><li>Act as coach and mentor to more junior Implementation Engineers and Technicians. </li><li>Assume responsibility for the co-ordination of the activities of the Engineers, in line with performance targets. </li><li>May be required to serve periodically on the customer service desk, providing third line telephonic, remote and on-site support and problem management. </li><li>Included in higher complexity design work, with input to the design expected. </li><li>Expected to take ownership of relevant technologies according to domain or specialization. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Knowledge, Skills and Attributes:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Good understanding and appreciation of technical design and business principles</li><li>Demonstrates project management and administration ability</li><li>Good project skills which are demonstrated in the execution of installations and other assignments</li><li>Demonstrate customer engagement skills</li><li>Demonstrate relevant domain specialist knowledge</li><li>Good verbal communication skills</li><li>Client focused and display a proactive approach to solving problems</li><li>Ability to work under pressure</li><li>Ability to coach, mentor and provide guidance to team members</li><li>Good understanding of project management principles</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Academic Qualifications and Certifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Computer Science / Information Technology Degree or equivalent together with specialised training in new technologies and legacy systems or equivalent</li><li>Project management certification</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Required Experience:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Solid work experience in a technical implementation engineering or similar role</li><li>Experience engaging with clients and conducting presentations</li><li>Good project administration and documentation experience</li><li>Report writing experience</li><li>Basic project management</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>What will make you a good fit for the role?</strong>
