title: APIGEE Developer
description: ABOUT US:<p><br></p>Fusion92 is an innovation-forward digital marketing agency building out its SaaS and PaaS Product Department. We deliver innovative digital experiences, and the infrastructure to support them. We work with a variety of clients across many industries who require our technological expertise. We strive to be experts in our field and never stop learning and growing. <p><br></p>For those obsessed with curiosity, to innovate amazing things together. We bring together thinkers, tinkerers, designers, writers, planners, poets, inventors, innovators, and robot makers to deliver real results, to give answers to the unanswerable. We’ve transformed businesses. We’ve launched products. We’ve patented innovations. We’ve created results-winning ideas. And we have one strong, hungry team ready to work collaboratively with you. We’re both dreamers and doers. Fully integrated. And we’re crazy about finding what matters to open the amazing.<p><br></p>Our difference is our people. That's where you come in.<p><br></p>JOB SUMMARY:<p><br></p>As our team grows, we are looking to add another full-stack developer to act primarily as a contributor but also provide leadership in the team. Our ideal hire would have 5+ years of experience in a full-stack development role and have some work examples (code and/or final product) available to show. We are a relatively small development team with a great deal of autonomy. In addition to a couple of in-house products we maintain, we take on new client projects that are heavy on the creative side, so there is always a wide variety of work. We solve interesting problems on a regular basis and are constantly streamlining our processes and tools to aid us in delivering to our clients with as little friction as possible. <p><br></p>This role can be remote or a part of our Chicago or Detroit offices.<p><br></p><ul><li>While our offices are currently open, daily in-office attendance is not required. </li></ul><p><br></p> <p><br></p>GENERAL RESPONSIBILITIES:<p><br></p><ul><li>Expert coder in C# and .NET (MVC) </li><li>Hands on experience with contemporary front end web development (HTML5, CSS3, SASS, Less, jQuery, Vue, NodeJS and AJAX) </li><li>Hands on experience with Microsoft technology stack: Azure, Visual Studio, MS SQL, Windows Server </li><li>Hands on experience with data transfer formats JSON, XML, etc. </li><li>Hands on experience with REST and SOAP </li><li>Experience with Atlassian tools JIRA, and GitHub </li><li>Can read and write functional specs’ </li><li>Can effectively communicate scope creep </li><li>Is comfortable guiding clients and project managers through complex technical architecture </li></ul><p><br></p>REQUIREMENTS:<p><br></p><ul><li>Modern front-end frameworks, Vue preferred.  </li><li>Writing maintainable and testable code.  </li><li>An eye for basic design as well as UI/UX.  </li><li>The ability to communicate effectively with both tech and non-tech-oriented team members and clients. </li><li>Must have strong communication skills (code comments/interoperability)  </li><li>Must be highly motivated, self-starter  </li><li>Must be adept at problem solving  </li><li>Must be highly organized  </li><li>5+ years of development experience within a collaborative team environment is preferred  </li><li>Experience working in a digital agency and/or Ad Tech is a plus. </li></ul><p><br></p><em>Disclaimer: All qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status affectional or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality, or sex. </em>

title: Software Technical Lead (Remote)
description: This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux, Python, and web services at scale. We are building the next generation management solution for Ubuntu in the enterprise - on premise and on the public cloud - to enable large estate observability, telemetry, security, compliance and operations. Build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.<p><br></p>Landscape is the leading management tool to deploy, monitor and manage fleets of Ubuntu systems, including package and repository management, health and security monitoring, hardware inventory, and automation. As Landscape software engineer you will be responsible for contributing on a distributed development team participating in all facets of the development process.<p><br></p>What you'll do<p><br></p><ul><li>Collaborate proactively with a distributed team</li><li>Write high-quality code to create new features, fix bugs and modernize the Landscape codebase</li><li>Demonstrate your strong commitment to code quality and automated testing</li><li>Participate in the engineering process with code and architectural reviews</li><li>Take personal ownership of problems and design and deliver solutions</li><li>Work remotely with global travel 2 to 4 weeks for internal and external events</li><li>Assist with release management during each development cycle</li><li>Collaborate with devops for Landscape SaaS, Canonical's hosted Landscape</li></ul><p><br></p>Who you are<p><br></p><ul><li>You love technology and working with brilliant people</li><li>You are curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable</li><li>You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated</li><li>You have a Bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree</li><li>You have proficiency developing public-facing APIs and web applications, preferably using Python. </li><li>Experience with Python and web frameworks such as Flask and Django. </li><li>Experience with databases, and ORMs (PostgreSQL a plus)</li><li>You are comfortable with Ubuntu as a development and deployment platform. </li></ul><p><br></p><em>Canonical is proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. We truly believe that diversity of experience, perspectives, and background will lead to a better environment for our employees and a better platform for our users and customers. This is something we value deeply and we encourage everyone to come be a part of the world of Ubuntu.</em><p><br></p>#stack<p><br></p>

Build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company.<p><br></p>Landscape is the leading management tool to deploy, monitor and manage fleets of Ubuntu systems, including package and repository management, health and security monitoring, hardware inventory, and automation. title: Java8 Streaming - Financial/Terraform/Algorithms
description: <em>At Horizon Therapeutics, we define success by the number of lives touched, lives changed, and lives saved. Our global biotechnology company is made up of agile, out-of-the-box thinkers with a focus on delivering breakthrough medicines to those living with rare, autoimmune, and severe inflammatory diseases. This is the heart of our global mission. Start a career that enables you to live up to your potential and help others live up to theirs. Join us.</em><p><br></p><em>The exceptional support we provide patients and communities equally extends to our employees. We offer industry-leading and award-winning benefits, compensation and rewards programs that positively impact all areas of our employees’ personal and professional lives.</em><p><br></p><strong>Position Summary: </strong><p><br></p>The Data Science team at Horizon Therapeutics is looking for an extraordinary Data Scientist who is passionate about crafting data science solutions that drive impact for patients. In this role you will be leveraging cutting edge artificial intelligence, algorithms, and technology to influence decisions across the organization.<p><br></p>The role requires extensive knowledge of machine learning, the creativity to correctly identify opportunities for data science to be impactful, and a passion for the life sciences. You will assist matrixed teams across multiple therapeutic areas and commercial functions. This individual should be an expert at manipulating messy data and apply object-oriented design principles to automate outputs and datasets. The Data Scientist should be experienced in moving models from development to production, and have a good sense for tracking and updating model performance.<p><br></p>Some key projects that the Data Scientist will support include physician targeting and segmentation, lead generation for our field sales teams, patient journey mapping and prediction, disease incidence and prevalence projection, and predicting patients likely to start therapy.<p><br></p><strong>Qualifications and Skills Required:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>BS in Computer Science, Statistics, Machine Learning &amp; Artificial Intelligence, Physics, Molecular Biology, Bioinformatics, or a related technical discipline</li><li>Masters degree in a relevant technical field or 1 year of relevant data science experience </li><li>Strong working knowledge of state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms and a solid grounding in traditional algorithms like linear regression, tree models, probabilistic (Bayesian) approaches, and clustering</li><li>Ability to juggle multiple projects and deadlines in a fast-paced environment</li><li>Expert proficiency with Python and SQL</li><li>Experience with Pyspark, and familiarity working in a cloud-based technology stack</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Familiarity with Healthcare Datasets such as APLD claims and/or EMR/EHR records, as well as their respective nuances</li><li>Experience in the commercial pharmaceutical space</li><li>Experience working on data science projects in a production environment</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Our Values</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Transparency: We value collaboration. Trusting teach other and tackling tough challenges can make a powerful difference.</li><li>Accountability: We do what’s right for our patient communities through quality decisions and owning our successes and failures.</li><li>Growth: We fiercely innovate and evolve to better ourselves, our communities and our patients.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>These three values come to life through our five Leadership Expectations that apply to all Horizon employees</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Enterprise Mindset: Look beyond one’s team, brand or function to see the broader company and external perspective</li><li>Exhibit Intellectual Curiosity: Seek to understand what you do not know; ask the right questions of the right people and sources</li><li>Ensure Accountability and Courage: Step up to address difficult issues and hold self and others accountable to commitments</li><li>Embrace Diverse Perspectives: Welcome others with a respectful attitude; integrate diverse perspectives into ways of working</li><li>Develop Talent: Provide feedback, coaching and mentorship to help others be more effective in their role</li></ul><p><br></p><em>At Horizon, we know that disease does not discriminate. We embrace the bold ideas of one another, foster a sense of belonging, and value inclusion. We attract and develop diverse talent because we believe that when people from different backgrounds and life experiences come together, we make lives better.</em><p><br></p><em>Horizon intends that all qualified applications are given equal opportunity, and that selection decisions be based on job-related factors. We do not discriminate based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or any other characteristics protected by law.</em>

title: Software Engineer In Test
description: <u><strong>Your Impact:</strong></u><p><br></p>Rauland Corporation is looking for a talented and passionate Requirements Engineer who wants to make an impact in the medical &amp; educational space. You can help the development teams make a real difference in innovating, designing, and developing cutting-edge products that delight customers that they use as part of their daily operations. This is a highly visible position of influence that is expected to improve customer satisfaction, R &amp; D return on investment, time to market, and scheduling accuracy while increasing skills and joy for you and the teams<p><br></p><u><strong>What You'll Do:</strong></u><p><br></p><ul><li> Translate end user requirements into a consumable form for the developers and the test team </li><li> Write clear and well-structured technical product requirements </li><li> Assist product managers in converting roadmap items into user stories as needed </li><li> Collaborate with a cross functional team to draft and secure approval of product requirements, acceptance criteria and review test cases </li><li> Analyze requirements for completeness, correctness, and other requirement development best practices </li><li> Manage the development and traceability of requirements throughout the product lifecycle </li><li> Collaborate with our quality team to maintain requirement documents in the design history file throughout the product lifecycle </li></ul><p><br></p><u><strong> What You Need: </strong></u><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor’s degree or equivalent combination of professional experience and education </li><li> 5+ years of working experience as a technical requirements engineer/analyst in a product development company </li><li> Experience developing technical requirements for a product in a regulated industry (medical device, automotive, defense, aerospace, etc.) </li><li> Familiarity with requirements management tools. </li></ul><p><br></p>If you have experience with the below, even better!<p><br></p><ul><li> Enterprise-class software requirements development for on-premises or cloud hosted applications </li><li> Mobile application requirements development </li><li> Embedded systems requirements development </li><li> Jama and / or Azure Devops </li><li> Medical device or healthcare IT industry regulated by FDA </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Why Us?</u></strong><p><br></p>Rauland, a division of AMETEK, is a business unit in the Measurement, Communications and Technologies division of AMETEK. We are a leader in integrated communications technology, designing and manufacturing Nurse Call Systems for the medical industry and school critical communication systems for the education K-12 market.<p><br></p>Website: www.rauland.com<p><br></p><strong><u>Compensation</u></strong><p><br></p>Salary Minimum: Market<p><br></p>Salary Maximum: Market<p><br></p>Incentive: No<p><br></p>Disclaimer: Where a specific pay range is noted, it is a good faith estimate at the time of this posting. The actual salary offered will be based on experience, skills, qualifications, market / business considerations, and geographic location.<br><br>AMETEK is committed to making a safer, sustainable, and more productive world a reality. We use differentiated technology solutions to solve our customers’ most complex challenges. We employ 18,500 colleagues, in 30 countries, that are grounded by our core values: Ethics and Integrity, Respect for the Individual, Diversity and Inclusion, Teamwork, and Social Responsibility. AMETEK (NYSE:AME) is a component of the S&amp;P 500. Visit www.ametek.com for more information.<br><br>We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, status as a veteran, and basis of disability or any other federal, state or local protected class. Individuals who need a reasonable accommodation because of a disability for any part of the employment process should call 1 (866) 263-8359.

title: TS Implementation Engineer (L2)
description: We are hiring a Golang software engineer to work on the low level Go codebase sitting between our REST API and the low level C libraries used to manage containers and virtual machines. We are looking for system-level developers with experience in design and data management/modeling.<p><br></p>The LXD team is responsible for the design, development and evolution of LXD, a modern system container and virtual machine manager that is widely used on Ubuntu, ChromeOS and other Linux platforms. LXD components span the entire software stack from low-level kernel features to the upper level management REST API and CLI.<p><br></p>This is an opportunity for someone who wants to have a meaningful impact on modern cloud computing technologies. Canonical offers a fun, fast-paced team environment and a career full of learning and development.<p><br></p>What you will do<p><br></p><ul><li>Design, implement and document system level Go code</li><li>Model data, design database schemas and implement data storage in a dqlite (SQL) database</li><li>Maintain code quality through static analysis, unit and system tests</li><li>Collaborate proactively with a distributed team</li><li>Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions</li><li>Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks/year for internal and external events</li></ul><p><br></p>Who you are<p><br></p><ul><li>You have experience programming in Go and C</li><li>You are knowledgeable in networking and storage technologies</li><li>You have experience with two or more of: cloud computing, virtualisation, containers, distributed systems, open source community</li><li>You are curious, flexible, articulate and accountable</li><li>You value soft skills and are enterprising, thoughtful and self-motivated</li><li>You have a bachelor's or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree</li></ul><p><br></p>Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, the world's best free software platform. Our services help businesses worldwide to reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.<p><br></p>We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.<p><br></p>#Stack<p><br></p>

title: Software Deployment Engineer
description: <strong>Role: Junior Business Analyst</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Summary</strong><p><br></p>One of our highly respected client is currently seeking a highly motivated and qualified Business Analyst to join a dynamic team responsible for ensuring the quality of important and highly visible projects. Helps implement customer-centric solutions (web, mobile and call center applications) in a cost-effective way by learning and comprehending business process, eliciting and documenting requirements, and communicating clearly to business and technology. This role requires a level of energy and assertiveness to drive work with multiple groups in a complex, busy environment. The successful candidate will possess experience with full life-cycle application development along with exposure to evaluating, coordinating and creating deliverables; meeting with customers and resolving issues. The role works across functional boundaries to connect-the-dots between IT department products and services.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Support the design and development of both custom and core product features.</li><li>Understand the business need &amp; gather requirements from clients.</li><li>Analyze requirements and prepare different use cases and user stories.</li><li>Develop one or more solution alternatives</li><li>Review of solution(s) with stakeholders.</li><li>Prepare Requirement &amp; Solution Document</li><li>Explain requirements to technical team</li><li>Assist in UAT.</li><li>Travel to work at client sites.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Skills Required:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>This person should have technical experience / Knowledge in API Mapping and Design.</li><li>Knowledge/experience with Confluence, JIRA, technical writing, diagramming, SQL, and XML.</li><li>Strong communication skills, must be able to communicate with technical and non-technical parties.</li><li>Ability to work independently as well as collaborate with others.</li><li>Strong project and time management skills.</li><li>Ability to analyze current systems/requirements and develop strategies for systems development.</li><li>Can assist in defining projects, effort and staff requirements.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Technical Skills:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience using Axure Pro/ MS Visio/ Pencil to prepare Wireframes.</li><li>Experience in preparing basic flow diagrams, swim-lane diagrams.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Basic Requirement:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Must have completed Masters Degree in Computer Science.</li><li>Experience in preparing basic flow diagrams, swim-lane diagrams</li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR<p><br></p>FDzrY01nSk

title: Full Stack Developer
description: Logistics Reply is a leader in logistics and supply chain technology. Part of the Reply Network, we provide cutting-edge software solutions that help companies achieve an efficient and more connected digital supply chain embracing the use of next-generation technologies such as AI, robotics, wearables and IoT.<p><br></p>Logistics Reply is looking for a motivated individual for our Application Maintenance Developer position. The ideal candidate will have experience in trouble shooting systems issues. They will demonstrate a passion for working with customers, and troubleshooting technical and software issues. This position is located at our office in Chicago, IL with hybrid work opportunities.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Monitor, check, inquire and configure Oracle based applications (proprietary solution), including monitoring on servers as well.</li><li>Interact with users resolving issues, gathering historical data and logs and providing role cause analysis when needed.</li><li>Set up and maintain accounts and profiles.</li><li>Support end users via phone, email or one on one consultation.</li><li>Troubleshoot applications, relational databases; web based applications and industrial processes.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor Management Information System, Operation and Systems Management, Computer Information Systems, or Computer Engineering</li><li>1 to 4 years’ experience in application maintenance and software life cycle.</li><li>Experience with monitoring and configuring Oracle based applications.</li><li>Experienced with Oracle, PL/SQL and SQL.</li><li>Ability to manage the relationships with customer with a high level of customer service</li><li>Demonstrate excellent Reverse Engineering Skills.</li><li>Experience in working within a ticketing system to ensure timely resolutions of end user issues.</li><li>Some level of experience on web-based applications, local and distributed infrastructures.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience in Logistics or Supply Chain domain.</li><li>Flexible to work on-call schedules (rare, but sometimes need coverage on evenings/nights)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>About Reply</strong><p><br></p>Reply specializes in the design and implementation of solutions based on new communication channels and digital media. Reply is a network of highly specialized companies supporting global industrial groups operating in the telecom and media, industry and services, banking, insurance and public administration sectors in the definition and development of business models enabled for the new paradigms of AI, cloud computing, digital media and the Internet of Things. Reply services include Consulting, System Integration and Digital Services.<p><br></p><strong>Reply is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to provide equal opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran you need assistance and reasonable accommodation due to a disability during the application or the recruiting process, email us at </strong> . <strong> Visit our website at to learn more about our open roles.</strong>

title: Requirements Engineer
description: <strong>Entry Level Business Analyst </strong><p><br></p>One of our highly respected client is currently seeking a highly motivated and qualified Business Analyst to join a dynamic team responsible for ensuring the quality of important and highly visible projects. Helps implement customer-centric solutions (web, mobile and call center applications) in a cost-effective way by learning and comprehending business process, eliciting and documenting requirements, and communicating clearly to business and technology. This role requires a level of energy and assertiveness to drive work with multiple groups in a complex, busy environment. The successful candidate will possess experience with full life-cycle application development along with exposure to evaluating, coordinating and creating deliverables; meeting with customers and resolving issues. The role works across functional boundaries to connect-the-dots between IT department products and services.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Develop comprehensive E2E test cases at the application and multi-application levels</li><li>Create direct channels of communication to software and application developers that get the job done without managerial interjection</li><li>Identify business trends utilizing real data, compile analysis reports that are delivered to developers and then follow-up on all results</li><li>Implement a comprehensive management plan for each project and hold regular stakeholder meetings to keep all interested parties updated in project progress</li><li>Determine and document user requirements for business processes and abide by those requirements for future projects</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications &amp; Skills</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Master’s degree in Computer Science/ Information Technology (2017 or 2018)</li><li>SQL database management and maintenance skills</li><li>Practical application ability with Microsoft Office and Visio</li><li>Detailed analytical abilities</li><li>Strong experience in user testing and project management</li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR<p><br></p>nhPazorsth

title: Golang System Software Engineer - Containers / Virtualisation
description: Experience Level: Entry-Level<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong>:<p><br></p><ul><li>Interface directly with business users to gather, track, and prioritize business requirements, and translate them into technical system requirements for development team</li><li>Analyze and make improvement recommendations to business processes and application features to resolve defects and/or enhance business capabilities</li><li>Evaluate key interfaces and interdependencies of core application components and systems.</li><li>Provide timely and effective communication regarding work status to appropriate stakeholders.</li><li>Escalate issues and propose solutions where appropriate.</li><li>Contribute to team-best practice and process improvements</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Master’s Degree preferred in Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics(Required)</li><li>0-2 years of work experience in the functional area of business analysis/systems analysis</li><li>High degree of initiative, ability to learn, understand and identify solutions</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to adjust communication approach &amp; style to accommodate a variety of technical and non-technical audiences</li><li>Knowledge of and/or experience in requirements gathering and development</li><li>Experience with systems analysis and functional design</li><li>Experience with documentation and problem resolution</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Knowledge of databases and ability to write queries in SQL</li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR<p><br></p>xO4By2xsI7

title: Business Analyst
description: This role is an opportunity for a hands-on, but literally hands-off, technologist with a passion for Linux to build a career with Canonical and drive the success with those leveraging Ubuntu and open source products. If you have experience of IT operations automation, Infrastructure as Code and a passion for technology, then you will enjoy working with some of the best people in the industry at Canonical.<p><br></p><strong>Job Summary</strong><p><br></p>The IS team at Canonical supports and maintains all of Canonical's IT production services. The team is in charge of running services used by over 60 million Ubuntu users.<p><br></p>As an SRE &amp; Gitops engineer you'll be in a unique position to drive operations automation to the next level, both in our own private clouds as well as in the public clouds. We do this by utilizing the best of open source infrastructure as code software, software development practices such as CI/CD pipelines, and Canonical's leading products for software operation automation.<p><br></p>In addition to defining the infrastructure as code, you will improve Canonical products and the open-source technologies they're based on by providing critical feedback to developers on how their products operate at scale. This is done by submitting bugs (and sometimes writing pull requests) and collaborating on design and implementations with other teams within the company.<p><br></p>You'll be part of a global team of SREs that work together and support each other to provide the best possible services to our company, Canonical's customers and the Ubuntu Community.<p><br></p>As a Site Reliability / Gitops Engineer engineer you will<p><br></p><ul><li>Apply your experience of IaC to develop infrastructure as code practice within IS by constantly increasing automation and improving IaC processes</li><li>Automate software operations for re-usability and consistency across private and public clouds, taking into consideration the complexities of distributed systems</li><li>Develop new features and improve the resilience and scalability of the existing cloud and container portfolio at Canonical</li><li>Maintain operational responsibility for all of Canonical's core services, networks, and infrastructure</li><li>Develop skills in troubleshooting, capacity planning, and performance investigation, Setting up, maintaining and using observability tools such as Prometheus, Grafana, and Elasticsearch; design, implement and maintain monitoring and alerting for various systems and services</li><li>Collaborate with development teams to design service architecture, documentation, playbooks, policies and operational procedures</li><li>Provide assistance and work with globally distributed engineering, operations, and support peers</li><li>Be given uninterrupted development time to focus on larger projects and automation of manual tasks</li><li>Share your experience, know-how and best practices with other team members in design sessions, mentorship and 'doing work together'</li><li>Carry final responsibility for time-critical escalations</li></ul><p><br></p>What we are looking for in you<p><br></p><ul><li>A deep experience of, and knowledge to define operations in code, using version control, peer review and CI/CD to roll out changes both to applications and infrastructure</li><li>Strong modern engineering background (peer-review, unit testing, SCM, CI/CD, Agile)</li><li>Python software development experience, with large projects</li><li>Practical knowledge of Linux networking, routing, and firewalls</li><li>Affinity with various forms of Linux storage, from Ceph to Databases</li><li>Hands-on experience administering enterprise Linux servers</li><li>Extensive knowledge of cloud computing concepts and technologies</li><li>Bachelor's degree or greater, preferably in computer science or related engineering field</li><li>Able to communicate clearly and effectively in English over email, chat, video or voice calls and in-person</li><li>Motivated and able to troubleshoot from kernel to web, and willing to ask others when appropriate</li><li>A willingness to be flexible and able to learn new things quickly</li><li>Be inspired by the needs of fast-changing environments</li><li>Happy to work within distributed teams</li><li>Be passionate and familiarized about open-source, especially Ubuntu or Debian</li></ul><p><br></p>What we offer you<p><br></p>Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilization. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.<p><br></p>In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.<p><br></p><ul><li>Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!</li><li>Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum</li><li>Annual compensation review</li><li>Recognition rewards</li><li>Annual holiday leave</li><li>Parental Leave</li><li>Employee Assistance Programme</li><li>Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'</li><li>Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>About Canonical</strong><p><br></p>Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.<p><br></p>Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.<p><br></p>Canonical is an equal opportunity employer<p><br></p>We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.<p><br></p>

together'</li><li>Carry final responsibility for time-critical escalations</li></ul><p><br></p>What we are looking for in you<p><br></p><ul><li>A deep experience of, and knowledge to define operations in code, using version control, peer review and CI/CD to roll out changes both to applications and infrastructure</li><li>Strong modern engineering background (peer-review, unit testing, SCM, CI/CD, Agile)</li><li>Python software development experience, with large projects</li><li>Practical knowledge of Linux networking, routing, and firewalls</li><li>Affinity with various forms of Linux storage, from Ceph to Databases</li><li>Hands-on experience administering enterprise Linux servers</li><li>Extensive knowledge of cloud computing concepts and technologies</li><li>Bachelor's degree or greater, preferably in computer science or related engineering field</li><li>Able to communicate clearly and effectively in English over email, chat, video or voice calls and in-person</li><li>Motivated and able to troubleshoot from kernel to web, and willing to ask others when appropriate</li><li>A willingness to be flexible and able to learn new things quickly</li><li>Be inspired by the needs of fast-changing environments</li><li>Happy to work within distributed teams</li><li>Be passionate and familiarized about open-source, especially Ubuntu or Debian</li></ul><p><br></p>What we offer you<p><br></p>Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilization. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.<p><br></p>In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.<p><br></p><ul><li>Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!</li><li>Personal learning and development budget of 2,000USD per annum</li><li>Annual compensation review</li><li>Recognition rewards</li><li>Annual holiday leave</li><li>Parental Leave</li><li>Employee Assistance Programme</li><li>Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'</li><li>Priority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>About Canonical</strong><p><br></p>Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.<p><br></p>Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.<p><br></p>Canonical is an equal opportunity employer<p><br></p>We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.<p><br></p>

title: Application Maintenance Developer
description: <strong>Job Summary:</strong><p><br></p>Looking for high powered and quantitatively oriented IT Business Analyst to support the Projects in IT Domain. Analyst will be required to analyze specific business problems and drive value in strategic areas of business.<p><br></p><strong>What you will get to do:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Typically the customers would be Senior Managers / Directors from different Domains located in US, Latin America, and Asia Pacific.</li><li>The analyst would typically handle a high impact project at any time which should result in bottom line impact.</li><li>Most of the work would be around business understanding, data understanding, guiding junior analysts in data preparation, working with the statistical team to create models if required and result presentation. </li><li>The analyst would be required to understand the business model, business brief, and the information available for analysis.</li><li>Adhoc requirements would need to be fulfilled from time to time as well.</li><li>High Level of Business analysis skills is necessary.</li><li>Graduate or Post Graduate from Tier 1 with 0-2 years of experience</li><li>Ideal candidate would have strong analytical skills, ability to understand business situations and provide data backed analysis.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Basic Requirement:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Graduate degree in Computer Science. </li><li>Must have completed Masters Degree in Computer Science.</li><li>Experience in preparing basic flow diagrams, swim-lane diagrams.</li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR<p><br></p>Oq1Rzvttif

description: <strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p>Established Financial Management firm seeks a Junior Business Analyst- Finance Specialist with little or no experience. In this role, you will be working in a technology team reporting to a senior business analyst, working on business analysis, quality assurance and specification design. This Junior Business Analyst-Finance Specialist will be involved with projects including Management Information Reporting, Client Reporting, and Internal Business processes. The initial focus will be on client and performance reports which will help you get familiar with the myriad business process and systems throughout the firm. This very visible opportunity gives you the chance to work in a small team with incredible exposure to the business. You will learn a great deal about Fixed Income while improving your technical skills.<p><br></p>Typical job duties for financial business analysts include evaluating financial reports, such as income statements, cash flow statements, and balance sheets, and determining how a company’s finances will impact business operations. They may also facilitate decision making by finance and operations personnel or investors by presenting data analysis and interpretation in clear, compelling ways.<p><br></p>Financial business analysts are often required to make recommendations for action by synthesizing financial information and trends. They may predict future business activity to assist product developers or sales teams. Some business analysts create tools or systems, including databases and spreadsheets, to improve financial data analysis and reporting.<p><br></p>Other responsibilities can include keeping financial data secure and documenting activity and procedures for future reference. Financial Business analysts help others understand how new laws, regulations, and developments will impact businesses in the finance and banking sector.<p><br></p><strong>Duties &amp; Key Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p>Management Accounts Preparation<p><br></p>Assist the Sr. Business Analyst with the planning and budgeting process.<p><br></p>Provide financial information service to management<p><br></p>Produce reports for the Head of Finance and Business Analyst.<p><br></p>Produce reports for Finance Committee and Executive Group.<p><br></p>Investigate possible cost saving areas.<p><br></p> <strong>General Attributes</strong> <p><br></p><ul><li>Able to manage change and risk.</li><li>Excellent communication skills and the ability to communicate</li><li>financial issues with non-finance professionals and volunteers.</li><li>Problem-solving ability.</li><li>Strong team player.</li><li>Excellent interpersonal skills.</li><li>Good planning and organizational skills.</li><li>Prioritise workload and meet strict deadlines</li></ul><p><br></p> <strong>Education Qualification</strong> <p><br></p><ul><li>Masters' from a reputed University (Preferred).</li><li>Bachelor's is Mandatory.</li><li>Excellent Written and verbal communication skills</li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR<p><br></p>yyR3emlEXd

title: Junior Business Analyst
description: <strong>Job Summary:<br><br></strong>This role performs and implements activities that impacts components / processes of specified functional areas of the Walgreens business software products OR Digital/Online application in an Agile environment. Work is typically received in short-term assignments that often require the application of independent judgment. Operates within the context of defined procedures that provide desired functionality to digital solutions, products and programs, typically for intermediary, basic to complex systems. Implements activities that influence entry to mid-level components of the functional area<br><br><strong>Job Responsibilities:<br></strong><ul><li>Writes code that meets specifications. Develops software applications and tools. </li><li>Completes programming and performs testing and debugging applications</li><li>Develops software applications and tools using Agile development methodologies. </li><li>Participates actively in the design, architecture and build phases, to aim at producing high quality deliverables, working with existing architects where appropriate. </li><li>Participates in the evaluation of compatibility of programs with existing communications hardware and software features. Develops professional expertise, applies company policies and procedures to resolve a variety of issues. </li><li>Works on problems of moderate scope where analysis of situations or data requires a review of a variety of factors. Exercises judgment within defined procedures and practices to determine appropriate action. </li><li>Builds productive internal/external working relationships. </li><li>Receives general instructions on routine work, detailed instructions on new projects or assignments. Usually works with some supervision, conferring with superiors on unusual or complex matters</li><li>Demonstrates proficiency in several areas of the professional function. </li><li>Has working knowledge of programming languages important to the organization</li><li>Effectively resolves problems and roadblocks as they occur. Has working knowledge of programming languages important to the organization. </li><li>Interacts with internal and external peers and/or managers to exchange semi-complex information related to assigned activities. </li><li>Acts as individual contributor as well as team member</li><li>Utilizes experience in order to identify problematic relationships. </li><li>Anticipates, prevents and eliminates problems and creates efficient fixes. </li><li>Gathers and updates necessary information and communicates to appropriate parties. </li></ul><strong>About Walgreens and WBA<br><br></strong>Walgreens (www.walgreens.com) is included in the U.S. Retail Pharmacy and U.S. Healthcare segments of Walgreens Boots Alliance, Inc. (Nasdaq: WBA), an integrated healthcare, pharmacy and retail leader with a 170 year heritage of caring for communities. WBA’s purpose is to create more joyful lives through better health. Operating nearly 9,000 retail locations across America, Puerto Rico and the U.S. Virgin Islands, Walgreens is proud to be a neighborhood health destination serving nearly 10 million customers each day. Walgreens pharmacists play a critical role in the U.S. healthcare system by providing a wide range of pharmacy and healthcare services, including those that drive equitable access to care for the nation’s medically underserved populations. To best meet the needs of customers and patients, Walgreens offers a true omnichannel experience, with fully integrated physical and digital platforms supported by the latest technology to deliver high quality products and services in communities nationwide.<br><br><strong>Basic Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s Degree and at least 2 years of Engineering, Software Engineering or similar field experience OR High School/ GED and at least 4 years of Engineering, Software Engineering or similar field experience</li><li>Experience writing code for applications or automation</li><li>Experience with programming languages for online applications, microservices, APIs or mobile applications</li><li>Experience building, testing applications or automation</li><li>Knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle</li><li>Experience creating coding solutions to fix moderate problems/issues</li><li>Willing to travel up to 5% of the time for business purposes (domestically and/or internationally). <br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong> <ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology or similar field</li><li> Experience working in an Agile environment</li><ul><li>At least 2 years of progressively complex related experience. </li></ul><li>Experience identifying operational issues and recommending and implementing strategies to resolve problems</li><li>DevOps</li><li>2+ years of on experience is Deployment automation for various applications IaaS, PaaS platforms</li><li>2+ years of hands-on experience in automation software like Chef, Puppet, Ansible, Terraform or equivalent</li><li>Good knowledge of GIT workflows and Repo management</li><li>Excellent knowledge in implement of CI/CD pipelines for Cloud deployments using containers/Docker</li><li>Working knowledge of Kubernetes and microservices architecture and other DevOps tooling and Linux environments</li><li>Working knowledge or experience of software development for Web and Mobile applications in agile environments</li><li>Web/backend Developer</li><li>Previous experience with full stack development ranging from front-end user interfaces to back-end systems</li><li>Proficient in back-end languages like Java, Node/Typescript, .NET, Python etc. with exposure to performance optimization of high traffic &amp; scalable services</li><li>Hands on with modern UI frameworks like React with good knowledge of front-end design pattern (stateless components, conditional rendering, controlled components, hooks etc.)</li><li>Excellent knowledge of distributed SQL (e.g., Oracle, MySQL), NoSQL (MongoDB, Cassandra) design &amp; consumption patterns</li><li>Have an exposure to implementation, capacity planning &amp; performance tuning of Cloud technologies – Azure (ACS, AKS), Google, IBM, AWS or Cloud Foundry</li><li>Knowledge of software engineering best practices including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build process, testing &amp; operations</li><li>Mobile Developer</li><li>2 years of Mobile App development experience and hands on skills in Swift, SwiftUI, Objective C ( iOS)</li><li>2 Years of Mobile App development experience and hands-on skills in Kotlin ( Android)</li><li>Experience in building client applications consuming JSON based on APIs</li><li>Knowledge of software engineering best practices including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build process, testing &amp; operations</li><li>Software Engineer in Test</li><li>3+ years of experience as an SDET, Developer, or strong Automation Engineer</li><li>Experience developing automation in at least one OO language - Java, C#/C++, Python or web based technologies</li><li>Proven experience creating automation frameworks and tools to support test automation</li><li>Experience working in a Microservices based architecture in a cloud native environment</li><li>Data &amp; Analytics</li><li>2 years of experience in integrating, transforming and consolidating data from various structured and unstructured data systems for building analytics solutions in any cloud Platforms: Microsoft Azure, AWS or GCP</li><li>Experience with relational and NoSQL databases such as Cosmos, Cassandra</li><li>2 years of Experience in SQL, Java or Python programming</li><li>Experience in Data Pipeline and integration workflow management tools: Talend, Store Proc, Change Data Capture (CDC), Spark &amp; Azure API</li><li>Experience identifying operational issues and recommending fixes to resolve problems</li><li>Knowledge in Azure cloud technologies like Data Flow, Data Bricks, Azure Synapse, Power BI Analytics</li><li>Experience in any of reporting tools like Power BI, Business objects, Cognos or Tableau</li></ul>

title: Junior Business Analyst
description: <strong>Entry Level - Business Analyst</strong> <p><br></p>BA acts as the conduit between the business customer, and the delivery team. They will identify, interpret, and define business need and features; translate them into requirements; and lead the process to visualize, document, and communicate functional product solutions used to design, build, and test the system. Prioritise workload and meet strict deadlines.</li><li>MS office.</li></ul><p><br></p> <strong>Minimum Qualification</strong> <p><br></p><ul><li>0-1 years experience in a BA/IT role.</li><li>Basic understanding of IT and technology terminology is a plus.</li><li>SQL knowledge is a plus.</li><li>MS office.</li><li>Masters' from a reputed University (Required).</li><li>Bachelor's is Mandatory.</li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR<p><br></p>4uIF8ApYgn

title: Business Analyst - Entry Level
description: <strong>Role: Junior Business Analyst</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Summary</strong><p><br></p>One of our highly respected client is currently seeking a highly motivated and qualified Business Analyst to join a dynamic team responsible for ensuring the quality of important and highly visible projects. Helps implement customer-centric solutions (web, mobile and call center applications) in a cost-effective way by learning and comprehending business process, eliciting and documenting requirements, and communicating clearly to business and technology. This role requires a level of energy and assertiveness to drive work with multiple groups in a complex, busy environment. The successful candidate will possess experience with full life-cycle application development along with exposure to evaluating, coordinating and creating deliverables; meeting with customers and resolving issues. The role works across functional boundaries to connect-the-dots between IT department products and services.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Support the design and development of both custom and core product features.</li><li>Understand the business need &amp; gather requirements from clients.</li><li>Analyze requirements and prepare different use cases and user stories.</li><li>Develop one or more solution alternatives</li><li>Review of solution(s) with stakeholders.</li><li>Prepare Requirement &amp; Solution Document</li><li>Explain requirements to technical team</li><li>Assist in UAT.</li><li>Travel to work at client sites.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Skills Required:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>This person should have technical experience / Knowledge in API Mapping and Design.</li><li>Knowledge/experience with Confluence, JIRA, technical writing, diagramming, SQL, and XML.</li><li>Strong communication skills, must be able to communicate with technical and non-technical parties.</li><li>Ability to work independently as well as collaborate with others.</li><li>Strong project and time management skills.</li><li>Ability to analyze current systems/requirements and develop strategies for systems development.</li><li>Can assist in defining projects, effort and staff requirements.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Technical Skills:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience using Axure Pro/ MS Visio/ Pencil to prepare Wireframes.</li><li>Experience in preparing basic flow diagrams, swim-lane diagrams.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Basic Requirement:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Must have completed Masters Degree in Computer Science.</li><li>Experience in preparing basic flow diagrams, swim-lane diagrams</li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR<p><br></p>xtfwRYSutn

title: Entry level Business Analyst
description: Harris Associates is committed to bringing together individuals whose diverse backgrounds, opinions and perspectives maximize our expertise in finding value and delivering an excellent client experience.<br><br><strong>The Position<br><br></strong>This role is within the Operations Technology team. Our mission is to empower our investment professionals to achieve greater success by leveraging Technology &amp; Data to enhance all facets of our decision-making.<br><br>We seek creative software engineers with strong analytical &amp; collaborative skills to join our team of highly qualified technology professionals to work towards our shared vision of unlocking the alpha in technology. Intellectual curiosity with a keen interest in investing &amp; asset management are essential for a rewarding career and long-term success at the firm.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li>Work with the team to design, develop &amp; support software, and vendor integrations on our systems.</li><li>Collaborate with the team on software development lifecycle to develop, test &amp; deploy applications</li><li>Develop business expertise in supported areas, related technology, data domains and vendor platforms.</li><li>Partner with stakeholders on efforts to modernize and transform our platforms to leverage cloud-native solutions to democratize technology &amp; data across the enterprise.</li><li>As part of support escalations, triage &amp; solve production incidents and participate in support activities for critical issues during business hours and when necessary, weeknights or weekends.<br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications<br><br></strong><u>Required<br></u><ul><li>At least 5 years’ work experience in the asset management industry with specific knowledge of Investment Accounting and Order Management</li><li>Expertise with the .NET framework, C#, SQL Server, database, and application design &amp; development</li><li>Experience building applications and integrations using Azure platforms &amp; services</li><li>Experience with API design, messaging / event-driven architecture &amp; modern test frameworks</li><li>Strong collaborative, communication, and problem-solving skills</li><li>4-year degree in a STEM discipline or equivalent professional experience<br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred<br></strong><ul><li>Experience with Eagle and Charles River Investment Systems</li><li>Expertise in development and orchestration of Azure data pipelines</li><li>Familiarity with trade life cycle, security data management, and other middle office processes<br><br></li></ul><strong>Equal Employment Opportunity Policy Statement<br><br></strong>Harris Associates L.P. pursues a policy of equal opportunity in all areas of employment including recruitment, hiring, training, compensation, benefits, advancement, and treatment on the job. This means that Harris does not discriminate against employees, or qualified applicants, based on an individual's race, color, religion, creed, sex, age, national origin, physical disability, sexual orientation, trans-gender status, transsexual status, status as a veteran or disabled veteran, genetic information or for any other reason prohibited by law. Harris reserves the right to review publicly available information about applicants (i.e., via social networking sites), to the extent permissible under applicable law.<br><br><strong>Reasonable Accommodation Notice<br><br></strong>We provide reasonable accommodation for individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in job application procedures. If you have any difficulty using our online system and you need an accommodation due to a disability, you may use the alternative email address below to contact us about your interest in employment at HR@harrisassoc.com or you can call us at 312-646-3600.<br><br><strong>Privacy Statement<br><br></strong>The information you send to us is used for employment purposes only. What you send is kept confidential—we will not give your personal information to outside parties without your consent.

description: <ul><li>Company with sports and technology at its core - with mobile and web apps|Opportunity with company exponentially accelerating revenue and overall growth<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>About Our Client<br><br></strong>My client is a industry leader in the youth sports space. The leadership within the company is constantly finding new ways to adapt to market changes and opportunities in the sports market for youth athletes and thier families. In order to do so, they are in need of smart, self-sufficient, and accountable Sr. software engineers excelling in problem-solving. My client is planning on staying agile and flexible in regards to strategies and best practices. Staying up to date on current trends as well as paving the way to new ones will be essential in this role.<br><br><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong><ul><li>Autonomy on project implementation</li><li>Gamifying marketing strategies for clients</li><li>Efficient in coding review</li><li>Reporting directly to owners</li><li>Agile work-flow </li><li>Collaborating with onshore and offshore teams<br><br></li></ul>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.<br><br><strong>The Successful Applicant<br><br></strong><ul><li>Full stack coding experience in C# and .NET frameworks (10-15 years).</li><li>Good communication skills.</li><li>Loves building things and working in a team.</li><li>Eager to move into a lead role with rapid expected company growth.</li><li>Comfortable working in a remote role.</li><li>Dependable individual who can take initiative on cleaning up and expanding projects.</li></ul><strong>What's on Offer<br></strong><ul><li>Salary up to $200k based on experience and interviews</li><li>Expected company growth</li><li>Growth in individual role in short and long-term</li><li>Innovative projects</li><li>Reporting directly to CTO</li><li>Autonomy on projects</li><li>Great culture focused on building a self-driven team</li><li>Full medical, dental, vision</li><li>Generous PTO</li><li>Strong employee benefits and perks<br></li></ul><strong>Contact: Sean Stanton<br><br></strong><strong>Quote job ref: JN-062023-6093085</strong>

title: Software Engineer - App Stores Backend (Remote)
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>As a <strong>Senior Associate Application Engineer (Full Stack),</strong> you<strong>’</strong>ll build and release reliable software systems at scale. By partnering with enterprise-wide) teams, you’ll develop and maintain full stack solutions that fit our business needs. You’ll use your holistic view of all products (and their interactions) to design elegant solutions and strategize the future state of our larger technical ecosystem. By independently innovating and advocating for best practices, you’ll solve complex problems and guide the team on implementing solutions from inception to production.<p><br></p>In this specific role, you will be part of a product team responsible for the technical development in the Bank Collections department. Each product team is responsible for new business features as well as a strong focus on application modernization and building out the CI/CD pipeline for the Discover bank collections platform (E-ICE).<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Completes most features and user stories including test cases and automation unattended</li><li>Learns more complex software engineering practices such as domain driven design, test driven development, operations, and security</li><li>Contributes to agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms, and participates in technology communities</li><li>Participates in system design decisions and learns how these decisions impact the product as a whole</li><li>Learns to support production systems and understands how observed events and failures impact the product</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related</li><li>1+ Years – Information Technology, (Software) Engineering, or related</li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of advanced beginner on the Dreyfus engineering scale</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><ul><li>Either hands on experience or ability to quickly learn and adapt to our tech stack</li><ul><li>Java/JavaScript programming</li><li>Eclipse RCP or Java Swing</li><li>Cloud Technology – AWS, Pivotal Cloud Foundry, OpenShift</li><li>Extreme automation mindset as it pertains to testing and build/deploy concepts</li><li>CI/CD Pipeline experience via Jenkins, Github Actions, Chef, Ansible, Nexus</li></ul><li>Knowledge of the banking industry a plus</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $70,000.00 to $118,400.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)<p><br></p>

title: Junior Business Analyst
description: <strong>About the Role:</strong><p><br></p>We are looking for Business Analysts who would assist our clients in applying our software applications to their organization. Come be a part of a very talented and innovated team and help ensure that the system output supports the clients’ operations and serves to manage their operating margins by applying your systems skill sets.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>While working under close supervision and direction, gather and organize information on business requirements, problems and procedures.</li><li>Create and maintain software development artifacts not limited to BRD’s, FRD’s, Data Dictionaries.</li><li>Document findings of study and prepare recommendations for implementation of new systems, procedures, or organizational changes.</li><li>Assist in the development, integration and definition of Systems Process procedures and roadmaps. Review documentation and analyze data gathered to develop solutions or alternative methods of proceeding.</li><li>Subject to review and approval by a supervisor, provide content knowledge for ongoing process development, and sustain user base support. Assist with interviewing personnel and conduct on-site observation to ascertain unit functions, work performed, and methods, equipment, and personnel used.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Master’s Degree</li><li>Strong Communication &amp; Technical skills</li><li>Data Analysis: MS Excel, SQL querying.</li><li>Responsible, dependable, quick learner</li><li>Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technology</li><li>Preferred willingness to relocate nationwide in the US for projects</li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR<p><br></p>WS2tLTMN8Y

title: Business Analyst
description: <strong>Dunn Solutions Group, Inc. seeks a Java Developer / Data Engineer</strong><p><br></p>Dunn Solutions Group is a digital transformation consultancy focusing on E-Commerce, Analytics and Marketing Automation. We are looking for a strong Java Developer / Data Engineer to design and supervise the implementation of scalable and reliable data pipelines leveraging cloud platforms and technologies. This role can be based in the Greater Chicago area or the Greater Minneapolis area with a hybrid working environment.<p><br></p>The ideal candidate has experience working with data sources that include: <strong>RESTful APIs</strong>, files, on-premise and cloud databases and <strong>SaaS platforms</strong>. A strong knowledge of development languages like <strong>Java, JavaScript and/or Python</strong> is important. Projects include development of data lakes and data warehouses from start to finish. The ideal candidate will have strong skills in the design and implementation of ELT and ETL pipelines, that are fault tolerant and dependable.<p><br></p>The following skills and knowledge are required:<p><br></p><ul><li>Proficiency in data modeling techniques, understanding of database design principles, and experience with relational and/or NoSQL databases.</li><li>Strong understanding of REST API interfaces and ODATA</li><li>Proficiency in programming languages commonly used in data engineering, such as Python or JavaScript</li><li>Strong knowledge of SQL for data querying, manipulation, and optimization.</li><li>Proficiency in building and managing data pipelines, including data ingestion, transformation, validation, and scheduling</li><li>Strong understanding of Azure services including: Azure SQL Database, or Azure Synapse Analytics (formerly SQL Data Warehouse), Data Factory, Databricks, Azure Data Lake and Purview.</li><li>Knowledge of AWS services including: Redshift, Athena, Kinesis, Glue and Glue DataBrew.</li><li>Knowledge of data integration techniques, tools, and patterns to combine data from multiple sources and systems.</li><li>Understanding of data quality principles and practices, as well as data governance frameworks to ensure data integrity, consistency, and compliance.</li><li>Strong teamwork and communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams, stakeholders, and data consumers effectively.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>B.S. In Computer Science Required</strong><p><br></p>3+ years of relevant experience<p><br></p>For more information about Dunn Solutions Group, please visit our website at ;/p&gt;<p><br></p>This position is a Full-Time permanent salaried with benefits (medical, dental, 401(k), long term disability, paid vacation, PTO, and holiday pay).<p><br></p>This is a hybrid role. Applicants must reside in Chicago or Minneapolis area and willing to commute to either of our offices at least twice a week.<p><br></p>If you meet these requirements and are interested in working in a dynamic environment with the best people, please sent a copy of your resume to:<p><br></p>**No agencies or phone calls please. Only qualified candidates will be contacted.**

title: Software Engineer - Investment Ops Technology
description: <ul><li>Vast growth opportunities, long retention, up to 20% bonuses|Work/Life balance with flexible working and extensive PTO<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>About Our Client<br><br></strong>My client is a industry leader in the customer loyalty space. The leadership within the company is constantly finding new ways to adapt to market changes and opportunities in the sports market for youth athletes and thier families. In order to do so, they are in need of smart, self-sufficient, and accountable software engineers excelling in problem-solving. My client is planning on staying agile and flexible in regards to strategies and best practices. Staying up to date on current trends as well as paving the way to new ones will be essential in this role.<br><br><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong><ul><li>Autonomy on project implementation</li><li>Gamifying marketing strategies for clients</li><li>Efficient in coding review</li><li>Reporting directly to owners</li><li>Agile work-flow </li><li>Collaborating with leadership onshore and offshore<br><br></li></ul>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.<br><br><strong>The Successful Applicant<br><br></strong><ul><li>Full stack coding experience in C# and .NET frameworks (5-7 years).</li><li>Good communication skill.</li><li>Loves building things and working in a team.</li><li>Eager to move into a lead role with rapid expected company growth.</li><li>Comfortable working in a remote role.</li><li>Dependable individual who can take initiative on cleaning up and expanding projects.</li></ul><strong>What's on Offer<br></strong><ul><li>Salary based on experience and interviews</li><li>Expected company growth</li><li>Growth in individual role in short and long-term</li><li>Innovative projects</li><li>Reporting directly to CTO</li><li>Autonomy on projects</li><li>Great culture focused on building a self-driven team</li><li>Full medical, dental, vision</li><li>Generous PTO</li><li>Strong employee benefits and perks<br></li></ul><strong>Contact: Sean Stanton<br><br></strong><strong>Quote job ref: JN-062023-6093367</strong>
industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Software Development, and Computer and Network Security

description: <strong>Job Description</strong><p><br></p>The Business Analyst is responsible for the set of tasks and techniques used to understand the structure, policies, and operations of the organization, and to recommend automated solutions that enable the organization to achieve its goals. title: Business Analyst
description: <strong>Job Summary</strong><p><br></p>One of our highly respected client is currently seeking a highly motivated and qualified Business Analyst to join a dynamic team responsible for ensuring the quality of important and highly visible projects. The primary function of the Junior Business Analyst will be to executive all phases of the business analyst life cycle consisting of but not limited to: requirements gathering, design, implementation, documentation and end user support. A successful candidate will be driven and will make certain that project deliverables meet client specifications, are delivered on time and are of high quality.<p><br></p><strong>Key responsibilities may include:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Identifying business/functional requirements by working with key client personnel or end-users</li><li>Evaluating software applications/IT environments, analyzing gaps between current/desired states</li><li>Designing and executing use &amp; test cases for custom application development projects</li><li>Discovering and documenting business and IT processes, workflows and requirements</li><li>Assisting the sales/ client-facing teams with activities for on-boarding clients</li><li>Interfacing with other functional and technical groups within the organization</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Skills</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Strong knowledge in the area of requirements definition and software development lifecycle methodology</li><li>Significant experience with Word, Excel, MS Project, PowerPoint and Visio</li><li>Basic project management experience</li><li>Strong writing, problem solving, communication and client-facing skills</li><li>Able to utilize a business analysis strategic roadmap and project archetypes for guiding the organization towards increased business agility and reduced IT rework.</li><li>Proven techniques for defining and/or improving requirements</li><li>With proven techniques for collaborating to define requirements and specifications with Business Architects and IT professionals</li></ul><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR<p><br></p>WqICYok7vQ
